overview = An overenthusiastic high-school maintenance man attempts to lead an unlikely group of misfits to the Nebraska state tennis championship in Balls Out: The Gary Houseman Story? director Danny Leiner's underdog sports comedy. American Pie star Seann William Scott stars as the ambitious janitor who believes he has what it takes to coach the winning team. 
duration of the movie = 1h27 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Robbie Ferguson 
revenue = 243.5 millions of dollars 
Director = Danny Leiner 
average note = 5.4 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h27 

In "Balls Out: The Gary Houseman Story," directed by Danny Leiner, an overenthusiastic high-school maintenance man, portrayed by Seann William Scott, takes on the challenge of coaching a group of misfits towards the Nebraska state tennis championship. With a runtime of 1 hour and 27 minutes, this underdog sports comedy follows Gary Houseman's ambitious journey to lead his team to victory. Produced by Robbie Ferguson, the film, originally in English, grossed an impressive $243.5 million at the box office. Despite receiving an average rating of 5.4, the movie showcases the determination and heart of a janitor turned coach in a hilarious and inspiring tale.

title = Burn After Reading 
overview = When a disc containing memoirs of a former CIA analyst falls into the hands of Linda Litzke and Chad Feldheimer, the two gym employees see a chance to make enough money for her to have life-changing cosmetic surgery. Predictably, events whirl out of control for the duo doofuses and those in their orbit. 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Joel Coen 
date of release = the 5 of September 2008 
tagline = Intelligence is relative. 
budget = 37.0 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h36 
Director = Joel Coen 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 6.5 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the 2008 film "Burn After Reading," directed by Joel Coen and produced by Joel Coen, a chaotic chain of events is set in motion when two gym employees, Linda Litzke and Chad Feldheimer, stumble upon a disc containing memoirs of a former CIA analyst. With the goal of funding life-changing cosmetic surgery for Linda, the duo embarks on a misguided journey to capitalize on their discovery. As the narrative unfolds, the characters find themselves entangled in a web of absurdity and misadventures, showcasing that intelligence is indeed relative. Set against the backdrop of the United States of America, this dark comedy with a budget of 37.0 million dollars offers a runtime of 1 hour and 36 minutes. With an average rating of 6.5, "Burn After Reading" presents a satirical take on ambition, espionage, and the unpredictable nature of human folly. The movie was released on the 5th of September 2008 and the tagline for the film is "Intelligence is relative." The original language of the movie is English.

title = Signs 
overview = A family living on a farm finds mysterious crop circles in their fields which suggests something more frightening to come. 
date of release = the 2 of August 2002 
revenue = 408.2 millions of dollars 
budget = 72.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Kennedy/Marshall Company, The 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 2 of August 2002 

In the suspenseful movie "Signs," released on the 2nd of August 2002, a family residing on a farm makes a chilling discovery of mysterious crop circles in their fields. As they grapple with the ominous signs, they come to realize that something far more terrifying may be looming on the horizon. Produced by the Kennedy/Marshall Company, this gripping tale captivated audiences worldwide, grossing an impressive $408.2 million against a budget of $72.0 million.

title = Bad Boys 
overview = Mick O'Brien is a young Chicago street thug torn between a life of petty crime and the love of his girlfriend. But when the heist of a local drug dealer goes tragically wrong Mick is sentenced to a brutal juvenile prison where violence is a rite of passage and respect is measured in vengeance. 
Producer = Marty Hornstein 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = There's Only One Person Left Who Believes Mick O'Brien Can Make It... Mick O'Brien. 
average note = 6.7 
date of release = the 25 of March 1983 
cast = Sean Penn, Reni Santoni, Jim Moody, Eric Gurry 
Director = Rick Rosenthal 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Marty Hornstein 

In the gritty crime drama "Bad Boys," Mick O'Brien, a young Chicago street thug, finds himself at a crossroads between a life of crime and his love for his girlfriend. After a botched heist involving a local drug dealer, Mick is sent to a brutal juvenile prison where violence reigns and respect is earned through vengeance. With a tagline reminding us that "There's Only One Person Left Who Believes Mick O'Brien Can Make It... Mick O'Brien," this intense film, produced by Marty Hornstein, takes viewers on a gripping journey through the harsh realities of the criminal underworld. Starring Sean Penn, Reni Santoni, Jim Moody, and Eric Gurry, and directed by Rick Rosenthal, "Bad Boys" captivates audiences with its raw portrayal of a young man's struggle for survival. Released on the 25th of March 1983 in the United States of America, this film has garnered an average rating of 6.7, making it a must-watch for fans of gritty crime thrillers.

overview = A young woman recuperating at her father's run-down home after a tragic accident soon encounters a terrifying presence with a connection to her long-deceased mother.

In the spine-chilling movie "Jessabelle," released on the 29th of August 2014, a young woman finds herself seeking solace at her father's dilapidated home following a tragic accident. However, her road to recovery takes a sinister turn when she comes face to face with a horrifying entity that seems to be linked to her deceased mother. As she unravels the mysteries surrounding her family's past, she must confront the terrifying presence that haunts her every move. Brace yourself for a tale of supernatural terror and unearthly connections in this gripping thriller.

title = The Three Burials of Melquiades Estrada 
overview = When brash Texas border officer Mike Norton (Barry Pepper) wrongfully kills and buries the friend and ranch hand of Pete Perkins (Tommy Lee Jones), the latter is reminded of a promise he made to bury his friend, Melquiades Estrada (Julio Cesar Cedillo), in his Mexican home town. He kidnaps Norton and exhumes Estrada's corpse, and the odd caravan sets out on horseback for Mexico. As Estrada's body begins to rot, Norton begins to unravel, but Perkins remains determined to honor his vow. 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 7.0 
tagline = Nobody is beyond redemption. 
Producer = Luc Besson 
duration of the movie = 2h01 
budget = 15.0 millions of dollars 
revenue = 12.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = The Javelina Film Company 
Director = Tommy Lee Jones 
cast = Tommy Lee Jones, Barry Pepper, Dwight Yoakam, January Jones 
date of release = the 17 of November 2005 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "The Three Burials of Melquiades Estrada," directed by Tommy Lee Jones, a brash Texas border officer, Mike Norton, played by Barry Pepper, makes a grave mistake by wrongfully killing and burying the friend of ranch hand Pete Perkins, portrayed by Tommy Lee Jones. Remembering a promise he made to his friend Melquiades Estrada, Pete kidnaps Norton and exhumes Estrada's corpse, embarking on a journey to fulfill his vow of burying him in his Mexican hometown. As they travel on horseback towards Mexico, with the decaying body of Estrada in tow, tensions rise and emotions unravel. The film, produced by Luc Besson, explores themes of redemption and loyalty, reminding viewers that "Nobody is beyond redemption." With a runtime of 2 hours and 1 minute, the movie was released on November 17, 2005, in the United States. Despite a budget of 15 million dollars, the film grossed 12 million dollars. The stellar cast includes Dwight Yoakam and January Jones, making this a compelling and poignant tale of friendship and honor. 

Facts included in the final description:
- Title: The Three Burials of Melquiades Estrada
- Overview of the movie
- Original language of the movie: English
- Average note: 7.0
- Tagline: Nobody is beyond redemption
- Producer: Luc Besson
- Duration of the movie: 2h01
- Budget: 15.0 million dollars
- Revenue: 12.0 million dollars
- Production country: United States of America
- Production company: The Javelina Film Company
- Director: Tommy Lee Jones
- Cast: Tommy Lee Jones, Barry Pepper, Dwight Yoakam, January Jones
- Date of release: the 17th of November 2005

title = The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby: Them 
overview = A New York couple's relationship is tested after the loss of their child. This film is the wide-released combination of the original two :him and :her volumes that premiered at the Cannes Film Festival. 
Director = Ned Benson 
revenue = 1.0 millions of dollars 
cast = Jessica Chastain, James McAvoy, Bill Hader, Viola Davis 
tagline = Two films. One love. 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h59 
production compagnie = Myriad Pictures 
date of release = the 14 of May 2014 
Producer = Cassandra Kulukundis 
average note = 6.2 
budget = 150.1 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Ned Benson 

In "The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby: Them," director Ned Benson explores the intricate dynamics of a New York couple whose relationship is profoundly impacted by the tragic loss of their child. Jessica Chastain and James McAvoy deliver powerful performances alongside a talented cast including Bill Hader and Viola Davis. The film, which premiered at the Cannes Film Festival, intricately weaves together the original two volumes, ":him" and ":her," into a wide-released version. With a poignant tagline of "Two films. One love.," this emotional journey unfolds in the United States of America, where the couple's story is brought to life by Myriad Pictures. Despite its modest revenue of 1.0 million dollars, the film resonated with audiences and critics alike, earning an average rating of 6.2. As the couple navigates their grief and struggles, viewers are taken on a 1 hour and 59-minute exploration of love, loss, and resilience. Released on the 14th of May 2014, "The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby: Them" remains a testament to the enduring power of love in the face of adversity. The film was produced by Cassandra Kulukundis with a budget of 150.1 million dollars. The original language of the movie is English.

In "The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby: Them," director Ned Benson explores the intricate dynamics of a New York couple whose relationship is profoundly impacted by the tragic loss of their child. Jessica Chastain and James McAvoy deliver powerful performances alongside a talented cast including Bill Hader and Viola Davis. The film, which premiered at the Cannes Film Festival, intricately weaves together the original two volumes, ":him" and ":her," into a wide-released version. With a poignant tagline of "Two films. One love.," this emotional journey unfolds in the United States of America, where the couple's story is brought to life by Myriad Pictures. Despite its modest revenue of 1.0 million dollars, the film resonated with audiences and critics alike, earning an average rating of 6.2. As the couple navigates their grief and struggles, viewers are taken on a 1 hour and 59-minute exploration of love, loss, and resilience. Released on the 14th of May 2014, "The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby: Them" remains a testament to the enduring power of love in the face of adversity. The film was produced by Cassandra Kulukundis with a budget of 150.1 million dollars. The original language of the movie is English.

title = Undertaking Betty 
overview = A politician's wife and the mortician who has secretly loved her for years plan to fake her death so they can run away together. 
Producer = Michael Cowan 
production countrie = Germany 
production compagnie = Spice Factory 
date of release = the 4 of October 2002 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Michael Cowan 

In the charming and quirky film "Undertaking Betty," produced by Michael Cowan and released on the 4th of October 2002, viewers are taken on a wild ride as a politician's wife and a mortician hatch a daring plan. The mortician, who has harbored a secret love for the politician's wife for years, proposes a scheme to fake her death so they can escape together. Set against the backdrop of Germany and brought to life by the production company Spice Factory, this romantic comedy is sure to keep audiences on the edge of their seats until the very end.

title = The Razor's Edge 
overview = A adventuresome young man goes off to find himself and loses his socialite fiancée in the process. But when he returns 10 years later, she will stop at nothing to get him back, even though she is already married. 
revenue = 162.1 millions of dollars

original language of the movie = English

In "The Razor's Edge," a young man embarks on a journey of self-discovery, leaving behind his socialite fiancée. Produced by Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation, this English-language film grossed an impressive $162.1 million at the box office.

title = The Natural 
overview = An unknown middle-aged batter named Roy Hobbs with a mysterious past appears out of nowhere to take a losing 1930s baseball team to the top of the league in this magical sports fantasy. With the aid of a bat cut from a lightning struck tree, Hobbs lives the fame he should have had earlier when, as a rising pitcher, he is inexplicably shot by a young woman. 
tagline = He lived for a dream that wouldn't die. 
Director = Barry Levinson 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Robert Redford, Glenn Close, Kim Basinger, Wilford Brimley 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 11 of May 1984 
duration of the movie = 2h17 
budget = 28.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = TriStar Pictures 
average note = 7.0 
revenue = 48.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = He lived for a dream that wouldn't die. 

In "The Natural," directed by Barry Levinson, an unknown middle-aged batter named Roy Hobbs emerges with a mysterious past to lead a struggling 1930s baseball team to victory in this enchanting sports fantasy. With the help of a bat crafted from a lightning-struck tree, Hobbs fulfills the destiny he was denied after a tragic incident involving a gunshot wound from a young woman during his pitching career. Starring Robert Redford, Glenn Close, Kim Basinger, and Wilford Brimley, this American film, released on the 11th of May 1984, captures the essence of living for a dream that refuses to fade away. TriStar Pictures produced this movie with a budget of 28.0 million dollars, which went on to generate a revenue of 48.0 million dollars. The film, with an average rating of 7.0, runs for a duration of 2 hours and 17 minutes, all in its original English language. The tagline for the movie is "He lived for a dream that wouldn't die." The production country for "The Natural" is the United States of America.

title = DeadHeads 
overview = Two inexplicably coherent zombies awake amidst a zombie attack and decide to take a road trip to find the one's lost love, unaware they are being chased by the agents of a ruthless company with it's own agenda. 
tagline = The dead will walk, talk and ride shotgun. 
date of release = the 29 of April 2011 
cast = Michael McKiddy, Ross Kidder, Markus Taylor, Thomas Galasso 
production compagnie = Splendid Film 
Producer = Brett Pierce 
duration of the movie = 1h34 
budget = 279.6 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = The dead will walk, talk and ride shotgun. 

In "DeadHeads," released on April 29, 2011, two surprisingly coherent zombies find themselves in the midst of a zombie apocalypse. Determined to embark on a road trip to locate one of the zombie's lost love, they remain oblivious to the fact that they are being pursued by the agents of a ruthless company with their own sinister agenda. As the dead walk, talk, and even ride shotgun, played by talented actors such as Michael McKiddy, Ross Kidder, Markus Taylor, and Thomas Galasso, the film, produced by Brett Pierce under Splendid Film, unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 34 minutes with a budget of a staggering $279.6 million. Get ready for a unique blend of romance, comedy, and horror in this unforgettable zombie adventure. Remember, the dead may be walking, but they're also talking and riding shotgun.

['correct']

Get ready for a unique blend of romance, comedy, and horror in this unforgettable zombie adventure. Remember, the dead may be walking, but they're also talking and riding shotgun.

title = Red Dust 
overview = Sarah Barcant, a lawyer in New York City who grew up in South Africa, returns to her childhood dwelling place to intercede for Alex Mpondo, a Black South African politician who was tortured during apartheid. 
cast = Chiwetel Ejiofor, Hilary Swank, Jamie Bartlett, Ian Roberts 
tagline = Nothing is more dangerous than the truth. 
revenue = 128.9 millions of dollars 
Director = Tom Hooper 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
production compagnie = BBC Films 
duration of the movie = 1h50 
date of release = the 1 of January 2004 
average note = 6.4 
Producer = Anant Singh 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Chiwetel Ejiofor, Hilary Swank, Jamie Bartlett, Ian Roberts 

In the gripping drama "Red Dust," directed by Tom Hooper, lawyer Sarah Barcant, portrayed by Hilary Swank, navigates the complexities of her South African roots as she fights for justice for Black politician Alex Mpondo, played by Chiwetel Ejiofor, who endured torture during apartheid. With a stellar cast including Jamie Bartlett and Ian Roberts, this BBC Films production delves into the dangerous power of truth. Released on January 1, 2004, the film garnered a revenue of 128.9 million dollars and an average rating of 6.4. As Sarah delves into her past and confronts the harsh realities of her homeland, she must confront the past to secure a future for those who have suffered.

The tagline of the movie is "Nothing is more dangerous than the truth." The production company behind "Red Dust" is BBC Films, and it was produced by Anant Singh. The movie has a duration of 1 hour and 50 minutes. The production country for the film is the United Kingdom. The full cast includes Chiwetel Ejiofor, Hilary Swank, Jamie Bartlett, and Ian Roberts.

title = The Legend of Boggy Creek 
overview = A documentary-style drama based on true accounts of the Fouke Monster in Arkansas. It focuses on the lives of back country people and their culture while detailing certain sightings of the monster. This title was a drive-in B movie favorite for it's time. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : Producer = Charles B. Pierce 

In "The Legend of Boggy Creek," viewers are taken on a thrilling journey through the mysterious and eerie world of the Fouke Monster in Arkansas. This documentary-style drama delves into the lives of back country people, offering a glimpse into their unique culture and traditions. As the narrative unfolds, the film meticulously recounts various sightings of the elusive monster, keeping audiences on the edge of their seats. A beloved drive-in B movie favorite of its time, this gripping tale blends elements of horror and reality, leaving a lasting impression on all who dare to explore the legend of Boggy Creek. The movie is based on true accounts of the Fouke Monster, adding a chilling layer of authenticity to the storytelling. 
 
 
TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "The Legend of Boggy Creek," viewers are taken on a thrilling journey through the mysterious and eerie world of the Fouke Monster in Arkansas. This documentary-style drama delves into the lives of back country people, offering a glimpse into their unique culture and traditions. As the narrative unfolds, the film meticulously recounts various sightings of the elusive monster, keeping audiences on the edge of their seats. A beloved drive-in B movie favorite of its time, this gripping tale blends elements of horror and reality, leaving a lasting impression on all who dare to explore the legend of Boggy Creek. The movie is based on true accounts of the Fouke Monster, adding a chilling layer of authenticity to the storytelling.

fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In "The Legend of Boggy Creek," viewers are taken on a thrilling journey through the mysterious and eerie world of the Fouke Monster in Arkansas. This documentary-style drama delves into the lives of back country people, offering a glimpse into their unique culture and traditions. As the narrative unfolds, the film meticulously recounts various sightings of the elusive monster, keeping audiences on the edge of their seats. A beloved drive-in B movie favorite of its time, this gripping tale blends elements of horror and reality, leaving a lasting impression on all who dare to explore the legend of Boggy Creek. The movie is based on true accounts of the Fouke Monster, adding a chilling layer of authenticity to the storytelling.

['wrong']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h30 

In "The Legend of Boggy Creek," viewers are taken on a thrilling journey through the mysterious and eerie world of the Fouke Monster in Arkansas. This documentary-style drama delves into the lives of back country people, offering a glimpse into their unique culture and traditions. As the narrative unfolds, the film meticulously recounts various sightings of the elusive monster, keeping audiences on the edge of their seats. A beloved drive-in B movie favorite of its time, this gripping tale blends elements of horror and reality, leaving a lasting impression on all who dare to explore the legend of Boggy Creek. The movie is based on true accounts of the Fouke Monster, adding a chilling layer of authenticity to the storytelling. 
 
 

 
title = Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers 
overview = Six years ago, Michael Myers terrorized the town of Haddonfield, Illinois. He and his niece, Jamie Lloyd, have disappeared. Jamie was kidnapped by a bunch of evil druids who protect Michael Myers. And now, six years later, Jamie has escaped after giving birth to Michael's child. She runs to Haddonfield to get Dr. Loomis to help her again. 
tagline = Haddonfield is ready to celebrate Halloween.... so is Michael Myers! 
date of release = the 29 of September 1995 
production compagnie = Miramax Films 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h28 
budget = 5.0 millions of dollars 
average note = 5.0 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Joe Chappelle 
cast = Donald Pleasence, Paul Rudd, Marianne Hagan, Mitchell Ryan 
revenue = 15.1 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Haddonfield is ready to celebrate Halloween.... so is Michael Myers! 

In "Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers," the town of Haddonfield, Illinois, is once again haunted by the infamous Michael Myers. Six years after his last reign of terror, Michael's niece Jamie Lloyd, who was kidnapped by evil druids protecting him, escapes after giving birth to his child. Desperate for help, Jamie seeks out Dr. Loomis in Haddonfield as the town prepares to celebrate Halloween. Directed by Joe Chappelle and starring Donald Pleasence, Paul Rudd, Marianne Hagan, and Mitchell Ryan, this horror film was released on September 29, 1995, by Miramax Films. With a budget of 5.0 million dollars, the movie grossed 15.1 million dollars at the box office, receiving an average rating of 5.0. Haddonfield is ready to celebrate Halloween, but so is Michael Myers in this chilling installment. The original language of the movie is English, and it has a duration of 1h28. The production country is the United States of America.

In the heartwarming animated film "Balto," a courageous half-wolf outcast embarks on a perilous journey to save Nome, Alaska from a deadly epidemic. Released on December 22, 1995, in the United States of America, this English-language movie produced by Universal Pictures and Steven Spielberg captures the audience's attention for 1 hour and 18 minutes. With a talented cast including Kevin Bacon, Bob Hoskins, Bridget Fonda, and Jim Cummings, "Balto" garnered a revenue of 11.3 million dollars and an impressive average rating of 7.1.

title = The Stepford Wives 
overview = The urban aspirant photographer Joanna Eberhart moves from Manhattan to Stepford, Connecticut with her family. Her husband Walter Eberhart decided to live in a calm suburb, but Joanna did not like the neighborhood with beautiful and perfect housewives. She becomes friend of Bobbie Markowe and Charmaine Wimperis, and when they change Joanna tries to escape. 
revenue = 102.9 millions of dollars 
tagline = Something strange is happening in the town of Stepford. 
Producer = Edgar J. Scherick 
cast = Katharine Ross, Paula Prentiss, Nanette Newman, Judith Baldwin 
average note = 6.7 
Director = Bryan Forbes 
budget = 64.7 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 12 of February 1975 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Palomar Pictures 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h57 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 102.9 millions of dollars 

In the 1975 film "The Stepford Wives," directed by Bryan Forbes and produced by Edgar J. Scherick, urban photographer Joanna Eberhart relocates to the seemingly perfect town of Stepford, Connecticut with her family. Unsettled by the flawless housewives in the neighborhood, Joanna befriends Bobbie Markowe and Charmaine Wimperis, only to discover a disturbing secret when her friends undergo a transformation. As Joanna tries to escape the eerie town, she unravels a sinister plot. Starring Katharine Ross, Paula Prentiss, Nanette Newman, and Judith Baldwin, this suspenseful thriller with a tagline "Something strange is happening in the town of Stepford" captivated audiences and grossed over 102.9 million dollars at the box office. With a runtime of 1 hour and 57 minutes, this English-language production from Palomar Pictures offers a chilling glimpse into the dark side of suburban perfection. The movie was released on the 12th of February 1975 in the United States of America. The budget for the film was 64.7 million dollars, and it received an average rating of 6.7.

In the 1975 film "The Stepford Wives," directed by Bryan Forbes and produced by Edgar J. Scherick, urban photographer Joanna Eberhart relocates to the seemingly perfect town of Stepford, Connecticut with her family. Unsettled by the flawless housewives in the neighborhood, Joanna befriends Bobbie Markowe and Charmaine Wimperis, only to discover a disturbing secret when her friends undergo a transformation. As Joanna tries to escape the eerie town, she unravels a sinister plot. Starring Katharine Ross, Paula Prentiss, Nanette Newman, and Judith Baldwin, this suspenseful thriller with a tagline "Something strange is happening in the town of Stepford" captivated audiences and grossed over 102.9 million dollars at the box office. With a runtime of 1 hour and 57 minutes, this English-language production from Palomar Pictures offers a chilling glimpse into the dark side of suburban perfection. The movie was released on the 12th of February 1975 in the United States of America. The budget for the film was 64.7 million dollars, and it received an average rating of 6.7.

title = The Baxter 
overview = A man with a "doormat" personality tries standing up for himself for a change in this comedy. Mild mannered tax accountant Elliot Sherman (Michael Showalter) is what he calls a "Baxter": the kind of calm, unexciting fellow who "wears sock garters" and "enjoys raking leaves." Loved by bosses and parents, Elliot is a perfectly nice guy. And that's his problem. 
date of release = the 24 of April 2005 
cast = Michael Showalter, Elizabeth Banks, Michelle Williams, Justin Theroux 
tagline = A romantic comedy for anyone who's ever been dumped. 
Producer = Galt Niederhoffer 
production compagnie = IFC Films 
Director = Michael Showalter 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 24 of April 2005 

In the romantic comedy "The Baxter," released on April 24, 2005, mild-mannered tax accountant Elliot Sherman, played by Michael Showalter, embodies the quintessential "Baxter" - a nice guy who always finishes last. When Elliot decides to finally stand up for himself, hilarity ensues as he navigates love and self-discovery. With a stellar cast including Elizabeth Banks, Michelle Williams, and Justin Theroux, this film, directed by Michael Showalter and produced by Galt Niederhoffer under IFC Films, is a must-watch for anyone who has ever experienced heartbreak. Get ready to root for the underdog in this charming and relatable tale of finding one's voice in the midst of romantic turmoil. "The Baxter" is a romantic comedy for anyone who's ever been dumped.

title = Black Rock 
overview = Three childhood friends set aside their personal issues and reunite for a girls’ weekend on a remote island off the coast of Maine. One wrong move turns their weekend getaway into a deadly fight for survival. 
production compagnie = Submarine Entertainment Distributors 
budget = 95.2 millions of dollars 
revenue = 260.8 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 21 of January 2012

average note = 4.9 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h23 
original language of the movie = English

cast = Kate Bosworth, Lake Bell, Jay Paulson, Katie Aselton 
tagline = Not every island is a paradise.

fact : production compagnie = Submarine Entertainment Distributors 

In the thrilling movie "Black Rock," directed by Katie Aselton and released on the 21st of January 2012, three childhood friends, portrayed by Kate Bosworth, Lake Bell, and Jay Paulson, embark on a girls' weekend on a remote island off the coast of Maine. As they set aside their personal issues, one wrong move quickly escalates their getaway into a deadly fight for survival. With a budget of 95.2 million dollars and a revenue of 260.8 million dollars, this intense tale of friendship and danger is a production of Submarine Entertainment Distributors. Producer Adele Romanski brings this 1 hour and 23-minute film to life in the United States of America, with an average rating of 4.9. The original language of the movie is English, and the tagline reminds us that "Not every island is a paradise."

title = About Mrs. Leslie 
overview = A lonely, unhappy owner of a Beverly Hills boarding house reflects on her lonely, unhappy life and the lonely, unhappy man she once loved. Director Daniel Mann's 1954 drama about lonely, unhappy people stars Shirley Booth, Robert Ryan, Alex Nicol, Marjie Millar, Eileen Janssen, Percy Helton, Ray Teal, Maidie Norman, Mabel Albertson, Ellen Corby, Harry Morgan, James Bell, Virginia Brissac, Laura Elliott, Philip Ober, Nana Bryant and Ian Wolfe. 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 
Director = Daniel Mann 
average note = 8.5 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 

In the 1954 drama "About Mrs. Leslie," directed by Daniel Mann and produced by Paramount Pictures, viewers are taken on a poignant journey into the life of a lonely and unhappy owner of a Beverly Hills boarding house. The film delves into her reflections on her past, particularly her relationship with a lonely and unhappy man she once loved. Starring a talented ensemble cast including Shirley Booth, Robert Ryan, Alex Nicol, Marjie Millar, Eileen Janssen, Percy Helton, Ray Teal, Maidie Norman, Mabel Albertson, Ellen Corby, Harry Morgan, James Bell, Virginia Brissac, Laura Elliott, Philip Ober, Nana Bryant, and Ian Wolfe, this emotional tale resonates with audiences as it explores themes of loneliness and lost love. With an average rating of 8.5, "About Mrs. Leslie" is a classic drama that tugs at the heartstrings and leaves a lasting impact on all who watch it.

In the 1954 drama "About Mrs. Leslie," directed by Daniel Mann and produced by Paramount Pictures, viewers are taken on a poignant journey into the life of a lonely and unhappy owner of a Beverly Hills boarding house. The film delves into her reflections on her past, particularly her relationship with a lonely and unhappy man she once loved. Starring a talented ensemble cast including Shirley Booth, Robert Ryan, Alex Nicol, Marjie Millar, Eileen Janssen, Percy Helton, Ray Teal, Maidie Norman, Mabel Albertson, Ellen Corby, Harry Morgan, James Bell, Virginia Brissac, Laura Elliott, Philip Ober, Nana Bryant, and Ian Wolfe, this emotional tale resonates with audiences as it explores themes of loneliness and lost love. With an average rating of 8.5, "About Mrs. Leslie" is a classic drama that tugs at the heartstrings and leaves a lasting impact on all who watch it.

title = Stop at Nothing: The Lance Armstrong Story 
overview = A portrait of the man behind the greatest fraud in sporting history. Lance Armstrong enriched himself by cheating his fans, his sport, and the truth. But the former friends whose lives and careers he destroyed would finally bring him down. 
tagline = You think you know this story? You don't. 
date of release = the 27 of May 2014 
average note = 7.0 

In "Stop at Nothing: The Lance Armstrong Story," viewers are taken on a gripping journey into the dark side of sports as they delve into the life of Lance Armstrong, a man who orchestrated the greatest fraud in sporting history. Despite his initial rise to fame and glory, Armstrong's deceitful actions not only betrayed his fans and the sport but also led to the destruction of the lives and careers of those who once called him a friend. Released on the 27th of May 2014, this documentary sheds light on the intricate web of lies woven by Armstrong and the eventual downfall he faced at the hands of those he wronged. As the tagline suggests, "You think you know this story? You don't." With an average rating of 7.0, this film offers a compelling and eye-opening look into the scandal that rocked the world of sports.

title = MURDER and murder 
overview = Mildred and Doris are two middle-aged white women, from very different backgrounds, who become lovers and set up house together. Film explores the pleasures and uncertainties of later-life emotional attachment and lesbian identity in a culture that glorifies youth and heterosexual romance. 
budget = 139.3 millions of dollars 
tagline = Mildred and Doris are two middle-aged women. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 139.3 millions of dollars 

In the thought-provoking film "MURDER and murder," Mildred and Doris, two middle-aged white women from contrasting backgrounds, defy societal norms as they embark on a romantic relationship and establish a home together. Against the backdrop of a culture that often prioritizes youth and heterosexual love, the movie delves into the complexities of later-life emotional connections and lesbian identity. With a budget of 139.3 million dollars, this poignant tale challenges perceptions and celebrates the power of love regardless of age or sexual orientation. As the tagline suggests, Mildred and Doris navigate their unique journey as two middle-aged women, highlighting the beauty and challenges of their unconventional love story.

title = Dying Breed 
overview = In the depths of the Tasmanian wilderness a group of hikers looking for a Tasmanian Tiger. They encounter a group of cannibals descended from Alexander Pearce, who was hung for cannibalism in 1824, out to find fresh breeding stock. 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 5.0 
Director = Jody Dwyer 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the depths of the Tasmanian wilderness, a group of hikers ventures into the wilderness in search of the elusive Tasmanian Tiger. Little do they know, they stumble upon a group of cannibals who are descendants of Alexander Pearce, a notorious figure who was executed for cannibalism in 1824. These cannibals are on the hunt for fresh breeding stock, leading to a terrifying and deadly encounter for the unsuspecting hikers. With an average rating of 5.0, this horror film delves into the dark and gruesome depths of human survival instincts gone awry. The film is directed by Jody Dwyer and is in the English language.

['correct']
fact : average note = 5.0

With an average rating of 5.0, this horror film delves into the dark and gruesome depths of human survival instincts gone awry. The film is directed by Jody Dwyer and is in the English language.

With an average rating of 5.0, this horror film delves into the dark and gruesome depths of human survival instincts gone awry. The film is directed by Jody Dwyer and is in the English language.

title = Poison Ivy 
overview = A seductive teen befriends an introverted high school student and schemes her way into the lives of her wealthy family. 
Director = Katt Shea 
cast = Sara Gilbert, Drew Barrymore, Tom Skerritt, Cheryl Ladd 
tagline = What Ivy wants, Ivy gets. 
production compagnie = New Line Cinema 
duration of the movie = 1h33 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 146.9 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 8 of May 1992 
Producer = Andy Ruben 
revenue = 231.6 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Katt Shea 

In the sultry thriller "Poison Ivy," directed by Katt Shea, a seductive teen played by Drew Barrymore befriends an introverted high school student, portrayed by Sara Gilbert. With a tagline of "What Ivy wants, Ivy gets," the movie delves into Ivy's manipulative schemes as she infiltrates the lives of a wealthy family, including Tom Skerritt and Cheryl Ladd. Produced by Andy Ruben and released on the 8th of May 1992 in the United States of America, this New Line Cinema production runs for 1 hour and 33 minutes in English. With a budget of 146.9 million dollars, "Poison Ivy" raked in a revenue of 231.6 million dollars, making it a captivating and financially successful film.

title = The War Zone 
overview = An alienated teenager, saddened that he has moved away from London, must find a way to deal with a dark family secret. 
average note = 7.2 
budget = 242.3 millions of dollars 
production countrie = Italy 
cast = Ray Winstone, Tilda Swinton, Lara Belmont, Colin Farrell 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 11 of June 1999 
duration of the movie = 1h38 
revenue = 151.5 millions of dollars 
Director = Tim Roth 
tagline = When the worst of men hides in a family with no history. 
Producer = Dixie Linder 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 7.2 

In the movie "The War Zone," directed by Tim Roth, an alienated teenager grapples with the weight of a dark family secret after moving away from London to Italy. Starring Ray Winstone, Tilda Swinton, Lara Belmont, and Colin Farrell, this English-language film delves into the complexities of family dynamics and the impact of buried truths. With a budget of 242.3 million dollars, the movie was released on the 11th of June 1999 and received an average rating of 7.2. As the story unfolds in 1 hour and 38 minutes, viewers are drawn into a world where the tagline rings true: "When the worst of men hides in a family with no history." Despite its critical acclaim, the movie generated a revenue of 151.5 million dollars, showcasing the powerful storytelling and performances brought to life by producer Dixie Linder. The production country of the movie is Italy.

As the story unfolds in 1 hour and 38 minutes, viewers are drawn into a world where the tagline rings true: "When the worst of men hides in a family with no history." Despite its critical acclaim, the movie generated a revenue of 151.5 million dollars, showcasing the powerful storytelling and performances brought to life by producer Dixie Linder. The production country of the movie is Italy.

title = Tales of Manhattan 
overview = Ten screenwriters collaborated on this series of tales concerning the effect a tailcoat cursed by its tailor has on those who wear it. The video release features a W.C. Fields segment not included in the original theatrical release. 
cast = Charles Boyer, Rita Hayworth, Ginger Rogers, Henry Fonda 
date of release = the 5 of August 1942 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 22.1 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.9 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Charles Boyer, Rita Hayworth, Ginger Rogers, Henry Fonda 

In the classic film "Tales of Manhattan," released on August 5, 1942, a cursed tailcoat made by a tailor impacts the lives of those who wear it. This anthology movie features segments written by ten screenwriters, with a special W.C. Fields segment included in the video release. Starring Charles Boyer, Rita Hayworth, Ginger Rogers, and Henry Fonda, the film unfolds in English, captivating audiences with its intriguing tales. With a revenue of 22.1 million dollars and an average rating of 6.9, "Tales of Manhattan" weaves together a tapestry of stories that showcase the transformative power of a single garment.

title = The Sweet Hereafter 
overview = A small mountain community in Canada is devastated when a school bus accident leaves more than a dozen of its children dead. A big-city lawyer arrives to help the survivors' and victims' families prepare a class-action suit, but his efforts only seem to push the townspeople further apart. At the same time, one teenage survivor of the accident has to reckon with the loss of innocence brought about by a different kind of damage. 
Producer = Atom Egoyan 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 5.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = Canada 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Atom Egoyan 

In "The Sweet Hereafter," a heartbreaking tragedy strikes a small mountain community in Canada when a school bus accident claims the lives of more than a dozen children. As the townspeople grapple with grief and guilt, a big-city lawyer, Atom Egoyan, arrives to assist the families in preparing a class-action lawsuit. However, his efforts inadvertently deepen the rifts within the community. Amidst the turmoil, a teenage survivor must confront the loss of innocence caused by the devastating event. This poignant drama, filmed in English with a budget of 5.0 million dollars, delves into the complexities of grief, guilt, and healing in the aftermath of a profound loss. The movie was produced in Canada.

title = Acolytes 
overview = Three teens blackmail a serial killer into helping them get rid of a violent bully. 
average note = 5.5 
production countrie = Australia 
budget = 254.4 millions of dollars 
tagline = Nothing stays buried forever. 
Director = Jon Hewitt 
Producer = Grant Bradley 
cast = Joel Edgerton, Michael Dorman, Sebastian Gregory, Hanna Mangan Lawrence 
revenue = 291.1 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Stewart and Wall Entertainment 
date of release = the 20 of September 2008 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h31 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 5.5 

In the Australian thriller "Acolytes," directed by Jon Hewitt and produced by Grant Bradley, three teenagers find themselves in a dangerous situation when they blackmail a serial killer to help them deal with a violent bully. Starring Joel Edgerton, Michael Dorman, Sebastian Gregory, and Hanna Mangan Lawrence, the film explores the dark consequences of their actions. With a tagline that warns "Nothing stays buried forever," the movie was released on the 20th of September 2008 and runs for 1 hour and 31 minutes. Despite its budget of 254.4 million dollars, "Acolytes" managed to generate a revenue of 291.1 million dollars. This intense thriller keeps viewers on the edge of their seats as secrets unravel and the characters' fates intertwine. The production company behind the film is Stewart and Wall Entertainment. The movie was filmed in Australia and the original language of the movie is English. The average note for the movie is 5.5.

In the Australian thriller "Acolytes," directed by Jon Hewitt and produced by Grant Bradley, three teenagers find themselves in a dangerous situation when they blackmail a serial killer to help them deal with a violent bully. Starring Joel Edgerton, Michael Dorman, Sebastian Gregory, and Hanna Mangan Lawrence, the film explores the dark consequences of their actions. With a tagline that warns "Nothing stays buried forever," the movie was released on the 20th of September 2008 and runs for 1 hour and 31 minutes. Despite its budget of 254.4 million dollars, "Acolytes" managed to generate a revenue of 291.1 million dollars. This intense thriller keeps viewers on the edge of their seats as secrets unravel and the characters' fates intertwine. The production company behind the film is Stewart and Wall Entertainment. The movie was filmed in Australia and the original language of the movie is English. The average note for the movie is 5.5.

title = Death Proof 
overview = Austin's hottest DJ, Jungle Julia, sets out into the night to unwind with her two friends Shanna and Arlene. Covertly tracking their moves is Stuntman Mike, a scarred rebel leering from behind the wheel of his muscle car, revving just feet away. 
duration of the movie = 1h53 
Producer = Robert Rodriguez

['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h53 

In "Death Proof," produced by Robert Rodriguez, Austin's popular DJ, Jungle Julia, along with her friends Shanna and Arlene, embark on a night out to relax. Little do they know, they are being closely watched by Stuntman Mike, a disfigured daredevil who follows them in his powerful muscle car, lurking just a few feet behind. As the tension rises, the movie unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 53 minutes, leading to a thrilling and suspenseful showdown that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

title = Werewolf Woman 
overview = A woman has dreams that she is a werewolf so she goes out and finds men. She proceeds to have sex with them and then rip their throats out with her teeth. She eventually falls in love but then she is raped and her lover is murdered so she goes out for revenge. 
revenue = 33.6 millions of dollars 
Director = Rino Di Silvestro 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 33.6 millions of dollars 

In "Werewolf Woman," directed by Rino Di Silvestro, we follow the story of a woman who is plagued by dreams of being a werewolf. Driven by her inner beast, she seeks out men, seduces them, and then unleashes her primal instincts by ripping their throats out with her teeth. However, her life takes a dark turn when she falls in love, only to be brutally raped and witness the murder of her lover. Fueled by grief and a thirst for vengeance, she embarks on a bloody quest for retribution. With a revenue of 33.6 million dollars, this chilling tale of horror and revenge will leave audiences on the edge of their seats.

title = The Jackal 
overview = Hired by a powerful member of the Russian mafia to avenge an FBI sting that left his brother dead, the perfectionist Jackal proves an elusive target for the men charged with the task of bringing him down: a deputy FBI boss and a former IRA terrorist. 
cast = Bruce Willis, Richard Gere, Sidney Poitier, Diane Venora 
tagline = How do you stop an assassin who has no identity? 
Producer = Kevin Jarre 
duration of the movie = 2h04 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 159.3 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 14 of November 1997 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 6.1 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Bruce Willis, Richard Gere, Sidney Poitier, Diane Venora 

In "The Jackal," a meticulous assassin known as the Jackal is hired by the Russian mafia to seek vengeance for his brother's death. As he becomes a target for both the FBI and a former IRA terrorist, a thrilling game of cat and mouse ensues. Starring Bruce Willis, Richard Gere, Sidney Poitier, and Diane Venora, this action-packed film, produced by Kevin Jarre, keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for 2 hours and 4 minutes. With a tagline asking "How do you stop an assassin who has no identity?" and an average rating of 6.1, this English-language movie, released on November 14, 1997, grossed a whopping $159.3 million at the box office. Set in the United States of America and produced by Universal Pictures, "The Jackal" is a must-watch for fans of suspenseful thrillers.

title = The Bear 
overview = An orphan bear cub hooks up with an adult male as they try to dodge human hunters. 
date of release = the 21 of October 1988 
cast = Tchéky Karyo, Jack Wallace, André Lacombe 
Producer = Claude Berri 
tagline = He's an orphan... at the start of a journey. A journey to survive. 
Director = Jean-Jacques Annaud 
average note = 6.9 
production compagnie = Renn Productions 
production countrie = France 
budget = 139.2 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h34 
revenue = 138.2 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 21 of October 1988 

In the heartwarming adventure film "The Bear," released on the 21st of October 1988, an orphan bear cub forms an unlikely bond with an adult male bear as they navigate the dangers of evading human hunters. Directed by Jean-Jacques Annaud and produced by Claude Berri, the movie showcases the stunning English countryside as the backdrop for this tale of survival. Starring Tchéky Karyo, Jack Wallace, and André Lacombe, the film follows the bears on a journey filled with challenges and triumphs. With an average rating of 6.9, "The Bear" captivates audiences with its emotional storyline and breathtaking cinematography. Despite its budget of 139.2 million dollars, the movie managed to earn 138.2 million dollars in revenue. Join the orphan bear cub as he embarks on a remarkable journey to survive in this unforgettable cinematic experience. The tagline for the movie is "He's an orphan... at the start of a journey. title = The Burning 
overview = A caretaker at a summer camp is burned when a prank goes tragically wrong. After several years of intensive treatment at hospital, he is released back into society, albeit missing some social skills. What follows is a bloody killing spree with the caretaker making his way back to his old stomping ground to confront one of the youths that accidently burned him. 
budget = 1.5 millions of dollars 
Director = Tony Maylam 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 1.5 millions of dollars 

In the chilling horror film "The Burning," directed by Tony Maylam, a summer camp caretaker is horrifically burned in a tragic prank gone awry. After years of extensive hospital treatment, he reemerges into society with a vengeance, lacking in social graces. As he embarks on a brutal killing spree, the caretaker sets his sights on returning to the camp where his torment began, seeking revenge on one of the youths responsible for his disfigurement. With a budget of 1.5 million dollars, this terrifying tale of retribution and horror will leave audiences on the edge of their seats.

title = The Witches 
overview = A young boy named Luke and his grandmother go on vacation only to discover their hotel is hosting an international witch convention, where the Grand High Witch is unveiling her master plan to turn all children into mice. Will Luke fall victim to the witches' plot before he can stop them? 
tagline = Saving the world from witches is a tall order for a boy they've turned into a mouse! 
average note = 6.7 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h31 
budget = 280.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
date of release = the 16 of February 1990 
production compagnie = Lorimar Film Entertainment 
cast = Anjelica Huston, Mai Zetterling, Jasen Fisher, Jane Horrocks 
Director = Nicolas Roeg 
revenue = 15.4 millions of dollars 
Producer = Mark Shivas 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Saving the world from witches is a tall order for a boy they've turned into a mouse! 

In "The Witches," directed by Nicolas Roeg, a seemingly ordinary vacation takes a dark turn for young Luke and his grandmother when they stumble upon an international witch convention at their hotel. Led by the menacing Grand High Witch, the witches unveil a sinister plan to transform all children into mice. As Luke races against time to thwart their evil scheme, he finds himself facing the daunting task of saving the world from these malevolent forces, all while navigating his newfound mouse form. With a stellar cast including Anjelica Huston and Mai Zetterling, this English-language film released on the 16th of February 1990, takes viewers on a thrilling adventure filled with magic, danger, and the resilience of the human spirit. Will Luke be able to outsmart the witches and prevent their wicked plan from succeeding? Find out in this captivating tale that proves that even the smallest heroes can make a big difference.

Tagline: Saving the world from witches is a tall order for a boy they've turned into a mouse!
Average Note: 6.7
Original Language of the Movie: English
Duration of the Movie: 1h31
Budget: 280.0 millions of dollars
Production Country: United Kingdom
Date of Release: the 16 of February 1990
Production Company: Lorimar Film Entertainment
Cast: Anjelica Huston, Mai Zetterling, Jasen Fisher, Jane Horrocks
Director: Nicolas Roeg
Revenue: 15.4 millions of dollars
Producer: Mark Shivas

With a stellar cast including Anjelica Huston and Mai Zetterling, this English-language film released on the 16th of February 1990, takes viewers on a thrilling adventure filled with magic, danger, and the resilience of the human spirit. Will Luke be able to outsmart the witches and prevent their wicked plan from succeeding? Find out in this captivating tale that proves that even the smallest heroes can make a big difference.

Tagline: Saving the world from witches is a tall order for a boy they've turned into a mouse!
Average Note: 6.7

Duration of the Movie: 1h31

Production Company: Lorimar Film Entertainment

title = Walk Softly, Stranger 
overview = A petty crook (Joseph Cotten) moves to an Ohio town and courts a factory owner's disabled daughter (Valli). 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 197.6 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the English-language film "Walk Softly, Stranger," a petty crook portrayed by Joseph Cotten relocates to an Ohio town where he finds himself entangled in a complex web of emotions as he begins to court the disabled daughter of a local factory owner, played by Valli. As the story unfolds, viewers are taken on a journey filled with unexpected twists and turns, all against the backdrop of small-town life. With a remarkable revenue of 197.6 million dollars, this movie captivates audiences with its intriguing plot and memorable performances.

title = Alaska 
overview = Jake Barnes and his two kids, Sean and Jessie, have moved to Alaska after his wife died. He is a former airline pilot now delivering toilet paper across the mountains. During an emergency delivery in a storm his plane goes down somewhere in the mountains. Annoyed that the authorities aren't doing enough, Jessie and Sean set out on an adventure to find their father with the help of a polar bear which they have saved from a ferocious poacher. Conflict ensues. 
average note = 5.2 
tagline = A missing father. A desperate search. An unforgettable adventure. 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Castle Rock Entertainment 
Director = Fraser Clarke Heston 
cast = Thora Birch, Vincent Kartheiser, Dirk Benedict, Ben Cardinal 
budget = 23.0 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h49 
production countrie = Canada 
Producer = Carol Fuchs 
date of release = the 14 of August 1996 
revenue = 251.4 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 5.2 

In the heartwarming adventure film "Alaska," directed by Fraser Clarke Heston and produced by Castle Rock Entertainment, we follow the journey of Jake Barnes, a former airline pilot turned toilet paper deliveryman, and his two children, Sean and Jessie, portrayed by Thora Birch and Vincent Kartheiser. After the tragic death of Jake's wife, the family relocates to Alaska where a plane crash during a storm leaves Jake stranded in the mountains. Annoyed by the slow response of the authorities, Jessie and Sean, with the help of a polar bear they saved from a poacher, set out on a daring adventure to find their missing father. Along the way, they face various conflicts and challenges that test their resilience and bond as a family.

The film "Alaska" was released on the 14th of August 1996 and has an average rating of 5.2. The tagline of the movie is "A missing father. A desperate search. An unforgettable adventure." The original language of the movie is English, and it has a runtime of 1 hour and 49 minutes. The production company behind the film is Castle Rock Entertainment, with Carol Fuchs as the producer. The cast includes Thora Birch, Vincent Kartheiser, Dirk Benedict, and Ben Cardinal. The budget for the movie was 23.0 million dollars, and it grossed 251.4 million dollars at the box office. The production country of the film is Canada. 

"Alaska" is a captivating story of survival, determination, and the unbreakable spirit of adventure, set against the breathtaking backdrop of the Alaskan wilderness.

['correct']

After the tragic death of Jake's wife, the family relocates to Alaska where a plane crash during a storm leaves Jake stranded in the mountains. Annoyed by the slow response of the authorities, Jessie and Sean, with the help of a polar bear they saved from a poacher, set out on a daring adventure to find their missing father. Along the way, they face various conflicts and challenges that test their resilience and bond as a family.

The film "Alaska" was released on the 14th of August 1996 and has an average rating of 5.2. The tagline of the movie is "A missing father. A desperate search. An unforgettable adventure." The original language of the movie is English, and it has a runtime of 1 hour and 49 minutes. The production company behind the film is Castle Rock Entertainment, with Carol Fuchs as the producer. The cast includes Thora Birch, Vincent Kartheiser, Dirk Benedict, and Ben Cardinal. The budget for the movie was 23.0 million dollars, and it grossed 251.4 million dollars at the box office. The production country of the film is Canada. 

"Alaska" is a captivating story of survival, determination, and the unbreakable spirit of adventure, set against the breathtaking backdrop of the Alaskan wilderness. 
 
 

 
title = All Is Lost 
overview = Deep into a solo voyage in the Indian Ocean, an unnamed man (Redford) wakes to find his 39-foot yacht taking on water after a collision with a shipping container left floating on the high seas. With his navigation equipment and radio disabled, the man sails unknowingly into the path of a violent storm. Despite his success in patching the breached hull, his mariner's intuition and a strength that belies his age, the man barely survives the tempest. Using only a sextant and nautical maps to chart his progress, he is forced to rely on ocean currents to carry him into a shipping lane in hopes of hailing a passing vessel. But with the sun unrelenting, sharks circling and his meager supplies dwindling, the ever-resourceful sailor soon finds himself staring his mortality in the face. 
revenue = 6.1 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.6 
production compagnie = Sudden Storm Productions 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 6.1 millions of dollars 

In "All Is Lost," a gripping tale of survival unfolds as an unnamed man, portrayed by Redford, faces the ultimate test of endurance during a solo voyage in the Indian Ocean. After a collision with a shipping container leaves his 39-foot yacht damaged and taking on water, he must navigate through treacherous waters with limited resources. Despite his resilience and experience, the man finds himself at the mercy of nature's fury as he battles a violent storm. With his navigation tools and communication devices rendered useless, he must rely on his instincts and sheer determination to stay alive. As he struggles to stay afloat, the man's harrowing journey is a testament to the strength of the human spirit in the face of overwhelming odds. Using only a sextant and nautical maps to chart his progress, he is forced to rely on ocean currents to carry him into a shipping lane in hopes of hailing a passing vessel. But with the sun unrelenting, sharks circling, and his meager supplies dwindling, the ever-resourceful sailor soon finds himself staring his mortality in the face.

The movie "All Is Lost" was produced by Sudden Storm Productions in the United States of America. It was filmed in English and received a revenue of 6.1 million dollars with an average note of 6.6.

fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the heartwarming comedy "The Nanny Diaries," a recent college graduate finds herself immersed in the chaotic world of a wealthy New York family. Balancing their dysfunction, a blossoming romance, and the challenging antics of the spoiled child she cares for, she navigates through the ups and downs of her new role. Starring Scarlett Johansson, Laura Linney, Nicholas Art, and Chris Evans, this film takes viewers on a journey through the complexities of life at the top, as observed from the bottom. Directed by Shari Springer Berman and produced by Dany Wolf, this American production by The Weinstein Company was released on August 24, 2007. With a budget of $20.0 million, the movie grossed $47.7 million at the box office, receiving an average rating of 6.1. The 1 hour and 46-minute film is presented in its original language, English, and promises a delightful blend of humor and heart.

The movie's production country is the United States of America. 

The tagline for the movie is "A comedy about life at the top, as seen from the bottom."

title = Joshua 
overview = The arrival of a newborn girl causes the gradual disintegration of the Cairn family; particularly for 9-year-old Joshua, an eccentric boy whose proper upbringing and refined tastes both take a sinister turn. 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = George Ratliff 
cast = Sam Rockwell, Vera Farmiga, Jacob Kogan, Celia Weston 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the chilling psychological thriller "Joshua," directed by George Ratliff, the Cairn family's seemingly idyllic life is shattered with the arrival of a newborn girl. As the family dynamics begin to unravel, the focus shifts to 9-year-old Joshua, a peculiar boy whose sophisticated demeanor and refined preferences start to take a dark and unsettling turn. Set in the United States of America, this gripping tale unfolds in English, featuring a stellar cast including Sam Rockwell, Vera Farmiga, Jacob Kogan, and Celia Weston. Watch as the sinister transformation of Joshua leads to a series of disturbing events that will keep you on the edge of your seat. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = George Ratliff 

In the chilling psychological thriller "Joshua," directed by George Ratliff, the Cairn family's seemingly idyllic life is shattered with the arrival of a newborn girl. As the family dynamics begin to unravel, the focus shifts to 9-year-old Joshua, a peculiar boy whose sophisticated demeanor and refined preferences start to take a dark and unsettling turn. Set in the United States of America, this gripping tale unfolds in English, featuring a stellar cast including Sam Rockwell, Vera Farmiga, Jacob Kogan, and Celia Weston. Watch as the sinister transformation of Joshua leads to a series of disturbing events that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

title = Offender 
overview = Justice needs to be served at Britain's most notorious young offenders institute. 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
production compagnie = Gunslinger 
date of release = the 8 of August 2012 
cast = Joe Cole, English Frank, Kimberley Nixon, Shaun Dooley 
revenue = 7.1 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h42 
Director = Ron Scalpello 
Producer = Paul Van Carter 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United Kingdom 

In the intense British film "Offender," directed by Ron Scalpello and produced by Paul Van Carter, justice takes center stage at Britain's most notorious young offenders institute. Released on the 8th of August 2012, the movie unfolds in the United Kingdom. With a stellar cast including Joe Cole, English Frank, Kimberley Nixon, and Shaun Dooley, the film delves into the challenges and complexities of the justice system. As the story unravels in English, the 1 hour and 42-minute runtime keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. "Offender" not only captivates audiences with its compelling storyline but also managed to generate a revenue of 7.1 million dollars, making it a standout production by Gunslinger. The production company behind this gripping film is Gunslinger, and it was released in the United Kingdom.

title = Another Man's Poison 
overview = Novelist Janet Frobisher, lives in an isolated house, having been separated for years from her criminal husband. She has fallen in love with her secretary's fiancé and when her estranged husband unexpectedly appears, Janet poisons him, but just as she's about to dispose of the body, one of her husband's criminal cohorts also shows up. 
Director = Irving Rapper 
cast = Bette Davis, Gary Merrill, Emlyn Williams, Anthony Steel 
budget = 277.5 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.4 
Producer = Daniel M. Angel 
production countrie = United Kingdom 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Irving Rapper 

In "Another Man's Poison," directed by Irving Rapper, acclaimed actress Bette Davis takes on the role of Janet Frobisher, a novelist living in isolation due to her criminal husband. Janet finds herself entangled in a web of deceit and betrayal when she falls for her secretary's fiancé. As tensions rise, Janet makes a fateful decision to poison her estranged husband, only to face unexpected consequences when his criminal associate arrives. With a stellar cast including Gary Merrill, Emlyn Williams, and Anthony Steel, this British production, produced by Daniel M. Angel, weaves a tale of love, murder, and intrigue. Despite its budget of 277.5 million dollars, the film captivates audiences with an average rating of 6.4, making it a must-watch for fans of suspenseful dramas. The movie was produced in the United Kingdom.

title = 4 Months, 3 Weeks and 2 Days 
overview = Gabita is pregnant, abortion is strictly forbidden in Romania during the communist regime. Despite this it is common practice and Gabita wants an abortion. The movie follows her and her friend Otilia during the day she has made the appointment with Mr. Bebe to have the abortion. 
production compagnie = Saga Film 
revenue = 1.2 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = Romanian 
tagline = At what moment do we begin to live? 
cast = Anamaria Marinca, Laura Vasiliu, Vlad Ivanov, Alexandru Potocean 
budget = 0.9 millions of dollars 
production countrie = Belgium 
duration of the movie = 1h53 
Director = Cristian Mungiu 
date of release = the 24 of August 2007 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Saga Film 

In the gripping Romanian drama "4 Months, 3 Weeks and 2 Days," directed by Cristian Mungiu and produced by Saga Film in collaboration with Belgium, we are taken back to a time when abortion was strictly forbidden in Romania during the communist regime. The story follows Gabita, who is pregnant and determined to have an abortion despite the risks. With the help of her loyal friend Otilia, they navigate the dangerous underground world of illegal abortions, culminating in a tense appointment with the notorious Mr. Bebe. As the clock ticks down, the two women must confront difficult choices and the harsh realities of their society. Starring Anamaria Marinca, Laura Vasiliu, Vlad Ivanov, and Alexandru Potocean, this intense and thought-provoking film challenges viewers to ponder the question: "At what moment do we begin to live?" Released on August 24, 2007, the movie has a duration of 1 hour and 53 minutes. With a budget of 0.9 million dollars and a revenue of 1.2 million dollars, "4 Months, 3 Weeks and 2 Days" stands as a testament to the power of storytelling and the resilience of the human spirit. The original language of the movie is Romanian, and the tagline is "At what moment do we begin to live?" 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 1.2 millions of dollars

['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = Romanian 

In the gripping Romanian drama "4 Months, 3 Weeks and 2 Days," directed by Cristian Mungiu and produced by Saga Film in collaboration with Belgium, we are taken back to a time when abortion was strictly forbidden in Romania during the communist regime. The story follows Gabita, who is pregnant and determined to have an abortion despite the risks. With the help of her loyal friend Otilia, they navigate the dangerous underground world of illegal abortions, culminating in a tense appointment with the notorious Mr. Bebe. As the clock ticks down, the two women must confront difficult choices and the harsh realities of their society. Starring Anamaria Marinca, Laura Vasiliu, Vlad Ivanov, and Alexandru Potocean, this intense and thought-provoking film challenges viewers to ponder the question: "At what moment do we begin to live?" Released on August 24, 2007, the movie has a duration of 1 hour and 53 minutes. With a budget of 0.9 million dollars and a revenue of 1.2 million dollars, "4 Months, 3 Weeks and 2 Days" stands as a testament to the power of storytelling and the resilience of the human spirit. The original language of the movie is Romanian, and the tagline is "At what moment do we begin to live?"

title = Flight of the Doves 
overview = While fleeing across the Irish countryside, two orphans are pursued by their villainous uncle, a master of disguises. 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
Director = Ralph Nelson 
budget = 243.9 millions of dollars 
Producer = Ralph Nelson 
cast = Ron Moody, Jack Wild, Dorothy McGuire, Stanley Holloway 
revenue = 139.6 millions of dollars 
tagline = Something special is coming your way! 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures Corporation 
date of release = the 2 of April 1971 
duration of the movie = 1h45 
average note = 6.3 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United Kingdom 

In the heartwarming adventure film "Flight of the Doves," directed by Ralph Nelson, two orphaned siblings find themselves on a thrilling journey through the picturesque Irish countryside. As they flee from their sinister uncle, a master of disguises played by Ron Moody, they encounter a series of challenges and heartwarming moments along the way. With a stellar cast including Jack Wild, Dorothy McGuire, and Stanley Holloway, the film captures the essence of family, courage, and the bond between siblings. Released on the 2nd of April 1971, by Columbia Pictures Corporation, this United Kingdom production with a budget of 243.9 million dollars went on to gross 139.6 million dollars at the box office. The tagline "Something special is coming your way!" perfectly encapsulates the magic and charm of this English-language film, which runs for 1 hour and 45 minutes and received an average rating of 6.3.

['correct']

In the heartwarming adventure film "Flight of the Doves," directed by Ralph Nelson, two orphaned siblings find themselves on a thrilling journey through the picturesque Irish countryside. As they flee from their sinister uncle, a master of disguises played by Ron Moody, they encounter a series of challenges and heartwarming moments along the way. With a stellar cast including Jack Wild, Dorothy McGuire, and Stanley Holloway, the film captures the essence of family, courage, and the bond between siblings. Released on the 2nd of April 1971, by Columbia Pictures Corporation, this United Kingdom production with a budget of 243.9 million dollars went on to gross 139.6 million dollars at the box office. The tagline "Something special is coming your way!" perfectly encapsulates the magic and charm of this English-language film, which runs for 1 hour and 45 minutes and received an average rating of 6.3.

title = La vérité si je mens ! 
overview = The sentimental and comedic adventures of Eddie, a non-Jew trying to pass as Jewish though totally ignorant of Jewish traditions, as he works in a Jewish community 
Producer = Aïssa Djabri 
production countrie = France 
date of release = the 1 of April 1997 
duration of the movie = 1h40 
original language of the movie = French 
cast = Richard Anconina, Vincent Elbaz, Richard Bohringer, José Garcia 
revenue = 29.5 millions of dollars 
budget = 4.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Aïssa Djabri 

In the heartwarming and hilarious film "La vérité si je mens!", viewers are taken on a journey with Eddie, a non-Jew who finds himself entangled in a web of comedic situations as he pretends to be Jewish while navigating the traditions of a close-knit Jewish community. Produced by Aïssa Djabri and released in France on the 1st of April 1997, this 1 hour and 40-minute film is a delightful exploration of cultural misunderstandings and the bonds that bring us together. The stellar cast includes Richard Anconina, Vincent Elbaz, Richard Bohringer, and José Garcia, who bring their characters to life in the original French language. Despite a modest budget of 4.0 million dollars, the film managed to rake in an impressive revenue of 29.5 million dollars, proving to be a success both critically and commercially.

title = Sinbad and the Eye of the Tiger 
overview = Princess Farah refuses to marry Sinbad until Prince Kassim, her brother, is able to give his consent. However, the Prince's wicked stepmother, Queen Zenobia, has changed Kassim into a baboon in order to have her own son crowned as caliph. Sinbad, his crew, the Princess and the transformed Prince travel to a distant land, fighting every obstacle Zenobia places in their path, to seek the advice of a legendary wise man who can possibly tell how to end the spell. 
date of release = the 15 of July 1977 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
Director = Sam Wanamaker 
average note = 6.3 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures 
tagline = New!! Sinbad's Boldest And Most Daring Adventure! 
duration of the movie = 1h53 
Producer = Ray Harryhausen 
budget = 3.5 millions of dollars 
revenue = 16.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 15 of July 1977 

Embark on a thrilling adventure with "Sinbad and the Eye of the Tiger" as Princess Farah, determined to save her brother Prince Kassim from a wicked spell, joins forces with the legendary sailor Sinbad. Directed by Sam Wanamaker and produced by Ray Harryhausen, this 1977 United Kingdom production by Columbia Pictures takes you on a journey filled with action and magic. As Sinbad and his crew battle Queen Zenobia's obstacles to seek the advice of a wise man, they must race against time to break the curse before it's too late. With a tagline promising Sinbad's boldest and most daring adventure, this film, with an average rating of 6.3, is a classic tale of courage and heroism.

The movie "Sinbad and the Eye of the Tiger" was released on the 15th of July 1977. It has a runtime of 1 hour and 53 minutes. The production budget for the film was 3.5 million dollars, and it went on to generate 16.0 million dollars in revenue.
