title = Duplicate 
overview = Bablu (Shah Rukh Khan), an aspiring chef, works in a hotel where Sonia Kapoor,(Juhi) works with him as banquet manager at the restaurant. His look-alike Manu (Shah Rukh Khan), a gangster, robs a bank along with his friend (Gulshan Grover) but gets caught. He comes out of prison and discovers that his cohort has double-crossed him. He murders his partner and escapes from the scene of the crime...without the money. Bablu stumbles on the money and keeps it. Manu's lover Lily (Sonali Bendre) mistakes Bablu to be Manu and spirits him away. Manu takes shelter in Bablu's house and realizes that he can use their resemblance to his advantage.Then starts the fun-ride with Babloo constantly being mistaken for Manu. With both Sonia and Lily after him, Manu furious and the Law taking him to be Manu, Babloo faces a tough time. And then, Manu kidnaps Bibi (Farida Jalal) Babloo's mother and holds her hostage. 
tagline = Double Dhamaka 
Producer = Karan Johar 
budget = 101.5 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Dharma Productions 
original language of the movie = Hindi 
cast = Shah Rukh Khan, Juhi Chawla, Sonali Bendre, Mohnish Behl 
production countrie = India 
Director = Mahesh Bhatt 
date of release = the 8 of May 1998 
duration of the movie = 2h46 
revenue = 168.3 millions of dollars 
average note = 5.6 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Double Dhamaka 

In the action-packed Bollywood film "Duplicate," Bablu, an aspiring chef portrayed by Shah Rukh Khan, finds himself in a whirlwind of events when he stumbles upon a bag of stolen money. Things take a wild turn when a gangster named Manu, also played by Shah Rukh Khan, who happens to be Bablu's doppelgänger, enters the scene. With mistaken identities, double-crossings, and a love triangle involving Sonia (Juhi Chawla) and Lily (Sonali Bendre), the movie takes the audience on a rollercoaster ride of comedy and suspense. As Manu uses their resemblance to his advantage, Bablu must navigate through a series of misunderstandings and dangerous situations. Directed by Mahesh Bhatt and produced by Karan Johar under Dharma Productions, "Duplicate" promises a double dose of entertainment with its tagline "Double Dhamaka." Will Bablu manage to outsmart Manu and save his mother from being held hostage? Find out in this 2 hours and 46 minutes long film released on the 8th of May 1998, which garnered a revenue of 168.3 million dollars against a budget of 101.5 million dollars. Starring Shah Rukh Khan, Juhi Chawla, Sonali Bendre, and Mohnish Behl, "Duplicate" is a Hindi-language movie that received an average rating of 5.6. The production company behind the film is Dharma Productions, it was produced in India, and the original language of the movie is Hindi. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']

title = The Girl 
overview = Director Alfred Hitchcock is revered as one of the greatest creative minds in the history of cinema. Known for his psychological thrillers, Hitchcock’s leading ladies were cool, beautiful and preferably blonde. One such actress was Tippi Hedren, an unknown fashion model given her big break when Hitchcock’s wife saw her on a TV commercial. Brought to Universal Studios, Hedren was shocked when the director, at the peak of his career, quickly cast her to star in his next feature, 1963’s The Birds. Little did Hedren know that as ambitious and terrifying as the production would be to shoot, the most daunting aspect of the film ended up coming from behind the camera. 
Producer = Amanda Jenks 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Amanda Jenks 

In "The Girl," a captivating film directed by the legendary Alfred Hitchcock and produced by Amanda Jenks, audiences are taken on a thrilling journey into the world of cinema. Focusing on the talented actress Tippi Hedren, who was plucked from obscurity by Hitchcock's keen eye, the movie delves into the behind-the-scenes drama of the making of the iconic 1963 film "The Birds." As Hedren navigates the challenges of working with the master of suspense himself, played by a brilliant actor, the true horror of the production unfolds in unexpected ways. With Amanda Jenks at the helm as producer, the English-language film offers a mesmerizing glimpse into the complexities of creativity and ambition in the golden age of Hollywood. The original language of the movie is English. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English

title = Around the World in 80 Days 
overview = A bet pits a British inventor, a Chinese thief and a French artist on a worldwide adventure that they can circle the globe in 80 days. 
revenue = 72.2 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Studio Babelsberg 
date of release = the 16 of June 2004 
production countrie = Germany 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 72.2 millions of dollars 

In "Around the World in 80 Days," a British inventor, a Chinese thief, and a French artist find themselves embarking on a global adventure due to a bet. The challenge? To circumnavigate the globe in just 80 days. Released on June 16, 2004, this film was produced by Studio Babelsberg in Germany and went on to gross an impressive $72.2 million at the box office. Join this unlikely trio as they race against time and obstacles in this thrilling and comedic journey that will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end.

Join this unlikely trio as they race against time and obstacles in this thrilling and comedic journey that will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end.

title = Stomp the Yard 
overview = After the death of his younger brother, a troubled 19-year-old street dancer from Los Angeles is able to bypass juvenile hall by enrolling in the historically black, Truth University in Atlanta, Georgia. But his efforts to get an education and woo the girl he likes are sidelined when he is courted by the top two campus fraternities, both of which want and need his fierce street-style dance moves to win the highly coveted national step show competition. 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 6.1 
duration of the movie = 1h54 
date of release = the 16 of May 2007 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the movie "Stomp the Yard," a 19-year-old street dancer from Los Angeles faces a challenging decision after the tragic loss of his younger brother. To avoid juvenile hall, he enrolls at Truth University in Atlanta, Georgia, where he navigates the competitive world of campus fraternities vying for victory in a national step show competition. Amidst his quest for education and romance, he must choose between the top two fraternities seeking his unique dance skills. Released on May 16, 2007, in English, this film has an average rating of 6.1 and runs for 1 hour and 54 minutes.

title = Battleground 
overview = The film concentrates on the camaraderie and the divisions between the troops as they ready for the big offensive. Told in a taut narrative, the men of the 101st, led by Van Johnson, wait out the winter in the Ardennes forest to confront the German army in what would be the last major offensive of World War II. The men are demoralized and trapped, with no hope of support from the Allies. 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 9 of November 1949 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = The First Great Picture Of The Second World War ! 
Producer = Dore Schary 
production compagnie = Loew's 
average note = 6.4 
duration of the movie = 1h58 
budget = 274.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the 1949 American film "Battleground," produced by Dore Schary under Loew's production company, viewers are taken on a gripping journey to the Ardennes forest during World War II. Led by Van Johnson, the men of the 101st division face the harsh winter conditions and prepare for a monumental offensive against the German army. As camaraderie and divisions among the troops unfold, the soldiers find themselves demoralized and trapped, with no hope of support from the Allies. This taut narrative captures the tension and bravery of the men as they confront the enemy in the last major offensive of the war. With an average rating of 6.4, this English-language film was released on November 9, 1949, and runs for 1 hour and 58 minutes. The tagline proudly declares it as "The First Great Picture Of The Second World War!"

The production country of "Battleground" is the United States of America, and the budget for the movie was 274.0 million dollars.

['correct']
fact : date of release = the 9 of November 1949

title = Mistress America 
overview = Tracy, a lonely college freshman in New York, is rescued from her solitude by her soon-to-be stepsister Brooke, an adventurous gal about town who entangles her in alluringly mad schemes. Mistress America is a comedy about dream-chasing, score-settling, makeshift families, and cat-stealing. 
production countrie = Brazil 
Producer = Noah Baumbach 
date of release = the 14 of August 2015 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = Brazil 

In "Mistress America," a comedy produced by Noah Baumbach, we follow Tracy, a lonely college freshman in New York, who finds herself drawn into the whirlwind world of her soon-to-be stepsister Brooke. Brooke, an adventurous and charismatic figure, introduces Tracy to a series of eccentric and daring escapades, including dream-chasing, score-settling, and even cat-stealing. Set against the backdrop of the bustling city, the film explores themes of friendship, family, and the pursuit of one's desires. Released on the 14th of August 2015, this Brazilian production is a delightful and quirky tale of two women navigating the complexities of life in the big city. The production country is Brazil.

In "Mistress America," a comedy produced by Noah Baumbach, we follow Tracy, a lonely college freshman in New York, who finds herself drawn into the whirlwind world of her soon-to-be stepsister Brooke. Brooke, an adventurous and charismatic figure, introduces Tracy to a series of eccentric and daring escapades, including dream-chasing, score-settling, and even cat-stealing. Set against the backdrop of the bustling city, the film explores themes of friendship, family, and the pursuit of one's desires. Released on the 14th of August 2015, this Brazilian production is a delightful and quirky tale of two women navigating the complexities of life in the big city. The production country is Brazil.

title = Mimic 
overview = A disease carried by common cockroaches is killing Manhattan children. In an effort to stop the epidemic an entomologist, Susan Tyler, creates a mutant breed of insect that secretes a fluid to kill the roaches. This mutant breed was engineered to die after one generation, but three years later Susan finds out that the species has survived and evolved into a large, gruesome monster that can mimic human form. 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 30.0 millions of dollars 
cast = Mira Sorvino, Jeremy Northam, Giancarlo Giannini, Josh Brolin 
average note = 5.7 
Producer = Ole Bornedal 
tagline = For thousands of years, man has been evolution's greatest creation... until now. 
duration of the movie = 1h45 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the heart of Manhattan, a deadly disease transmitted by common cockroaches is claiming the lives of children. Faced with this terrifying epidemic, renowned entomologist Susan Tyler takes matters into her own hands by genetically engineering a special breed of insect that produces a lethal fluid to eradicate the roaches. However, what was meant to be a temporary solution turns into a nightmare when Susan discovers that the mutant insects have not only survived but have evolved into monstrous creatures capable of mimicking human beings. As chaos ensues, Susan must race against time to stop the deadly creatures before they wreak havoc on the city. Starring Mira Sorvino, Jeremy Northam, Giancarlo Giannini, and Josh Brolin, "Mimic" is a gripping sci-fi horror film that will keep you on the edge of your seat. With a budget of 30 million dollars and a runtime of 1 hour and 45 minutes, this American production, produced by Ole Bornedal, delivers a chilling tale of evolution gone awry. The tagline "For thousands of years, man has been evolution's greatest creation... until now" sets the tone for this intense and thrilling movie experience, which has garnered an average rating of 5.7.

The movie "Mimic" was released in the United States of America.

title = This Boy’s Life 
overview = In 1957, a son and mother flee the East and an abusive boyfriend to find a new life, and end up in Seattle, where the mother meets a polite garage mechanic. The boy continually gets into trouble by hanging out with the wrong crowd. The mom marries the mechanic, but they soon find out that he's an abusive and unreasoning alcoholic, and they struggle to maintain hope in an impossible situation as the boy grows up with plans to escape the small town by any means possible. Based on a true story by Tobias Wolff. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the gripping drama "This Boy's Life," set in 1957, a mother and her son embark on a journey to escape abuse and start afresh in Seattle. However, their hopes for a better life are shattered when the mother falls for a seemingly kind garage mechanic who turns out to be a violent alcoholic. As the boy navigates the challenges of adolescence and dreams of leaving the small town behind, the family is trapped in a cycle of despair and turmoil. The mom marries the mechanic, but they soon find out that he's an abusive and unreasoning alcoholic. Based on a true story by Tobias Wolff, this film portrays the heartbreaking struggle for survival and escape in the face of overwhelming adversity.

title = Nowhere to Run 
overview = Escaped convict Sam Gillen single handedly takes on ruthless developers determined to evict Clydie - a widow with two young children. Nobody knows who Sam is. 
date of release = the 15 of January 1993 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 262.8 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 30.1 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 15 of January 1993 

In the action-packed film "Nowhere to Run," released on the 15th of January 1993, we follow escaped convict Sam Gillen as he bravely confronts heartless developers aiming to evict Clydie, a widowed mother of two. Set in the United States of America, this English-language movie showcases Sam's one-man mission against the ruthless forces threatening Clydie's home. With a budget of 30.1 million dollars, "Nowhere to Run" went on to generate an impressive revenue of 262.8 million dollars, proving to be a thrilling and financially successful cinematic venture.

With a budget of 30.1 million dollars, "Nowhere to Run" went on to generate an impressive revenue of 262.8 million dollars, proving to be a thrilling and financially successful cinematic venture.

title = Too Late the Hero 
overview = A WWII film set on a Pacific island. Japanese and allied forces occupy different parts of the island. When a group of British soldiers are sent on a mission behind enemy lines, things don't go exactly to plan. This film differs in that some of the 'heroes' are very reluctant, but they come good when they are pursued by the Japanese who are determined to prevent them returning to base. 
date of release = the 20 of May 1970 
cast = Michael Caine, Cliff Robertson, Henry Fonda, Ian Bannen 
duration of the movie = 2h25 
Director = Robert Aldrich 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 6.4 
production compagnie = ABC Pictures 
revenue = 125.7 millions of dollars 
Producer = Robert Aldrich 
budget = 6.2 millions of dollars 
tagline = War. It's a dying business. 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 20 of May 1970 

In the WWII film "Too Late the Hero," directed by Robert Aldrich, a group of British soldiers find themselves on a Pacific island occupied by Japanese and allied forces. As they are sent on a mission behind enemy lines, their reluctance to be heroes is put to the test when they are pursued by the determined Japanese forces. Starring Michael Caine, Cliff Robertson, Henry Fonda, and Ian Bannen, this action-packed movie was released on the 20th of May 1970 and runs for 2 hours and 25 minutes. With an average rating of 6.4, the film was produced by ABC Pictures in the United States of America. Despite its budget of 6.2 million dollars, "Too Late the Hero" managed to generate a revenue of 125.7 million dollars. The tagline "War. It's a dying business" sets the tone for this intense and gripping tale told in English.

title = Aguirre: The Wrath of God 
overview = A few decades after the destruction of the Inca empire, a Spanish expedition leaves the mountains of Peru and goes down the Amazon river in search of gold and wealth. Soon, they come across great difficulties and Don Aguirre, a ruthless man who cares only about riches, becomes their leader. But will his quest lead them to "the golden city", or to certain destruction? 
production compagnie = Werner Herzog Filmproduktion 
tagline = A breathtaking journey into the heart of darkness 
Director = Werner Herzog 
revenue = 273.6 millions of dollars 
cast = Klaus Kinski, Helena Rojo, Del Negro, Ruy Guerra 
Producer = Werner Herzog 
date of release = the 29 of December 1972 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Werner Herzog Filmproduktion 

In the epic film "Aguirre: The Wrath of God", directed by Werner Herzog and released on the 29th of December 1972, viewers are taken on a breathtaking journey into the heart of darkness. The story follows a Spanish expedition in search of gold and wealth along the Amazon river, led by the ruthless Don Aguirre, portrayed by Klaus Kinski. As the expedition faces great difficulties, including betrayal and treacherous conditions, the question arises: will their quest lead them to "the golden city", or to certain destruction? With a stellar cast including Klaus Kinski, Helena Rojo, Del Negro, and Ruy Guerra, this Werner Herzog Filmproduktion production grossed a whopping 273.6 million dollars at the box office, solidifying its place as a cinematic masterpiece.

With a stellar cast including Klaus Kinski, Helena Rojo, Del Negro, and Ruy Guerra, this Werner Herzog Filmproduktion production grossed a whopping 273.6 million dollars at the box office, solidifying its place as a cinematic masterpiece.

title = Traitor 
overview = When straight arrow FBI agent Roy Clayton heads up the investigation into a dangerous international conspiracy, all clues seem to lead back to former U.S. Special Operations officer, Samir Horn. 
average note = 6.6 
tagline = The truth is complicated. 
cast = Don Cheadle, Guy Pearce, Neal McDonough, Saïd Taghmaoui 
Producer = Don Cheadle 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 23 of August 2008 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.6 

In the 2008 English-language film "Traitor," FBI agent Roy Clayton finds himself at the center of a high-stakes investigation into an international conspiracy. As he delves deeper into the case, all signs point to Samir Horn, a former U.S. Special Operations officer played by Don Cheadle. With a stellar cast including Guy Pearce, Neal McDonough, and Saïd Taghmaoui, the movie explores the complexities of truth and loyalty. Produced by Don Cheadle, "Traitor" was released on the 23rd of August 2008, receiving an average rating of 6.6. As the tagline suggests, in this gripping thriller, the truth is indeed complicated.

With a stellar cast including Guy Pearce, Neal McDonough, and Saïd Taghmaoui, the movie explores the complexities of truth and loyalty. Produced by Don Cheadle, "Traitor" was released on the 23rd of August 2008, receiving an average rating of 6.6. As the tagline suggests, in this gripping thriller, the truth is indeed complicated.

title = Dead & Buried 
overview = After a series of gory murders commited by mobs of townspeople against visiting tourists, the corpses appear to be coming back to life and living normally as locals in the small town. 
revenue = 0.2 millions of dollars

In the chilling movie "Dead & Buried," a small town is plagued by a series of gruesome murders committed by its own residents against unsuspecting tourists. As the bodies of the victims mysteriously come back to life, they seamlessly integrate into the community, posing a terrifying threat to the town's inhabitants. With a runtime of 1 hour and 34 minutes, this eerie tale unfolds as the revenants navigate their new lives among the living. Despite its haunting premise, "Dead & Buried" managed to earn a revenue of 0.2 million dollars, solidifying its status as a cult classic in the horror genre.

title = The Event 
overview = In August 1991 a failed coup d'état attempt (known as Putsch) led by a group of hard-core communists in Moscow, ended the 70-year-long rule of the Soviets. The USSR collapsed soon after, and the tricolour of the sovereign Russian Federation flew over Kremlin. As president Gorbachev was detained by the coup leaders, state-run TV and radio channels, usurped by the putschists, broadcast Tchaikovsky's "Swan Lake" instead of news bulletins, and crowds of protestors gathered around Moscow's White House, preparing to defend the stronghold of democratic opposition led by Boris Yeltsin, in the city of Leningrad thousands of confused, scared, excited and desperate people poured into the streets to become a part of the event, which was supposed to change their destiny. A quarter of a century later, Sergei Loznitsa revisits the dramatic moments of August 1991 and casts an eye on the event which was hailed worldwide as the birth of "Russian democracy". 
date of release = the 2 of September 2015 
Producer = Andrey Eshpay 
production compagnie = Filmstudio Demarsh 
production countrie = Russia 
cast = Chulpan Khamatova, Igor Gordin, Sergey Perelygin, Yevgeniya Simonova 
Director = Sergey Loznitsa 
duration of the movie = 1h14 
tagline = Three days that shook the world or much ado about nothing? 
average note = 5.0 
revenue = 160.1 millions of dollars 
budget = 89.2 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = Russian 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 2 of September 2015 

In "The Event," a gripping portrayal of the failed coup d'état attempt in Moscow in August 1991, viewers are taken on a journey through the dramatic moments that led to the collapse of the USSR and the rise of the Russian Federation. As President Gorbachev is detained, chaos ensues with state-run media broadcasting "Swan Lake" instead of news bulletins. The film captures the confusion, fear, excitement, and desperation of the people as they pour into the streets, ready to defend their democratic opposition led by Boris Yeltsin. Directed by Sergey Loznitsa and featuring a talented cast including Chulpan Khamatova, Igor Gordin, Sergey Perelygin, and Yevgeniya Simonova, "The Event" revisits a pivotal moment in history that was hailed as the birth of "Russian democracy." With a tagline asking whether it was "Three days that shook the world or much ado about nothing?" this Russian-language film released on September 2, 2015, by Filmstudio Demarsh is a must-watch. Despite its average note of 5.0, the movie managed to generate an impressive revenue of 160.1 million dollars against a budget of 89.2 million dollars. The production company behind this historical drama is Filmstudio Demarsh, and it was produced in Russia. The duration of the movie is 1 hour and 14 minutes, and the original language of the movie is Russian.

title = The War Lord 
overview = A knight in the service of a duke goes to a coastal villiage where an earlier attempt to build a defensive castle has failed. He begins to rebuild the duke's authority in the face of the barbarians at the border and is making progress until he falls in love with one of the local women. 
duration of the movie = 2h03 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 5.9 
tagline = He Battled Two Empires For The Love Of One Woman. 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Charlton Heston, Rosemary Forsyth, Richard Boone, Maurice Evans 
revenue = 44.9 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 2h03 

In "The War Lord," a knight in the service of a duke ventures to a coastal village to rebuild a failed defensive castle and restore the duke's authority against barbarian threats at the border. As he makes progress in his mission, he unexpectedly falls in love with a local woman, jeopardizing his loyalty and duty. Starring Charlton Heston, Rosemary Forsyth, Richard Boone, and Maurice Evans, this English-language film produced by Universal Pictures takes viewers on a journey of love, loyalty, and power struggles. With an average rating of 5.9, this 2-hour and 3-minute epic tale grossed an impressive $44.9 million at the box office, captivating audiences with the tagline, "He Battled Two Empires For The Love Of One Woman." The production company behind this movie is Universal Pictures, and it was filmed in the United States of America.

fact : production compagnie = Universal Pictures 

In "The War Lord," a knight in the service of a duke ventures to a coastal village to rebuild a failed defensive castle and restore the duke's authority against barbarian threats at the border. As he makes progress in his mission, he unexpectedly falls in love with a local woman, jeopardizing his loyalty and duty. Starring Charlton Heston, Rosemary Forsyth, Richard Boone, and Maurice Evans, this English-language film produced by Universal Pictures takes viewers on a journey of love, loyalty, and power struggles. With an average rating of 5.9, this 2-hour and 3-minute epic tale grossed an impressive $44.9 million at the box office, captivating audiences with the tagline, "He Battled Two Empires For The Love Of One Woman." The production company behind this movie is Universal Pictures, and it was filmed in the United States of America.

title = The Assassination of Richard Nixon 
overview = It’s 1974 and Sam Bicke has lost everything. His wife leaves him with his three kids, his boss fires him, his brother turns away from him, and the bank won’t give him any money to start anew. He tries to find someone to blame for his misfortunes and comes up with the President of the United States who he plans to murder. 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 3.5 millions of dollars 
budget = 123.8 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.4 
production compagnie = Monsoon Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "The Assassination of Richard Nixon," set in 1974, we follow the story of Sam Bicke who, after losing everything in his life, including his family and job, seeks someone to blame for his misfortunes. Blaming the President of the United States, he devises a plan to murder him. This English-language film was produced in the United States of America by Monsoon Pictures. Despite its budget of 123.8 million dollars, the movie managed to generate a revenue of 3.5 million dollars. With an average rating of 6.4, this gripping drama delves into the depths of one man's unraveling psyche.

title = The Aviator 
overview = A biopic depicting the life of filmmaker and aviation pioneer Howard Hughes from 1927 to 1947, during which time he became a successful film producer and an aviation magnate, while simultaneously growing more unstable due to severe obsessive-compulsive disorder. 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Miramax Films 
budget = 116.0 millions of dollars 
tagline = For some men, the sky was the limit. For him, it was just the beginning. 
average note = 7.0 
revenue = 102.0 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 2h50 
Director = Martin Scorsese 
cast = Leonardo DiCaprio, Cate Blanchett, Kate Beckinsale, John C. Reilly 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the biographical film "The Aviator," directed by Martin Scorsese, viewers are taken on a journey through the life of Howard Hughes, a renowned filmmaker and aviation pioneer. Spanning from 1927 to 1947, the movie showcases Hughes' rise to success as a film producer and aviation magnate, all while battling severe obsessive-compulsive disorder. Portrayed by Leonardo DiCaprio, Hughes' story unfolds against the backdrop of the United States of America, where his ambitions knew no bounds. With a budget of 116.0 million dollars, the film was produced by Miramax Films and received critical acclaim, earning an average rating of 7.0. The star-studded cast includes Cate Blanchett, Kate Beckinsale, and John C. Reilly. As Hughes reaches for the skies, his journey proves that for some men, the sky was the limit, but for him, it was just the beginning. The movie's tagline reads, "For some men, the sky was the limit. For him, it was just the beginning." The original language of the movie is English, and it has a duration of 2 hours and 50 minutes. The film grossed 102.0 million dollars in revenue, solidifying its success in the box office.

As Hughes reaches for the skies, his journey proves that for some men, the sky was the limit, but for him, it was just the beginning. The movie's tagline reads, "For some men, the sky was the limit. For him, it was just the beginning." The original language of the movie is English, and it has a duration of 2 hours and 50 minutes. The film grossed 102.0 million dollars in revenue, solidifying its success in the box office.

fact : date of release = the 17 of December 2004 

In the biographical film "The Aviator," directed by Martin Scorsese, viewers are taken on a journey through the life of Howard Hughes, a renowned filmmaker and aviation pioneer. Spanning from 1927 to 1947, the movie showcases Hughes' rise to success as a film producer and aviation magnate, all while battling severe obsessive-compulsive disorder. Portrayed by Leonardo DiCaprio, Hughes' story unfolds against the backdrop of the United States of America, where his ambitions knew no bounds. With a budget of 116.0 million dollars, the film was produced by Miramax Films and received critical acclaim, earning an average rating of 7.0. For him, it was just the beginning." The original language of the movie is English, and it has a duration of 2 hours and 50 minutes. production compagnie = Merchant Ivory Productions 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 16.0 millions of dollars 
average note = 5.3 
Director = James Ivory 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 4 of September 1996

fact : Producer = David L. Wolper 

In "Surviving Picasso," produced by David L. Wolper under Merchant Ivory Productions, viewers are immersed in the passionate drama depicting the tumultuous relationship between Pablo Picasso and Francoise Gilot. Directed by James Ivory, the film delves into Gilot's resilience as the only lover strong enough to endure Picasso's cruelty and ultimately move forward with her life. title = RockNRolla 
overview = When a Russian mobster sets up a real estate scam that generates millions of pounds, various members of London's criminal underworld pursue their share of the fortune. Various shady characters, including Mr One-Two, Stella the accountant, and Johnny Quid, a druggie rock-star, try to claim their slice. 
Producer = Guy Ritchie 
Director = Guy Ritchie 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
cast = Mark Strong, Tom Wilkinson, Toby Kebbell, Gerard Butler 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Guy Ritchie 

In "RockNRolla," a gripping crime thriller directed and produced by the talented Guy Ritchie, the streets of London become a battleground as a Russian mobster orchestrates a lucrative real estate scheme, leading to a frenzy among the city's criminal elite to secure their piece of the pie. Mark Strong, Tom Wilkinson, Toby Kebbell, and Gerard Butler deliver stellar performances as various shady characters vying for their share of the fortune. As tensions rise and alliances shift, the fast-paced narrative keeps viewers on the edge of their seats in this United Kingdom production. Don't miss the electrifying performances and intricate plot twists in this high-stakes game of greed and betrayal. The movie features a character named Mr One-Two, Stella the accountant, and Johnny Quid, a druggie rock-star. Guy Ritchie serves as both the producer and director of the film.

title = Field of Dreams 
overview = Ray Kinsella is an Iowa farmer who hears a mysterious voice telling him to turn his cornfield into a baseball diamond. He does, but the voice's directions don't stop -- even after the spirits of deceased ballplayers turn up to play. 
date of release = the 21 of April 1989 
Director = Phil Alden Robinson 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = If you believe the impossible, the incredible can come true. 
cast = Kevin Costner, Amy Madigan, Gaby Hoffmann, Ray Liotta 
revenue = 84.4 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h47 
production compagnie = Universal Studios 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 254.2 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.1 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 21 of April 1989 

In the 1989 film "Field of Dreams," directed by Phil Alden Robinson, Iowa farmer Ray Kinsella, portrayed by Kevin Costner, hears a mysterious voice instructing him to transform his cornfield into a baseball diamond. Despite skepticism, Ray follows the guidance, leading to the appearance of deceased ballplayers on the field. As the supernatural events unfold, including the involvement of Amy Madigan, Gaby Hoffmann, and Ray Liotta, the film explores themes of belief and the extraordinary. With a tagline stating, "If you believe the impossible, the incredible can come true," this English-language production from Universal Studios captures the essence of chasing dreams and embracing the unknown. With a runtime of 1 hour and 47 minutes, "Field of Dreams" grossed $84.4 million at the box office, against a budget of $25.2 million, and received an average rating of 7.1. The movie was released on the 21st of April 1989 in the United States of America. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Phil Alden Robinson

With a runtime of 1 hour and 47 minutes, "Field of Dreams" grossed $84.4 million at the box office, against a budget of $25.2 million, and received an average rating of 7.1. The movie was released on the 21st of April 1989 in the United States of America. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = If you believe the impossible, the incredible can come true. 

In the 1989 film "Field of Dreams," directed by Phil Alden Robinson, Iowa farmer Ray Kinsella, portrayed by Kevin Costner, hears a mysterious voice instructing him to transform his cornfield into a baseball diamond. Despite skepticism, Ray follows the guidance, leading to the appearance of deceased ballplayers on the field. As the supernatural events unfold, including the involvement of Amy Madigan, Gaby Hoffmann, and Ray Liotta, the film explores themes of belief and the extraordinary. With a tagline stating, "If you believe the impossible, the incredible can come true," this English-language production from Universal Studios captures the essence of chasing dreams and embracing the unknown. With a runtime of 1 hour and 47 minutes, "Field of Dreams" grossed $84.4 million at the box office, against a budget of $25.2 million, and received an average rating of 7.1. The movie was released on the 21st of April 1989 in the United States of America.

title = The Hunchback of Notre Dame II 
overview = Now that Frollo is gone, Quasimodo rings the bell with the help of his new friend and Esmeralda's and Phoebus' little son, Zephyr. But when Quasi stops by a traveling circus owned by evil magician Sarousch, he falls for Madellaine, Sarouch's assistant. 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "The Hunchback of Notre Dame II," set in English, we follow Quasimodo as he navigates life after Frollo's demise. With the assistance of his new friend Zephyr, the son of Esmeralda and Phoebus, Quasi continues to ring the bell. However, his world is turned upside down when he encounters the captivating Madellaine while visiting a malevolent magician's traveling circus. As Quasimodo finds himself drawn to Madellaine, he must confront the sinister intentions of Sarousch, the circus owner, putting his loyalty and love to the test.

title = The Forgotten 
overview = Telly Paretta is a grieving mother struggling to cope with the loss of her 8-year-old son. She is stunned when her psychiatrist reveals that she has created eight years of memories about a son she never had. But when she meets a man who has had a similar experience, Telly embarks on a search to prove her son's existence, and her sanity. 
average note = 5.5 
cast = Julianne Moore, Anthony Edwards, Jessica Hecht, Christopher Kovaleski 
Producer = Bruce Cohen 
duration of the movie = 1h31 
budget = 42.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 24 of September 2004 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 117.6 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = You'll Never Forget The Ones You Love 
Director = Joseph Ruben 
production compagnie = Revolution Studios 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : average note = 5.5 

In "The Forgotten," grieving mother Telly Paretta, portrayed by Julianne Moore, is struggling to cope with the loss of her 8-year-old son. Her world is turned upside down when her psychiatrist reveals that she has fabricated eight years of memories about a son that never existed. Determined to prove her son's existence and her own sanity, Telly teams up with a man who shares a similar experience. Directed by Joseph Ruben and produced by Bruce Cohen, this psychological thriller takes viewers on a gripping journey as Telly delves into the mystery surrounding her son. With a talented cast including Anthony Edwards and Jessica Hecht, "The Forgotten" keeps audiences on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 31-minute runtime. Released on September 24, 2004, in the United States, the film garnered a revenue of 117.6 million dollars against a budget of 42.0 million dollars. The tagline "You'll Never Forget The Ones You Love" resonates throughout this captivating tale of memory, loss, and the search for truth. The production company behind the movie is Revolution Studios, and the original language of the film is English.

With a talented cast including Anthony Edwards and Jessica Hecht, "The Forgotten" keeps audiences on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 31-minute runtime. Released on September 24, 2004, in the United States, the film garnered a revenue of 117.6 million dollars against a budget of 42.0 million dollars. The tagline "You'll Never Forget The Ones You Love" resonates throughout this captivating tale of memory, loss, and the search for truth. The production company behind the movie is Revolution Studios, and the original language of the film is English. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Revolution Studios 

In "The Forgotten," grieving mother Telly Paretta, portrayed by Julianne Moore, is struggling to cope with the loss of her 8-year-old son. Her world is turned upside down when her psychiatrist reveals that she has fabricated eight years of memories about a son that never existed. Determined to prove her son's existence and her own sanity, Telly teams up with a man who shares a similar experience. Directed by Joseph Ruben and produced by Bruce Cohen, this psychological thriller takes viewers on a gripping journey as Telly delves into the mystery surrounding her son. With a talented cast including Anthony Edwards and Jessica Hecht, "The Forgotten" keeps audiences on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 31-minute runtime. Released on September 24, 2004, in the United States, the film garnered a revenue of 117.6 million dollars against a budget of 42.0 million dollars. The tagline "You'll Never Forget The Ones You Love" resonates throughout this captivating tale of memory, loss, and the search for truth. The production company behind the movie is Revolution Studios, and the original language of the film is English. 
 
 

 
title = The Messengers 2: The Scarecrow 
overview = The family man farmer John Rollins is stressed with his financial situation: the crows and the lack of irrigation are destroying his crop of corn; the bank is near closure of his mortgage; he does not have credit to fix the water pump or to buy seeds; and his marriage is in crisis and his wife Mary is giving too much attention to her friend Tommy. When John accidentally discovers a hidden compartment in the barn, he finds a creepy scarecrow but his son Michael makes him promise to destroy it. However, his neighbor Jude Weatherby visits him, gives a six-pack of beer to the abstemious John and convinces him to put the scarecrow in the cornfield. Out of the blue, the life of John changes: the crows die; the pump works again irrigating the land; and the banker responsible for the closure has an accident and dies. However, he feels that his land is possessed by something evil that is threatening his beloved family. 
duration of the movie = 1h34 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h34 

In "The Messengers 2: The Scarecrow," farmer John Rollins is facing numerous challenges on his farm, from financial struggles to crop destruction. When he stumbles upon a sinister scarecrow hidden in his barn, strange and dark events begin to unfold. With the scarecrow's presence, John's luck seems to turn around as the crows disappear, the water pump starts working, and even his troublesome banker meets a grim fate. However, John soon realizes that these improvements come at a terrifying cost, as he becomes convinced that an evil force has taken hold of his land, putting his family in grave danger. As the tension rises, John must confront the malevolent entity before it's too late. With a runtime of 1 hour and 34 minutes, this chilling tale of supernatural terror will keep you on the edge of your seat.

title = Buried 
overview = Paul is a U.S. truck driver working in Iraq. After an attack by a group of Iraqis he wakes to find he is buried alive inside a coffin. With only a lighter and a cell phone it's a race against time to escape this claustrophobic death trap. 
Producer = Peter Safran 
production compagnie = Studio 37 
cast = Ryan Reynolds, José Luis García Pérez, Robert Paterson, Stephen Tobolowsky 
Director = Rodrigo Cortés 
production countrie = Spain 
budget = 2.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Peter Safran 

In the heart-pounding thriller "Buried," directed by Rodrigo Cortés and produced by Peter Safran for Studio 37, we follow the harrowing journey of Paul, a U.S. truck driver working in Iraq. After a brutal attack leaves him buried alive in a coffin, Paul must rely on just a lighter and a cell phone to navigate his way out of this claustrophobic death trap. With a stellar cast including Ryan Reynolds, José Luis García Pérez, Robert Paterson, and Stephen Tobolowsky, the tension rises as time ticks away. Set against the backdrop of Spain and with a budget of 2.0 million dollars, "Buried" is a gripping tale of survival that will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end.

title = Hatchet II 
overview = Picking up right where the original ended, Marybeth escapes the clutches of the deformed, swamp-dwelling iconic killer Victor Crowley. After learning the truth about her family’s connection to the hatchet-wielding madman, Marybeth returns to the Louisiana swamps along with an army of hunters to recover the bodies of her family and exact the bloodiest revenge against the bayou butcher.

title = Turkish Delight 
overview = Sort of a cross between "Love Story" and an earthy Rembrandt painting, this movie stars Rutger Hauer as a gifted Dutch sculptor who has a stormy, erotic, and star-crossed romance with a beautiful young girl. The story follows the arc of their relationship and his interaction with her family. 
tagline = Turkish Delight is a cross between Love Story and Last Tango in Paris! 
duration of the movie = 1h52 
budget = 66.6 millions of dollars 
production countrie = Netherlands 
date of release = the 22 of February 1973 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Turkish Delight is a cross between Love Story and Last Tango in Paris! 

In the visually captivating film "Turkish Delight," viewers are taken on a tumultuous journey through the passionate and turbulent romance between a talented Dutch sculptor, played by Rutger Hauer, and a stunning young woman. Reminiscent of a blend between "Love Story" and a raw Rembrandt painting, the movie delves into the stormy and erotic dynamics of their relationship, set against the backdrop of the Netherlands. As the story unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 52 minutes, audiences witness the intricate interplay between love, art, and family. With a budget of 66.6 million dollars, this Dutch production was released on the 22nd of February 1973, leaving a lasting impression on all who experience its intense and unforgettable narrative. As the tagline suggests, "Turkish Delight" is indeed a cross between "Love Story" and "Last Tango in Paris," offering a unique and captivating cinematic experience. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h52

As the story unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 52 minutes, audiences witness the intricate interplay between love, art, and family. With a budget of 66.6 million dollars, this Dutch production was released on the 22nd of February 1973, leaving a lasting impression on all who experience its intense and unforgettable narrative. As the tagline suggests, "Turkish Delight" is indeed a cross between "Love Story" and "Last Tango in Paris," offering a unique and captivating cinematic experience.

title = Henry Poole Is Here 
overview = Henry Poole abandons his fiancée and family business to spend what he believes are his remaining days alone. The discovery of a 'miracle' by a nosy neighbor ruptures his solitude and restores his faith in life. 
Producer = Tom Rosenberg 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Tom Rosenberg 

In the heartwarming film "Henry Poole Is Here," produced by Tom Rosenberg, we follow the journey of Henry Poole as he makes a drastic decision to abandon his fiancée and family business, seeking solitude in what he believes are his final days. However, his plans for isolation are disrupted when a curious neighbor, played by a talented cast member, stumbles upon a 'miracle' that challenges his beliefs and ultimately restores his faith in life. Join Henry Poole on a poignant and uplifting tale of rediscovery and the unexpected miracles that can change our perspective on life.

title = The Elephant Man 
overview = A Victorian surgeon rescues a heavily disfigured man being mistreated by his "owner" as a side-show freak. Behind his monstrous façade, there is revealed a person of great intelligence and sensitivity. Based on the true story of Joseph Merrick (called John Merrick in the film), a severely deformed man in 19th century London. 
tagline = I am not an animal! I am a human being! I... am... a man! 
cast = Anthony Hopkins, John Hurt, Anne Bancroft, John Gielgud 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
Producer = Jonathan Sanger 
date of release = the 2 of October 1980 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = I am not an animal! I am a human being! I... am... a man! 

In the heart-wrenching film "The Elephant Man," based on the true story of Joseph Merrick (John Merrick in the film), viewers are taken on a journey through the life of a severely disfigured man in 19th century London. A Victorian surgeon, portrayed by Anthony Hopkins, comes to the rescue of the mistreated man, played by John Hurt, who is exploited as a side-show freak. As the story unfolds, the audience discovers the remarkable intelligence and sensitivity hidden behind the monstrous exterior of John Merrick. With a stellar cast including Anne Bancroft and John Gielgud, this English-language production from the United Kingdom, produced by Jonathan Sanger, delivers a powerful message about humanity and compassion. Released on the 2nd of October 1980, the tagline "I am not an animal! I am a human being! I... am... a man!" echoes the poignant plea for understanding and acceptance at the core of this unforgettable tale. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Anthony Hopkins, John Hurt, Anne Bancroft, John Gielgud

title = The Negotiator 
overview = The police try to arrest expert hostage negotiator Danny Roman, who insists he's being framed for his partner's murder in what he believes is an elaborate conspiracy. Thinking there's evidence in the Internal Affairs offices that might clear him, he takes everyone in the office hostage and demands that another well-known negotiator be brought in to handle the situation and secretly investigate the conspiracy. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : budget = 50.0 millions of dollars 

In the intense thriller "The Negotiator," expert hostage negotiator Danny Roman finds himself in a high-stakes situation when he becomes the prime suspect in his partner's murder. Convinced that he is being framed as part of a larger conspiracy, Roman takes drastic measures by taking the Internal Affairs office hostage. With tensions running high, he demands the presence of another renowned negotiator to assist in uncovering the truth behind the elaborate setup. As the suspense builds and secrets unravel, Roman must navigate a dangerous game of deception to prove his innocence and expose the real culprits. 

Facts included in the description:
1. Danny Roman is an expert hostage negotiator.
2. Danny Roman is framed for his partner's murder.
3. He believes he is part of an elaborate conspiracy.
4. He takes the Internal Affairs office hostage.
5. He demands another well-known negotiator to handle the situation.
6. The movie is an intense thriller.
7. The plot involves a dangerous game of deception.
8. Roman's goal is to prove his innocence and expose the real culprits.

['wrong']

With tensions running high, he demands the presence of another renowned negotiator to assist in uncovering the truth behind the elaborate setup. title = The Girl He Left Behind 
overview = A young man is drafted and goes through the rigors of basic training, ultimately discovering the experience is also character-building. Director David Butler's 1956 film stars '50s teen favorites Tab Hunter and Natalie Wood, with supporting roles played by Jim Backus, Jessie Royce Landis, Murray Hamilton, Henry Jones, James Garner, Alan King, Ernestine Wade, David Janssen and Raymond Bailey. 
production compagnie = Warner Bros. 
Director = David Butler 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Warner Bros. 

In the 1956 film "The Girl He Left Behind," directed by David Butler and produced by Warner Bros., a young man is drafted into the military and undergoes the challenges of basic training. As he navigates the rigorous training, he not only learns the skills necessary for service but also undergoes significant character development. The movie features a stellar cast including '50s teen favorites Tab Hunter and Natalie Wood, along with talented actors such as Jim Backus, Jessie Royce Landis, Murray Hamilton, Henry Jones, James Garner, Alan King, Ernestine Wade, David Janssen, and Raymond Bailey.

title = Eragon 
overview = In his homeland of Alagaesia, a farm boy happens upon a dragon's egg -- a discovery that leads him on a predestined journey where he realized he's the one person who can defend his home against an evil king. 
date of release = the 14 of December 2006 
budget = 100.0 millions of dollars 
cast = Ed Speleers, Jeremy Irons, Sienna Guillory, Robert Carlyle 
production compagnie = Ingenious Film Partners 
Director = Stefen Fangmeier 
Producer = John Davis 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = As darkness falls, the last dragon will choose its rider. 
revenue = 249.3 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 14 of December 2006 

In the fantasy film "Eragon," released on the 14th of December 2006, viewers are transported to the mystical land of Alagaesia where a young farm boy stumbles upon a dragon's egg. This unexpected discovery sets him on a fateful journey, revealing his true destiny as the chosen defender against an evil king. Directed by Stefen Fangmeier and produced by John Davis under the Ingenious Film Partners production company, the movie boasts a talented cast including Ed Speleers, Jeremy Irons, Sienna Guillory, and Robert Carlyle. With a budget of 100.0 million dollars, the film mesmerizes audiences with its stunning visuals and captivating storyline, all unfolding in the original English language. As the tagline ominously declares, "As darkness falls, the last dragon will choose its rider." "Eragon" proved to be a commercial success, raking in a revenue of 249.3 million dollars.

title = Every Girl Should Be Married 
overview = Anabel Sims is determined to find the perfect husband. She thinks she's found her man in Madison Brown, a handsome pediatrician. She then prepares an elaborate scheme to trap him into marriage 
date of release = the 25 of December 1948 
Director = Don Hartman 
budget = 30.8 millions of dollars 
cast = Cary Grant, Franchot Tone, Betsy Drake, Diana Lynn 
duration of the movie = 1h25 
revenue = 179.4 millions of dollars 
Producer = Don Hartman 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 6.3 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 25 of December 1948 

In the classic romantic comedy "Every Girl Should Be Married," Anabel Sims, played by the charming Betsy Drake, is on a mission to find the perfect husband. Set in the United States of America, this film directed by Don Hartman follows Anabel as she sets her sights on the handsome pediatrician, Madison Brown, portrayed by Cary Grant. With a budget of 30.8 million dollars, the movie was released on December 25, 1948, and went on to gross an impressive 179.4 million dollars at the box office. As Anabel devises an elaborate scheme to ensnare Madison into marriage, the audience is taken on a delightful 1 hour and 25-minute journey filled with laughter and love. Joined by a talented cast including Franchot Tone and Diana Lynn, "Every Girl Should Be Married" received an average rating of 6.3, making it a must-watch for fans of classic romantic comedies. The producer of the film is Don Hartman. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Don Hartman 

In the classic romantic comedy "Every Girl Should Be Married," Anabel Sims, played by the charming Betsy Drake, is on a mission to find the perfect husband. Set in the United States of America, this film directed by Don Hartman follows Anabel as she sets her sights on the handsome pediatrician, Madison Brown, portrayed by Cary Grant. With a budget of 30.8 million dollars, the movie was released on December 25, 1948, and went on to gross an impressive 179.4 million dollars at the box office. As Anabel devises an elaborate scheme to ensnare Madison into marriage, the audience is taken on a delightful 1 hour and 25-minute journey filled with laughter and love. Joined by a talented cast including Franchot Tone and Diana Lynn, "Every Girl Should Be Married" received an average rating of 6.3, making it a must-watch for fans of classic romantic comedies. The producer of the film is Don Hartman.

In "Phenomena," directed by Dario Argento, a young girl with a unique ability to communicate with insects is sent to an exclusive Swiss boarding school. Her extraordinary talent becomes crucial in solving a series of murders that have taken place in the area. With a runtime of 1 hour and 56 minutes, this English-language film produced by DACFILM Rome has garnered a revenue of 241.5 million dollars. The tagline "When Insects Attack!" sets the tone for this thrilling mystery. Starring Jennifer Connelly, Donald Pleasence, Daria Nicolodi, and Patrick Bauchau, the movie has received an average rating of 6.7. Despite its modest budget of 3.8 million dollars, "Phenomena" captivates audiences with its intriguing storyline and talented cast.

overview = Inventor Flint Lockwood creates a machine that makes clouds rain food, enabling the down-and-out citizens of Chewandswallow to feed themselves. tagline = Prepare to get served. 
date of release = the 17 of September 2009

In the whimsical animated film "Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs," inventor Flint Lockwood creates a miraculous machine that turns clouds into a source of nourishment for the struggling town of Chewandswallow. overview = Based on the legendary true story of the Red Dog who united a disparate local community while roaming the Australian outback in search of his long lost master. 
duration of the movie = 1h32 
tagline = He's Been Everywhere Mate. 
production countrie = Australia 
cast = Josh Lucas, Rachael Taylor, Rohan Nichol, Luke Ford 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h32 

In the heartwarming film "Red Dog," viewers are taken on a journey through the Australian outback as they follow the legendary true story of a loyal canine who goes by the name Red Dog. This furry protagonist embarks on a quest to find his long-lost master, all while managing to bring together a diverse local community along the way. With a runtime of 1 hour and 32 minutes, this Australian production showcases the talents of actors such as Josh Lucas, Rachael Taylor, Rohan Nichol, and Luke Ford. As the tagline suggests, Red Dog truly has been everywhere, mate. The movie was produced in Australia.

['correct']
fact : tagline = He's Been Everywhere Mate. 

In the heartwarming film "Red Dog," viewers are taken on a journey through the Australian outback as they follow the legendary true story of a loyal canine who goes by the name Red Dog. This furry protagonist embarks on a quest to find his long-lost master, all while managing to bring together a diverse local community along the way. With a runtime of 1 hour and 32 minutes, this Australian production showcases the talents of actors such as Josh Lucas, Rachael Taylor, Rohan Nichol, and Luke Ford. As the tagline suggests, Red Dog truly has been everywhere, mate. The movie was produced in Australia.

title = They 
overview = After witnessing a horrific and traumatic event, Julia Lund, a graduate student in psychology, gradually comes to the realization that everything which scared her as a child could be real. And what's worse, it might be coming back to get her.. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : Producer = Tom Engelman 

In the psychological thriller "They," graduate student Julia Lund is forced to confront her deepest fears after experiencing a terrifying event. As she delves deeper into her own psyche, she begins to question the reality of the things that once haunted her as a child. Now, faced with the chilling possibility that her childhood terrors may be resurfacing to harm her, Julia must navigate a terrifying journey into the unknown to protect herself from the looming threat. The movie is titled "They" and it follows Julia Lund, a graduate student in psychology, who gradually realizes that everything that scared her as a child could be real, and that it might be coming back to get her.

title = Belle de Jour 
overview = Beautiful young housewife Séverine Serizy cannot reconcile her masochistic fantasies with her everyday life alongside dutiful husband Pierre. When her lovestruck friend Henri mentions a secretive high-class brothel run by Madame Anais, Séverine begins to work there during the day under the name Belle de Jour. But when one of her clients grows possessive, she must try to go back to her normal life. 
revenue = 221.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 221.0 millions of dollars 

In the captivating film "Belle de Jour," we follow the story of Séverine Serizy, a stunning housewife who grapples with her inner desires and societal expectations. Unable to fully embrace her masochistic fantasies within her marriage to Pierre, Séverine embarks on a daring double life. Encouraged by her friend Henri, she enters the clandestine world of a high-class brothel, assuming the alluring persona of Belle de Jour during the day. As Séverine navigates this risky new venture, she finds herself entangled in a dangerous game of possessiveness with one of her clients. Will she be able to extricate herself from this perilous situation and return to her ordinary existence? With a staggering revenue of 221.0 million dollars, "Belle de Jour" is a mesmerizing exploration of desire, identity, and the consequences of indulging in forbidden pleasures.

title = Boyka: Undisputed IV 
overview = In the fourth installment of the fighting franchise, Boyka is shooting for the big leagues when an accidental death in the ring makes him question everything he stands for. When he finds out the wife of the man he accidentally killed is in trouble, Boyka offers to fight in a series of impossible battles to free her from a life of servitude 
date of release = the 1 of August 2016 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 1 of August 2016 

In "Boyka: Undisputed IV," released on August 1, 2016, the titular character, Boyka, is at a crossroads in his fighting career after a tragic incident in the ring forces him to reevaluate his values. When he learns that the wife of the man he unintentionally killed is in dire straits, Boyka makes a bold decision to participate in a series of grueling battles in order to secure her freedom from a life of servitude. As he strives to make amends and seek redemption, Boyka faces insurmountable challenges that will test his physical prowess and moral compass. The movie follows Boyka as he aims to enter the big leagues of fighting, all while dealing with the consequences of an accidental death that lead him to question his beliefs and purpose in the ring.

As he strives to make amends and seek redemption, Boyka faces insurmountable challenges that will test his physical prowess and moral compass. The movie follows Boyka as he aims to enter the big leagues of fighting, all while dealing with the consequences of an accidental death that lead him to question his beliefs and purpose in the ring.

title = My Life as a Zucchini 
overview = After his mother’s death, Zucchini is befriended by a kind police officer, Raymond, who accompanies him to his new foster home filled with other orphans his age. There, with the help of his newfound friends, Zucchini eventually learns to trust and love as he searches for a new family of his own. 
revenue = 0.3 millions of dollars 
Producer = Michel Merkt 
date of release = the 12 of October 2016 
production countrie = Switzerland 
production compagnie = Gébéka Films 
original language of the movie = French 
Director = Claude Barras 
tagline = My Life as a Courgette 
duration of the movie = 1h06 
cast = Gaspard Schlatter, Sixtine Murat, Paulin Jaccoud, Michel Vuillermoz 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 0.3 millions of dollars 

In the heartwarming film "My Life as a Zucchini," we follow the journey of a young boy named Zucchini who, after the tragic loss of his mother, finds solace in the company of a compassionate police officer named Raymond. Together, they navigate Zucchini's transition to a new foster home where he meets other orphans his age. With the support of his newfound friends, Zucchini embarks on a touching quest to discover the true meaning of trust and love while yearning for a sense of belonging within a new family. Directed by Claude Barras and produced by Michel Merkt, this Swiss production by Gébéka Films, released on the 12th of October 2016, beautifully captures the essence of resilience and friendship. Starring Gaspard Schlatter, Sixtine Murat, Paulin Jaccoud, and Michel Vuillermoz, this French-language film runs for 1 hour and 6 minutes, grossing 0.3 million dollars at the box office. "My Life as a Courgette" is a poignant tale that tugs at the heartstrings and showcases the power of human connection.

title = The Curse of Downers Grove 
overview = The town of Downers Grove looks like your average suburban neighborhood -- but Downers Grove has a disturbing secret.... For the past eight years, one senior from every high school graduating class has met a bizarre death right before graduation day. And this year, Chrissie Swanson has a terrible feeling that she is going to be the one to die. Can Chrissie survive the curse of Downers Grove or will she, like those seniors before her, fall prey to the town's deadly secret? 
production compagnie = Myriad Pictures 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Derick Martini 
cast = Bella Heathcote, Lucas Till, Helen Slater, Penelope Mitchell 
date of release = the 21 of August 2015 
tagline = High school can be murder. 
Producer = Oren Segal 
budget = 2.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Myriad Pictures 

In "The Curse of Downers Grove," directed by Derick Martini and released on the 21st of August 2015 in the United States of America, the town of Downers Grove harbors a chilling secret. For the past eight years, one senior from every high school graduating class has met a bizarre death right before graduation day. This year, Chrissie Swanson, portrayed by Bella Heathcote, fears she may be the next victim. With a budget of 2.0 million dollars, this suspenseful thriller, produced by Oren Segal for Myriad Pictures, follows Chrissie as she navigates the ominous curse looming over the town. Will she escape the deadly fate that has befallen her predecessors, or will she too succumb to the malevolent forces at play in Downers Grove? With a cast including Lucas Till, Helen Slater, and Penelope Mitchell, "The Curse of Downers Grove" will keep you on the edge of your seat as high school proves that it can indeed be murder. High school can be murder.

title = The Princess and the Warrior 
overview = Young nurse Sissi lives a secluded life entirely devoted to her patients at Birkenhof asylum. Her first encounter with ex-soldier and drifter Bodo has a lasting impact. He causes an accident in which he provides first aid, Sissi wonders if he may be the man of her dreams. But when she finds him weeks later she is rejected, as Bodo is stuck somewhere between a traumatic past and a criminal future. 
Director = Tom Tykwer 
production countrie = Germany 
duration of the movie = 2h15 
average note = 7.1 
cast = Franka Potente, Benno Fürmann, Joachim Król, Lars Rudolph 
date of release = the 12 of October 2000 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Tom Tykwer 

In "The Princess and the Warrior," directed by Tom Tykwer, viewers are taken on a captivating journey through the lives of young nurse Sissi and ex-soldier Bodo. Set in Germany, the film follows Sissi's secluded life at Birkenhof asylum, where she devotes herself entirely to her patients. When Bodo, a drifter with a traumatic past, enters her life by causing an accident, Sissi is left wondering if he could be the man of her dreams. Despite their initial connection, Bodo's inner turmoil leads to a heartbreaking rejection, leaving Sissi torn between her feelings and reality. Starring Franka Potente, Benno Fürmann, Joachim Król, and Lars Rudolph, this 2-hour and 15-minute film was released on October 12, 2000, and has an average rating of 7.1. The production country of the movie is Germany.

title = The Other F Word 
overview = What happens when a generation's ultimate anti-authoritarians — punk rockers — become society's ultimate authorities — dad's? With a large chorus of Punk Rock's leading men — Blink-182's Mark Hoppus, Red Hot Chili Peppers' Flea, Rise Against's Tim McIlrath — The Other F Word follows Jim Lindberg, 20-year veteran of skate punk band, Pennywise, on his hysterical and moving journey from belting his band's anthem, 'Fuck Authority', to embracing his ultimately pivotal authoritarian role in mid-life, fatherhood. 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Andrea Blaugrund 
average note = 6.4 
cast = Jim Lindberg, Tony Adolescent, Art Alexakis, Rob Chaos 
revenue = 289.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

title = The Other F Word 
overview = What happens when a generation's ultimate anti-authoritarians — punk rockers — become society's ultimate authorities — dad's? With a large chorus of Punk Rock's leading men — Blink-182's Mark Hoppus, Red Hot Chili Peppers' Flea, Rise Against's Tim McIlrath — The Other F Word follows Jim Lindberg, 20-year veteran of skate punk band, Pennywise, on his hysterical and moving journey from belting his band's anthem, 'Fuck Authority', to embracing his ultimately pivotal authoritarian role in mid-life, fatherhood. 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Andrea Blaugrund 
average note = 6.4 
cast = Jim Lindberg, Tony Adolescent, Art Alexakis, Rob Chaos 
revenue = 289.0 millions of dollars 

In "The Other F Word," directed by Andrea Blaugrund, viewers are taken on a poignant journey following Jim Lindberg, a seasoned member of the skate punk band Pennywise. As one of the key figures in the punk rock scene, Jim finds himself facing a unique challenge as he transitions from rebellious anti-authoritarianism to the unexpected role of a father. The documentary features a stellar cast including Tony Adolescent, Art Alexakis, and Rob Chaos, alongside prominent punk rock icons like Mark Hoppus of Blink-182, Flea of Red Hot Chili Peppers, and Tim McIlrath of Rise Against. With a blend of humor and heartfelt moments, "The Other F Word" explores the evolution of punk rockers into fathers, shedding light on the complexities of balancing youthful rebellion with the responsibilities of parenthood. This thought-provoking film, set in the United States of America, resonates with audiences and earned an average note of 6.4. With a box office revenue of 289.0 million dollars, this documentary offers a compelling insight into the journey of punk rockers navigating the challenges of fatherhood.

As one of the key figures in the punk rock scene, Jim finds himself facing a unique challenge as he transitions from rebellious anti-authoritarianism to the unexpected role of a father. The documentary features a stellar cast including Tony Adolescent, Art Alexakis, and Rob Chaos, alongside prominent punk rock icons like Mark Hoppus of Blink-182, Flea of Red Hot Chili Peppers, and Tim McIlrath of Rise Against. With a blend of humor and heartfelt moments, "The Other F Word" explores the evolution of punk rockers into fathers, shedding light on the complexities of balancing youthful rebellion with the responsibilities of parenthood. This thought-provoking film, set in the United States of America, resonates with audiences and earned an average note of 6.4. With a box office revenue of 289.0 million dollars, this documentary offers a compelling insight into the journey of punk rockers navigating the challenges of fatherhood.

title = The Other F Word 
overview = What happens when a generation's ultimate anti-authoritarians — punk rockers — become society's ultimate authorities — dad's? With a large chorus of Punk Rock's leading men — Blink-182's Mark Hoppus, Red Hot Chili Peppers' Flea, Rise Against's Tim McIlrath — The Other F Word follows Jim Lindberg, 20-year veteran of skate punk band, Pennywise, on his hysterical and moving journey from belting his band's anthem, 'Fuck Authority', to embracing his ultimately pivotal authoritarian role in mid-life, fatherhood. 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Andrea Blaugrund 
average note = 6.4 
cast = Jim Lindberg, Tony Adolescent, Art Alexakis, Rob Chaos 
revenue = 289.0 millions of dollars 

In "The Other F Word," directed by Andrea Blaugrund, viewers are taken on a poignant journey following Jim Lindberg, a seasoned member of the skate punk band Pennywise. As one of the key figures in the punk rock scene, Jim finds himself facing a unique challenge as he transitions from rebellious anti-authoritarianism to the unexpected role of a father. The documentary features a stellar cast including Tony Adolescent, Art Alexakis, and Rob Chaos, alongside prominent punk rock icons like Mark Hoppus of Blink-182, Flea of Red Hot Chili Peppers, and Tim McIlrath of Rise Against. With a blend of humor and heartfelt moments, "The Other F Word" explores the evolution of punk rockers into fathers, shedding light on the complexities of balancing youthful rebellion with the responsibilities of parenthood. This thought-provoking film, set in the United States of America, resonates with audiences and earned an average note of 6.4. With a box office revenue of 289.0 million dollars, this documentary offers a compelling insight into the journey of punk rockers navigating the challenges of fatherhood. 
 
 

 
title = Payback 
overview = With friends like these, who needs enemies? That's the question bad guy Porter is left asking after his wife and partner steal his heist money and leave him for dead -- or so they think. Five months and an endless reservoir of bitterness later, Porter's partners and the crooked cops on his tail learn how bad payback can be. 
average note = 6.7 
Director = Brian Helgeland 
duration of the movie = 1h40 
cast = Mel Gibson, Kris Kristofferson, Gregg Henry, Maria Bello

In "Payback," directed by Brian Helgeland, the audience is taken on a thrilling ride of betrayal and revenge. The story follows Porter, played by Mel Gibson, who is double-crossed by his wife and partner, leading to a heist gone wrong. Left for dead, Porter survives and embarks on a mission of payback against his former allies and the corrupt cops chasing him. With a runtime of 1 hour and 40 minutes, this action-packed film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. Co-starring Kris Kristofferson, Gregg Henry, and Maria Bello, the movie was released on February 5, 1999, by Paramount Pictures. Despite the treachery depicted on screen, "Payback" managed to generate a revenue of 161.6 million dollars, proving that revenge truly pays off. title = House of Dracula 
overview = A scientist working on cures for rare afflictions, such as a bone softening agent made from molds to allow him to correct the spinal deformity of his nurse, finds the physical causes of lycanthropy in wolf-man Larry Talbot and of vampirism in Count Dracula, but himself becomes afflicted with homicidal madness while exchanging blood with Dracula. 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Erle C. Kenton 
cast = John Carradine, Onslow Stevens, Lon Chaney Jr., Martha O'Driscoll 
duration of the movie = 1h07 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In "House of Dracula," directed by Erle C. Kenton, a dedicated scientist delves into finding cures for rare afflictions, utilizing innovative methods like a bone softening agent derived from molds. His quest leads him to uncover the physical origins of lycanthropy in Larry Talbot, the wolf-man, and vampirism in the infamous Count Dracula. However, as he exchanges blood with Dracula, he unwittingly falls victim to a terrifying fate of homicidal madness. Set in the United States of America and with a runtime of 1 hour and 7 minutes, this classic horror film features a stellar cast including John Carradine, Onslow Stevens, Lon Chaney Jr., and Martha O'Driscoll, all delivering captivating performances in English, the original language of the movie.

title = The Lazarus Project 
overview = After Ben Garvey foolishly turned back to crime, he thought his life was over when he was sentenced to death by lethal injection. But his death sentence isn't quite what it seems, as Ben regains consciousness near an eerie psychiatric ward, where he's told he's been hired as the groundskeeper. With the state of his soul in question, and the love for his wife and daughter all the more real and powerful, Ben must figure out if he's truly cheated death, or if he's become part of something far more sinister. 
average note = 6.0 
Director = John Glenn 
duration of the movie = 1h39 
budget = 9.8 millions of dollars 
cast = Paul Walker, Piper Perabo, Lambert Wilson, Linda Cardellini 
date of release = the 21 of October 2008 
tagline = Cheating death is only the beginning 
Producer = David Hoberman 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 0.6 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United Kingdom 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : average note = 6.0 

In "The Lazarus Project," directed by John Glenn, we follow the story of Ben Garvey, portrayed by Paul Walker, who finds himself in a perplexing situation after being sentenced to death for his criminal actions. Instead of facing the lethal injection, Ben wakes up in a mysterious psychiatric ward where he is given a second chance at life as a groundskeeper. As he grapples with the uncertainty of his existence and the deep love he holds for his family, Ben must navigate through the eerie setting to uncover the truth behind his unusual circumstances. With a haunting tagline "Cheating death is only the beginning," this English-language film released on October 21, 2008, keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for 1 hour and 39 minutes. The stellar cast includes Piper Perabo, Lambert Wilson, and Linda Cardellini, while the production took place in the United Kingdom with a budget of 9.8 million dollars and a revenue of 0.6 million dollars. Produced by David Hoberman, "The Lazarus Project" weaves a gripping tale of redemption, mystery, and the blurred lines between life and death.
