In "The Lazarus Project," directed by John Glenn, we follow the story of Ben Garvey, portrayed by Paul Walker, who finds himself in a perplexing situation after being sentenced to death for his criminal actions. Instead of facing the lethal injection, Ben wakes up in a mysterious psychiatric ward where he is given a second chance at life as a groundskeeper. As he grapples with the uncertainty of his existence and the deep love he holds for his family, Ben must navigate through the eerie setting to uncover the truth behind his unusual circumstances. With a haunting tagline "Cheating death is only the beginning," this English-language film released on October 21, 2008, keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for 1 hour and 39 minutes. The stellar cast includes Piper Perabo, Lambert Wilson, and Linda Cardellini, while the production took place in the United Kingdom with a budget of 9.8 million dollars and a revenue of 0.6 million dollars. Produced by David Hoberman, "The Lazarus Project" weaves a gripping tale of redemption, mystery, and the blurred lines between life and death.

title = Leviathan 
overview = Underwater deep-sea miners encounter a Soviet wreck and bring back a dangerous cargo to their base on the ocean floor with horrifying results. The crew of the mining base must fight to survive against a genetic mutation that hunts them down one by one. 
tagline = The true meaning of fear 
production compagnie = Gordon Company 
production countrie = Italy 
Director = George P. Cosmatos 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 15.7 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.0 
Producer = Aurelio De Laurentiis 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = The true meaning of fear 

In the depths of the ocean, a team of underwater deep-sea miners, working for the Gordon Company, stumbles upon a chilling discovery - a Soviet wreck containing a sinister cargo. As they bring this dangerous find back to their base on the ocean floor in Italy, they unknowingly unleash a horrifying genetic mutation that begins to pick them off one by one. Directed by George P. Cosmatos, "Leviathan" plunges viewers into a heart-pounding battle for survival as the crew must confront their deepest fears to outwit the relentless predator. With a tagline that promises to reveal "The true meaning of fear," this English-language thriller grossed 15.7 million dollars at the box office and received an average rating of 6.0. Produced by Aurelio De Laurentiis, "Leviathan" is a gripping tale of terror that will leave you on the edge of your seat until the very end. The production company behind this suspenseful film is Gordon Company, and it was filmed in Italy.

['correct']

title = Parasite Eve 
overview = Toshiaki Nagashima is a biologist who is doing major research on mitochondria. When his beautiful young wife is tragically involved in a car accident which leaves her brain dead, in desperation he steals her liver from her body in order to recieve the mitochondria from it to resurrect his wife from the dead. The killer mitochondria takes the form of his assistant. 
Director = Masayuki Ochiai 
production compagnie = Fuji Television Network 
budget = 106.6 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Masayuki Ochiai 

In "Parasite Eve," directed by Masayuki Ochiai and produced by Fuji Television Network, biologist Toshiaki Nagashima finds himself in a desperate situation after his wife is left brain dead following a tragic car accident. Driven by a desire to bring her back to life, he makes a controversial decision to steal her liver in order to extract the mitochondria from it. However, his experiment takes a dark turn when the mitochondria manifest as a sinister entity in the form of his assistant. With a budget of 106.6 million dollars, this gripping tale delves into the consequences of playing with the forces of life and death, blurring the lines between science and horror.

title = The Fugitive Kind 
overview = Val Xavier, a drifter of obscure origins, arrives at a small town and gets a job in a store run by Lady Torrence. Her husband, Jabe M. Torrance, is dying of cancer. Val is pursued by Carol Cutere, the enigmatic local tramp-of-good-family. 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Marlon Brando, Anna Magnani, Joanne Woodward, Victor Jory 
revenue = 56.7 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.5 
date of release = the 14 of April 1960 
budget = 284.4 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Pennebaker Productions 
tagline = With a guitar and a snake skin jacket he drifted out of the rain...and into the lives of these two women... 
duration of the movie = 1h59 
Producer = Martin Jurow 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the 1960 American film "The Fugitive Kind," directed by Martin Jurow and produced by Pennebaker Productions, a mysterious drifter named Val Xavier, portrayed by Marlon Brando, finds himself in a small town where he takes a job at a store owned by Lady Torrence, played by Anna Magnani. The town is also home to the dying Jabe M. Torrance, Lady's husband. As Val navigates his way through the town, he catches the attention of Carol Cutere, a complex character portrayed by Joanne Woodward. Victor Jory also stars in the film. The movie delves into the intricate relationships between these characters against the backdrop of the town's dynamics. With a tagline that reads, "With a guitar and a snake skin jacket he drifted out of the rain...and into the lives of these two women...," the film explores themes of love, desire, and societal expectations. Despite its star-studded cast and intriguing plot, the movie received an average rating of 6.5. "The Fugitive Kind" was released on the 14th of April 1960 and grossed 56.7 million dollars at the box office, with a budget of 284.4 million dollars. The film runs for 1 hour and 59 minutes, offering viewers a glimpse into the complexities of human relationships in a small town setting.

['correct']

"The Fugitive Kind" was released on the 14th of April 1960 and grossed 56.7 million dollars at the box office, with a budget of 284.4 million dollars. The film runs for 1 hour and 59 minutes, offering viewers a glimpse into the complexities of human relationships in a small town setting.

In the 1960 American film "The Fugitive Kind," directed by Martin Jurow and produced by Pennebaker Productions, a mysterious drifter named Val Xavier, portrayed by Marlon Brando, finds himself in a small town where he takes a job at a store owned by Lady Torrence, played by Anna Magnani. The town is also home to the dying Jabe M. Torrance, Lady's husband. As Val navigates his way through the town, he catches the attention of Carol Cutere, a complex character portrayed by Joanne Woodward. Victor Jory also stars in the film. The movie delves into the intricate relationships between these characters against the backdrop of the town's dynamics. title = Kill Me Three Times 
overview = While on a seemingly routine job, a jaded hit man discovers that he's not the only one with his target in the crosshairs. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : average note = 5.5 

In the action-packed thriller "Kill Me Three Times," a seasoned hitman finds himself in a precarious situation when he realizes that he is not the only one targeting his mark. As he embarks on what initially appears to be a routine job, he soon discovers that there are multiple parties with their sights set on the same target. With tensions escalating and betrayal lurking around every corner, the hitman must navigate a dangerous game of cat and mouse to complete his mission. Will he emerge victorious, or will he become the next victim in this deadly game of deception and revenge?

Facts included in the description:
1. Title: Kill Me Three Times
2. Overview: While on a seemingly routine job, a jaded hit man discovers that he's not the only one with his target in the crosshairs.

As he embarks on what initially appears to be a routine job, he soon discovers that there are multiple parties with their sights set on the same target. With tensions escalating and betrayal lurking around every corner, the hitman must navigate a dangerous game of cat and mouse to complete his mission. Will he emerge victorious, or will he become the next victim in this deadly game of deception and revenge?

Facts included in the description:
1. Title: Kill Me Three Times
2. Overview: While on a seemingly routine job, a jaded hit man discovers that he's not the only one with his target in the crosshairs.

title = Hostage 
overview = When a mafia accountant is taken hostage on his beat, a police officer – wracked by guilt from a prior stint as a negotiator – must negotiate the standoff, even as his own family is held captive by the mob. 
production countrie = Germany 
budget = 52.0 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h53 
production compagnie = Miramax Films 
cast = Bruce Willis, Kevin Pollak, Jimmy Bennett, Michelle Horn 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = Germany 

In the heart-pounding thriller "Hostage," set in Germany, a police officer finds himself in a high-stakes situation when a mafia accountant is taken hostage on his watch. Wracked by guilt from a previous negotiation gone wrong, the officer must navigate a tense standoff while also dealing with the added pressure of his own family being held captive by the mob. With a budget of 52.0 million dollars, this intense 1 hour and 53-minute film, produced by Miramax Films, features a stellar cast including Bruce Willis, Kevin Pollak, Jimmy Bennett, and Michelle Horn. Will the officer be able to save the day and rescue both the hostage and his family, or will the situation spiral out of control?

title = Riot on Sunset Strip 
overview = A police captain (Aldo Ray) is caught between businesses operating on the Los Angeles Sunset Strip who don't like the punks hanging out, and his belief in allowing the kids their rights. But when his daughter (Mimsy Farmer) gets involved with an unruly bunch, his attitude starts to change. 
date of release = the 1 of March 1967 
cast = Aldo Ray, Mimsy Farmer, Michael Evans, Laurie Mock 
average note = 5.0 
budget = 296.2 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h27 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = Meet the Hippies...the Teenyboppers with their too-tight capris...and the Pot-Partygoers - out for a new thrill...a new kick! 
Director = Arthur Dreifuss 
Producer = Sam Katzman 
revenue = 33.3 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 1 of March 1967 

In the 1967 film "Riot on Sunset Strip," directed by Arthur Dreifuss and produced by Sam Katzman, a police captain (played by Aldo Ray) finds himself torn between the businesses on Los Angeles' Sunset Strip and his belief in the rights of the youth who frequent the area. When his daughter (portrayed by Mimsy Farmer) becomes involved with a rebellious group, his perspective begins to shift. As tensions rise between the establishment and the counterculture, the captain must navigate a delicate balance to maintain order. With a star-studded cast including Michael Evans and Laurie Mock, this film delves into the clash of generations and ideologies during a tumultuous time. "Riot on Sunset Strip" runs for 1 hour and 27 minutes, offering a glimpse into a pivotal moment in American history. Don't miss this explosive portrayal of a community in turmoil, where the tagline rings true: "Meet the Hippies, the Teenyboppers, and the Pot-Partygoers - out for a new thrill, a new kick!"

The movie was released on the 1st of March 1967 and had an average rating of 5.0. The budget for the film was 296.2 million dollars, while it generated a revenue of 33.3 million dollars. The production country for "Riot on Sunset Strip" is the United States of America.

title = Catch and Release 
overview = Gray Wheeler just lost everything. But it could be the best thing that ever happened to her. After the death of her fiancé, Gray moves in with her late love's best friends. While Sam and Dennis do their best to cheer Gray up, Fritz doesn't seem to care. Once Gray breaks through Fritz's defenses, however, she finally sees why her fiancé thought so highly of him. As they spend more time together, Gray learns that her chances for love have not died out with her fiancé. But when some surprise guests show up on their doorstep, it'll take the love of all of her new friends to help Gray learn that life may be messy, but love is messier. 
Director = Susannah Grant 
average note = 5.8 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h51 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 20 of October 2006 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Susannah Grant 

In "Catch and Release," directed by Susannah Grant, Gray Wheeler finds herself at a crossroads after the tragic loss of her fiancé. Moving in with her late love's best friends, Sam and Dennis provide support while Fritz remains aloof. As Gray navigates her grief and forms a bond with Fritz, she discovers unexpected depths to his character. Through their growing connection, Gray realizes that love can still find its way into her life. However, when unexpected visitors arrive, the group must come together to show Gray that amidst life's chaos, love prevails. Set in the United States of America and released on the 20th of October 2006, this emotional journey unfolds in English with an average rating of 5.8 over a runtime of 1 hour and 51 minutes.

fact : average note = 5.8 

In "Catch and Release," directed by Susannah Grant, Gray Wheeler finds herself at a crossroads after the tragic loss of her fiancé. Moving in with her late love's best friends, Sam and Dennis provide support while Fritz remains aloof. As Gray navigates her grief and forms a bond with Fritz, she discovers unexpected depths to his character. Through their growing connection, Gray realizes that love can still find its way into her life. However, when unexpected visitors arrive, the group must come together to show Gray that amidst life's chaos, love prevails. Set in the United States of America and released on the 20th of October 2006, this emotional journey unfolds in English with an average rating of 5.8 over a runtime of 1 hour and 51 minutes.

title = The Fastest Gun Alive 
overview = Whenever it becomes known how good he is with guns, ex-gunman George and his wife Dora have to flee the town, in fear of all the gunmen who might want to challenge him. Unfortunately he again spills his secret when he's drunk. All citizens swear to keep his secret and support him to give up his guns forever -- but a boy tells the story to a gang of wanted criminals. Their leader threatens to burn down the whole town, if he doesn't duel him. 
average note = 6.3 
budget = 167.1 millions of dollars 
Producer = Clarence Greene 
cast = Glenn Ford, Jeanne Crain, Broderick Crawford, Russ Tamblyn 
Director = Russell Rouse 
tagline = WHAT HAPPENS in the next few minutes makes one of the most dramatic climaxes of any story you've ever seen! 
date of release = the 12 of July 1956 
duration of the movie = 1h29 
production countrie = United States of America 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.3 

In the classic Western film "The Fastest Gun Alive," directed by Russell Rouse and produced by Clarence Greene, we follow the story of ex-gunman George, portrayed by Glenn Ford, and his wife Dora, played by Jeanne Crain. George's exceptional skills with guns force them to constantly flee from town to town to avoid challenges from other gunmen. However, a drunken mistake leads to his secret being exposed, putting the entire town at risk. As the citizens rally behind him to renounce his guns, a young boy's loose lips attract the attention of a dangerous gang led by Broderick Crawford's character. Threatening to destroy the town, George is faced with a life-threatening duel that will determine the fate of everyone involved. With a stellar cast including Russ Tamblyn, this gripping tale of redemption and sacrifice unfolds in the dusty streets of the Old West. "The Fastest Gun Alive" is a thrilling Western that culminates in one of the most dramatic climaxes ever seen on screen. Released on July 12, 1956, in the United States by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, this 1 hour and 29-minute film, with an average rating of 6.3, showcases the timeless struggle between honor and survival.

The film had a budget of 167.1 million dollars and the tagline is "WHAT HAPPENS in the next few minutes makes one of the most dramatic climaxes of any story you've ever seen!" The production company behind the movie is Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer. The original language of the movie is English and it was filmed in the United States of America.

title = Backdraft 
overview = They say a blast of flames can take a life ... and hide a secret. But now firemen brothers Brian and Stephen McCaffrey are battling each other over past slights while trying to stop an arsonist with a diabolical agenda from torching Chicago. 
cast = Kurt Russell, William Baldwin, Robert De Niro, Donald Sutherland 
Producer = Pen Densham 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Kurt Russell, William Baldwin, Robert De Niro, Donald Sutherland 

In the intense thriller "Backdraft," firemen brothers Brian and Stephen McCaffrey, portrayed by Kurt Russell and William Baldwin, find themselves in a heated battle not only against a dangerous arsonist with a sinister plan to ignite Chicago but also against each other due to unresolved past conflicts. As they navigate through blazing infernos and deadly secrets, they must confront their own demons and work together to save the city from destruction. With a stellar cast including Robert De Niro and Donald Sutherland, and produced by Pen Densham, this film delves into the explosive world of firefighting where the line between heroism and betrayal blurs in the face of roaring flames. The movie explores the theme that a blast of flames can take a life and hide a secret, adding a layer of mystery and danger to the already intense storyline.

['correct']

As they navigate through blazing infernos and deadly secrets, they must confront their own demons and work together to save the city from destruction. title = King of California 
overview = Charlie gets released from an insane asylum and moves in with Miranda, the young daughter he left behind. Charlie believes that there is treasure hidden beneath the local Costco, so he puts together a plan to unearth the loot. By convincing Miranda to quit her job at McDonald's and instead work at the wholesale store, he is able to obtain a key. Although Miranda is skeptical, she helps her father with his irrational quest. 
date of release = the 24 of January 2007 
average note = 6.5 
Producer = Alexander Payne 
Director = Mike Cahill 
revenue = 1.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Michael Douglas, Evan Rachel Wood, Willis Burks II, Kathleen Wilhoite 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 24 of January 2007 

In the 2007 film "King of California," directed by Mike Cahill and produced by Alexander Payne, we follow the story of Charlie, portrayed by Michael Douglas, who is released from an insane asylum and reunites with his daughter Miranda, played by Evan Rachel Wood. Convinced that there is hidden treasure beneath the local Costco, Charlie enlists Miranda's help in his quest to unearth the loot. To access the treasure, they devise a plan that involves Miranda quitting her job at McDonald's to work at the wholesale store, ultimately leading them to obtain a key. Despite Miranda's initial skepticism, she decides to assist her father in his seemingly irrational mission. As their unconventional adventure unfolds, they navigate through challenges and unexpected discoveries. With a solid average rating of 6.5, "King of California" was released on January 24, 2007, in the United States of America and grossed $1.0 million at the box office. The film also features Willis Burks II and Kathleen Wilhoite in supporting roles, and is presented in its original English language. The main cast includes Michael Douglas, Evan Rachel Wood, Willis Burks II, and Kathleen Wilhoite.

title = Coach Carter 
overview = Based on a true story, in which Richmond High School head basketball coach Ken Carter made headlines in 1999 for benching his undefeated team due to poor academic results. 
revenue = 76.7 millions of dollars 
production countrie = Germany 
date of release = the 14 of January 2005 
duration of the movie = 2h16 
budget = 30.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 76.7 millions of dollars 

In the inspiring film "Coach Carter," released on the 14th of January 2005, viewers are taken on a journey based on a true story. The movie follows the courageous actions of Richmond High School's head basketball coach, Ken Carter, who gained national attention in 1999 for his decision to bench his undefeated team due to their poor academic performance. Despite being produced in Germany, the movie managed to generate an impressive revenue of 76.7 million dollars, surpassing its initial budget of 30.0 million dollars. With a runtime of 2 hours and 16 minutes, "Coach Carter" delivers a powerful message about the importance of academic excellence and discipline both on and off the court.

fact : duration of the movie = 1h37 

title = You'll Find Out 
overview = The manager of Kay Kyser's band books them for a birthday party bash for an heiress at a spooky mansion, where sinister forces try to kill her. 

In the thrilling movie "You'll Find Out," the manager of Kay Kyser's band secures a gig for them at a lavish birthday party thrown for an heiress at a mysterious and eerie mansion. As the night unfolds, sinister forces lurk in the shadows, plotting to harm the unsuspecting heiress. Will the band be able to uncover the dark secrets of the mansion and protect the birthday girl before it's too late? Join Kay Kyser and his band on a suspenseful journey filled with mystery, music, and mayhem. The movie features Kay Kyser's band as the main characters, a spooky and mysterious mansion setting, and a plot where sinister forces attempt to kill the heiress during the birthday party.

overview = The manager of Kay Kyser's band books them for a birthday party bash for an heiress at a spooky mansion, where sinister forces try to kill her. 

In the thrilling movie "You'll Find Out," the manager of Kay Kyser's band secures a gig for them at a lavish birthday party thrown for an heiress at a mysterious and eerie mansion. As the night unfolds, sinister forces lurk in the shadows, plotting to harm the unsuspecting heiress. Will the band be able to uncover the dark secrets of the mansion and protect the birthday girl before it's too late? Join Kay Kyser and his band on a suspenseful journey filled with mystery, music, and mayhem. The movie features Kay Kyser's band as the main characters, a spooky and mysterious mansion setting, and a plot where sinister forces attempt to kill the heiress during the birthday party. 
 
 
TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']

title = A Bug's Life 
overview = On behalf of "oppressed bugs everywhere," an inventive ant named Flik hires a troupe of warrior bugs to defend his bustling colony from a horde of freeloading grasshoppers led by the evil-minded Hopper. 
date of release = the 25 of November 1998 
production compagnie = Walt Disney Pictures 
revenue = 363.3 millions of dollars 
Director = John Lasseter 
cast = Kevin Spacey, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Hayden Panettiere, Phyllis Diller 
average note = 6.8 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 25 of November 1998 

In the heartwarming animated film "A Bug's Life," released on the 25th of November 1998 by Walt Disney Pictures, audiences are taken on a thrilling adventure alongside an inventive ant named Flik. Flik recruits a group of warrior bugs to protect his colony from the menacing grasshoppers, led by the villainous Hopper. Directed by the talented John Lasseter, the star-studded cast includes Kevin Spacey, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Hayden Panettiere, and Phyllis Diller. With a box office revenue of 363.3 million dollars and an average rating of 6.8, this film is a delightful tale of courage, teamwork, and standing up against oppression.

['correct']

title = The Frighteners 
overview = Once an architect, Frank Bannister now passes himself off as an exorcist of evil spirits. To bolster his facade, he claims his "special" gift is the result of a car accident that killed his wife. But what he does not count on is more people dying in the small town where he lives. As he tries to piece together the supernatural mystery of these killings, he falls in love with the wife of one of the victims and deals with a crazy FBI agent. 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = No Rest for the Wicked. 
date of release = the 18 of July 1996 
revenue = 29.4 millions of dollars 
production countrie = New Zealand 
budget = 30.0 millions of dollars 
Producer = Peter Jackson 
cast = Michael J. Fox, Jeffrey Combs, Jake Busey, Chi McBride 
Director = Peter Jackson 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the supernatural thriller "The Frighteners," architect turned fake exorcist Frank Bannister navigates a web of deceit in a small town plagued by mysterious deaths. Claiming his abilities stem from a tragic car accident that claimed his wife's life, Frank's world unravels as more lives are lost. Amidst the chaos, he finds himself entangled in a love affair with a victim's wife and at odds with a relentless FBI agent. Directed by Peter Jackson and featuring a stellar cast including Michael J. Fox, Jeffrey Combs, Jake Busey, and Chi McBride, this English-language film from New Zealand delivers a chilling tale with a tagline that rings true: "No Rest for the Wicked." Released on July 18, 1996, "The Frighteners" grossed $29.4 million against a budget of $30 million, solidifying its place as a hauntingly captivating cinematic experience. The production country of the movie is New Zealand, and the producer of the film is Peter Jackson. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = No Rest for the Wicked. 

In the supernatural thriller "The Frighteners," architect turned fake exorcist Frank Bannister navigates a web of deceit in a small town plagued by mysterious deaths. title = Love & Mercy 
overview = The life of reclusive and eccentric Beach Boys songwriter and musician Brian Wilson. 
average note = 7.3 
revenue = 28.6 millions of dollars 
Producer = Bill Pohlad 
duration of the movie = 2h00 
production compagnie = River Road Entertainment 
date of release = the 29 of May 2015 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 7.3 

In "Love & Mercy," viewers are taken on a captivating journey into the life of the reclusive and eccentric Beach Boys songwriter and musician, Brian Wilson. Directed by Bill Pohlad and produced by River Road Entertainment, this biographical film delves deep into Wilson's struggles and triumphs. Released on the 29th of May 2015, the movie runs for 2 hours and keeps audiences engaged with its poignant storytelling. With an average rating of 7.3, "Love & Mercy" also saw success at the box office, grossing an impressive $28.6 million. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 28.6 millions of dollars 

In "Love & Mercy," viewers are taken on a captivating journey into the life of the reclusive and eccentric Beach Boys songwriter and musician, Brian Wilson. Directed by Bill Pohlad and produced by River Road Entertainment, this biographical film delves deep into Wilson's struggles and triumphs. Released on the 29th of May 2015, the movie runs for 2 hours and keeps audiences engaged with its poignant storytelling. With an average rating of 7.3, "Love & Mercy" also saw success at the box office, grossing an impressive $28.6 million.

title = The Rage 
overview = A crazed scientist experimenting with a rage virus on innocent victims in a laboratory in the woods. When his monstrous subjects escape and vultures devour their remains, they became mutations seeking to feed on humans. 
Producer = Robert Kurtzman 
budget = 173.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h25 
Director = Robert Kurtzman 
tagline = A Mega-Dose of Pure Terror 
revenue = 30.1 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Precinct 13 Entertainment 
cast = Andrew Divoff, Erin Brown, Ryan Hooks, Sean Serino 
average note = 4.7 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Robert Kurtzman 

In the chilling horror film "The Rage," produced and directed by Robert Kurtzman, a crazed scientist conducts experiments with a rage virus on unsuspecting victims in a secluded laboratory in the woods. When the monstrous subjects break free and are devoured by vultures, they transform into mutations with a hunger for human flesh. As the mutations terrorize the area, a group of individuals including Andrew Divoff, Erin Brown, Ryan Hooks, and Sean Serino must fight for survival against the terrifying creatures. With a budget of 173.0 million dollars and a runtime of 1 hour and 25 minutes, this United States production by Precinct 13 Entertainment delivers a mega-dose of pure terror, earning a revenue of 30.1 million dollars. Despite its intense atmosphere and gripping storyline, the film receives an average rating of 4.7. The tagline for the movie is "A Mega-Dose of Pure Terror."

title = The Naked Cage 
overview = A young woman is falsely convicted of a bank robbery and sent to a maximum-security prison run by a corrupt warden, where she is forced to suffer various indignities. 
production compagnie = Cannon Group 
Director = Paul Nicholas 
cast = Shari Shattuck, Angel Tompkins, Lucinda Crosby, Stacey Shaffer 
Producer = Samuel Benedict 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 1 of March 1986 
tagline = Raw violence and hot rage explode 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Cannon Group 

In the gritty and intense film "The Naked Cage," directed by Paul Nicholas and produced by Samuel Benedict, a young woman finds herself unjustly imprisoned for a crime she didn't commit. Set in a maximum-security prison under the control of a corrupt warden, she is subjected to a series of degrading experiences. Starring Shari Shattuck, Angel Tompkins, Lucinda Crosby, and Stacey Shaffer, this Cannon Group production delivers raw violence and hot rage as it unravels the harrowing journey of survival behind bars. Released on the 1st of March 1986, this English-language film is a gripping tale of injustice and resilience.

title = Mona Lisa Smile 
overview = The story of Katherine Ann Watson, a feminist teacher who studied at UCLA graduate school and in 1953 left her boyfriend behind in Los Angeles, California to teach at Wellesley College, a conservative women's private liberal arts college in Massachusetts, United States. 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 19 of December 2003 
budget = 65.0 millions of dollars 
tagline = In a world that told them how to think, she showed them how to live. 
cast = Julia Roberts, Kirsten Dunst, Julia Stiles, Maggie Gyllenhaal 
Director = Mike Newell 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the 2003 American film "Mona Lisa Smile," directed by Mike Newell, viewers are taken on a journey with Katherine Ann Watson, a feminist teacher who defies societal norms by leaving her boyfriend in Los Angeles to teach at Wellesley College in Massachusetts in 1953. The movie, featuring a stellar cast including Julia Roberts, Kirsten Dunst, Julia Stiles, and Maggie Gyllenhaal, explores themes of feminism and individuality in a conservative women's college setting. With a budget of 65.0 million dollars, this thought-provoking drama was released on the 19th of December 2003, captivating audiences with its tagline: "In a world that told them how to think, she showed them how to live."

The production country of "Mona Lisa Smile" is the United States of America.

['correct']

In the 2003 American film "Mona Lisa Smile," directed by Mike Newell, viewers are taken on a journey with Katherine Ann Watson, a feminist teacher who defies societal norms by leaving her boyfriend in Los Angeles to teach at Wellesley College in Massachusetts in 1953. The movie, featuring a stellar cast including Julia Roberts, Kirsten Dunst, Julia Stiles, and Maggie Gyllenhaal, explores themes of feminism and individuality in a conservative women's college setting. With a budget of 65.0 million dollars, this thought-provoking drama was released on the 19th of December 2003, captivating audiences with its tagline: "In a world that told them how to think, she showed them how to live."

The production country of "Mona Lisa Smile" is the United States of America.

title = The Major and the Minor 
overview = Susan Applegate, tired of New York after one year and 25 jobs, decides to return to her home town. Discovering she hasn't enough money for the train fare, Susan disguises herself as a 12-year-old and travels for half the price. Caught out by the conductors, she hides in the compartment of Major Philip Kirby, a military school instructor who takes the "child" under his wing. 
revenue = 257.8 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h40 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 16 of September 1942 
Director = Billy Wilder 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 
budget = 149.5 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 257.8 millions of dollars 

In the classic comedy "The Major and the Minor," directed by Billy Wilder, Susan Applegate finds herself in a hilarious predicament. After growing tired of New York and facing financial constraints, she cleverly disguises herself as a 12-year-old to save on train fare. However, her ruse is discovered by the conductors, leading her to seek refuge in the compartment of Major Philip Kirby, a military school instructor. What follows is a heartwarming and comical journey as Major Kirby takes the "child" under his wing. Released on September 16, 1942, in the United States of America by Paramount Pictures, this charming film with a runtime of 1 hour and 40 minutes went on to gross an impressive $257.8 million, surpassing its budget of $149.5 million.

title = Ken Park 
overview = Ken Park focuses on several teenagers and their tormented home lives. Shawn seems to be the most conventional. Tate is brimming with psychotic rage; Claude is habitually harassed by his brutish father and coddled, rather uncomfortably, by his enormously pregnant mother. Peaches looks after her devoutly religious father, but yearns for freedom. They're all rather tight, or so they claim. 
cast = James Ransone, Tiffany Limos, Maeve Quinlan, Amanda Plummer 
tagline = Who are you? 
date of release = the 31 of August 2002 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = James Ransone, Tiffany Limos, Maeve Quinlan, Amanda Plummer 

In the gripping drama "Ken Park," we are introduced to a group of teenagers grappling with the complexities of their troubled home lives. Shawn appears to be the most conventional of the bunch, while Tate simmers with a dangerous, psychotic rage. Claude endures relentless abuse from his aggressive father and uncomfortable coddling from his heavily pregnant mother. Peaches, on the other hand, dutifully cares for her devout father but secretly yearns for freedom. They're all rather tight, or so they claim. As these interconnected stories unfold, the teenagers navigate their tight-knit yet tumultuous relationships, all while questioning their identities and roles in the world. Starring James Ransone, Tiffany Limos, Maeve Quinlan, and Amanda Plummer, "Ken Park" delves deep into the raw and unfiltered realities of adolescence. With a haunting tagline asking "Who are you?" this film was released on the 31st of August 2002, leaving a lasting impact on viewers.

title = Jackson County Jail 
overview = This is a powerful drama about a young woman who stumbles into a nightmare land of hijacking and humiliation while driving cross-country from California to New York. 
Producer = Jeff Begun 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 2.3 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h24 
budget = 0.4 millions of dollars 
average note = 5.2 
Director = Michael Miller 
tagline = The cops are there to protect her… but who will protect her from the cops? 
cast = Yvette Mimieux, Tommy Lee Jones, Robert Carradine, Mary Woronov 
date of release = the 31 of March 1976 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = New World Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Jeff Begun 

In the 1976 film "Jackson County Jail," directed by Michael Miller and produced by Jeff Begun, viewers are taken on a gripping journey with a young woman who finds herself in a harrowing situation of hijacking and humiliation. As she drives from California to New York, she unwittingly enters a nightmare scenario. The movie, presented in English, features a stellar cast including Yvette Mimieux, Tommy Lee Jones, Robert Carradine, and Mary Woronov. With a runtime of 1 hour and 24 minutes, the film garnered an average rating of 5.2. The tagline "The cops are there to protect her… but who will protect her from the cops?" sets the tone for the intense drama that unfolds. Despite its modest budget of 0.4 million dollars, "Jackson County Jail" managed to earn 2.3 million dollars in revenue. Set against the backdrop of the United States of America, this New World Pictures production was released on March 31, 1976.

['correct']

In the 1976 film "Jackson County Jail," directed by Michael Miller and produced by Jeff Begun, viewers are taken on a gripping journey with a young woman who finds herself in a harrowing situation of hijacking and humiliation. As she drives from California to New York, she unwittingly enters a nightmare scenario. The movie, presented in English, features a stellar cast including Yvette Mimieux, Tommy Lee Jones, Robert Carradine, and Mary Woronov. With a runtime of 1 hour and 24 minutes, the film garnered an average rating of 5.2. The tagline "The cops are there to protect her… but who will protect her from the cops?" sets the tone for the intense drama that unfolds. Despite its modest budget of 0.4 million dollars, "Jackson County Jail" managed to earn 2.3 million dollars in revenue. Set against the backdrop of the United States of America, this New World Pictures production was released on March 31, 1976.

title = Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory 
overview = Eccentric candy man Willy Wonka prompts a worldwide frenzy when he announces that golden tickets hidden inside five of his delicious candy bars will admit their lucky holders into his top-secret confectionary. But does Wonka have an agenda hidden amid a world of Oompa Loompas and chocolate rivers?

['wrong']
fact : revenue = 4.0 millions of dollars 

In "Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory," the eccentric candy man Willy Wonka creates a global sensation by hiding golden tickets inside his delectable candy bars, granting access to his mysterious chocolate factory. As the lucky winners embark on a whimsical tour filled with Oompa Loompas and chocolate rivers, the question arises: what ulterior motives might Wonka have behind the extravagant spectacle? The film is based on the novel "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory" by Roald Dahl.

title = Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band 
overview = A small town band makes it big, but loses track of their roots, as they get caught up into the big-time machinations of the music biz. Now, they must thwart a plot to destroy their home town. Built around the music of the beatles, this musical uses some big name groups like Peter Frampton and Aerosmith. 
Director = Michael Schultz 
cast = Barry Gibb, Robin Gibb, Maurice Gibb, Paul Nicholas 
Producer = Robert Stigwood 
duration of the movie = 1h53 
tagline = A splendid time is guaranteed for all. 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 
date of release = the 24 of July 1978 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Michael Schultz 

In the musical film "Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band," directed by Michael Schultz, a small town band experiences the highs and lows of fame as they navigate the cutthroat music industry. Led by Barry, Robin, and Maurice Gibb, along with Paul Nicholas, the band must confront a sinister plot to destroy their hometown. With a runtime of 1 hour and 53 minutes, this movie, produced by Robert Stigwood, immerses audiences in the iconic music of The Beatles, featuring performances by legendary groups like Peter Frampton and Aerosmith. Set in the United States of America and released on July 24, 1978, "Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band" promises a splendid time for all who watch. The tagline for the film is "A splendid time is guaranteed for all." The production company behind the movie is Universal Pictures.

title = Henry V 
overview = Gritty adaption of William Shakespeare's play about the English King's bloody conquest of France. 
tagline = The great adventure of a king who defied the odds to prove himself a man. 
duration of the movie = 2h17 
budget = 9.0 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.4 
Producer = Bruce Sharman 
production compagnie = BBC Films 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Kenneth Branagh, Derek Jacobi, Brian Blessed, James Larkin 
date of release = the 5 of October 1989 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
revenue = 262.6 millions of dollars 
Director = Kenneth Branagh 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = The great adventure of a king who defied the odds to prove himself a man. 

The description includes all the facts provided. Here is the final description:

In the gritty adaptation of William Shakespeare's play, "Henry V," director Kenneth Branagh leads a stellar cast including Derek Jacobi, Brian Blessed, and James Larkin in portraying the English King's bloody conquest of France. Against a backdrop of war and political intrigue, Branagh's portrayal of Henry V defies the odds, proving himself a man in the face of adversity. Produced by Bruce Sharman and BBC Films, this epic tale unfolds in its original language of English, captivating audiences for 2 hours and 17 minutes. Released on the 5th of October 1989 in the United Kingdom, the film garnered critical acclaim with an average rating of 7.4. With a budget of 9.0 million dollars, "Henry V" triumphed at the box office, raking in a staggering revenue of 262.6 million dollars.

Against a backdrop of war and political intrigue, Branagh's portrayal of Henry V defies the odds, proving himself a man in the face of adversity. Produced by Bruce Sharman and BBC Films, this epic tale unfolds in its original language of English, captivating audiences for 2 hours and 17 minutes. Released on the 5th of October 1989 in the United Kingdom, the film garnered critical acclaim with an average rating of 7.4. With a budget of 9.0 million dollars, "Henry V" triumphed at the box office, raking in a staggering revenue of 262.6 million dollars.

title = Atragon 
overview = The legendary empire of the lost continent of Mu reappears to threaten the world with domination. While countries unite to resist, an isolated World War II Captain has created the greatest warship ever seen, and possibly the surface world's only defense. 
Producer = Tomoyuki Tanaka 
tagline = Ride the JUGGERNAUT of destruction from the depths of the Seven Seas to the Outer Limits of Space! 
production countrie = Japan 
production compagnie = Toho Company 
budget = 19.8 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h36 
Director = Ishirô Honda 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Tomoyuki Tanaka 

In the epic movie "Atragon," produced by the legendary Tomoyuki Tanaka and directed by Ishirô Honda, the world faces a grave threat as the lost empire of Mu resurfaces to conquer and dominate. While countries unite to resist, an isolated World War II Captain has created the greatest warship ever seen, and possibly the surface world's only defense. With a budget of 19.8 million dollars, this Japanese production by Toho Company takes viewers on a thrilling journey from the depths of the Seven Seas to the Outer Limits of Space. Will this ultimate warship be enough to save the surface world from the impending doom? Find out in this 1 hour and 36-minute cinematic masterpiece, where you can truly "Ride the JUGGERNAUT of destruction" and witness the battle for survival unfold.

Producer: Tomoyuki Tanaka
Tagline: Ride the JUGGERNAUT of destruction from the depths of the Seven Seas to the Outer Limits of Space!
Production Country: Japan
Production Company: Toho Company
Budget: 19.8 million dollars
Duration of the movie: 1h36
Director: Ishirô Honda

title = Race with the Devil 
overview = For old friends Roger (Peter Fonda) and Frank (Warren Oates) and their wives (Lara Parker of Dark Shadows and Loretta Swit of M*A*S*H), it was supposed to be "the best damn vacation they ever had." But their RV road trip takes a deadly detour at a secluded campsite when they accidentally witness a Satanic orgy and brutal human sacrifice. Now horror hits the highway as the couples are chased by blood-crazed cultists through some of the most intense crash-and-burn mayhem of the decade and into one of the greatest twist endings in drive-in history. 
date of release = the 1 of June 1975 
cast = Peter Fonda, Warren Oates, Loretta Swit, Lara Parker 
tagline = If you're going to race with the devil, you've got to be as fast as Hell! 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 1 of June 1975 

In the thrilling movie "Race with the Devil" released on the 1st of June 1975, old friends Roger (Peter Fonda) and Frank (Warren Oates) embark on what was meant to be "the best damn vacation they ever had" with their wives (Lara Parker of Dark Shadows and Loretta Swit of M*A*S*H). However, their RV road trip takes a terrifying turn when they stumble upon a Satanic orgy and a brutal human sacrifice at a secluded campsite. What follows is a heart-pounding chase as the couples are pursued by blood-crazed cultists, leading to intense crash-and-burn mayhem. As they race for their lives, the group faces unimaginable horrors and must confront the twisted reality of the situation. With a tagline that warns, "If you're going to race with the devil, you've got to be as fast as Hell," this film delivers one of the greatest twist endings in drive-in history. Starring Peter Fonda, Warren Oates, Loretta Swit, and Lara Parker, "Race with the Devil" is a gripping tale of survival against all odds.

What follows is a heart-pounding chase as the couples are pursued by blood-crazed cultists, leading to intense crash-and-burn mayhem. As they race for their lives, the group faces unimaginable horrors and must confront the twisted reality of the situation. With a tagline that warns, "If you're going to race with the devil, you've got to be as fast as Hell," this film delivers one of the greatest twist endings in drive-in history. Starring Peter Fonda, Warren Oates, Loretta Swit, and Lara Parker, "Race with the Devil" is a gripping tale of survival against all odds.

['wrong']

title = The Wave 
overview = A school teacher discusses types of government with his class. His students find it too boring to repeatedly go over national socialism and believe that dictatorship cannot be established in modern Germany. He starts an experiment to show how easily the masses can become manipulated. 
budget = 7.5 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 7.5 millions of dollars 

In "The Wave," a school teacher delves into discussions about different types of government with his disinterested class. Frustrated by their lack of engagement, he embarks on a social experiment to prove a point. As he delves into the topic of national socialism, his students confidently assert that dictatorship could never take hold in modern Germany. With a budget of 7.5 million dollars, the teacher's experiment takes a dark turn as he demonstrates how easily the masses can be manipulated, leading to unforeseen consequences.

fact : date of release = the 8 of September 2012 

In the 2012 film "Silver Linings Playbook," directed by David O. Russell and produced by Bruce Cohen for The Weinstein Company, we follow the journey of a former teacher who moves back in with his parents after spending eight months in a mental institution. Set in the United States of America and primarily in English, the movie delves into his attempts to reconcile with his ex-wife, portrayed by a stellar cast including Bradley Cooper, Jennifer Lawrence, Robert De Niro, and Jacki Weaver. With a budget of 21.0 million dollars, the film went on to gross an impressive 205.7 million dollars at the box office, receiving an average rating of 7.0. Running for 2 hours and 2 minutes, "Silver Linings Playbook" is a must-watch with the tagline "Watch For The Signs."

title = The Enforcer 
overview = After years of pursuit, Assistant D.A. Martin Ferguson has a good case against Murder, Inc. boss Albert Mendoza. Mendoza is in jail and his lieutenant Joseph Rico is going to testify. But Rico falls to his death and Ferguson must work through the night going over everything to build the case anew. 
date of release = the 24 of February 1951 
budget = 277.8 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Warner Bros. 
tagline = "If you're smart you'll come down - if you're dumb you'll be dead..." 
average note = 7.4 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Milton Sperling 
duration of the movie = 1h27 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 24 of February 1951 

In 1951, Warner Bros. released "The Enforcer," a gripping crime drama produced by Milton Sperling. The film follows Assistant D.A. Martin Ferguson as he builds a case against Murder, Inc. boss Albert Mendoza, with the testimony of Mendoza's lieutenant, Joseph Rico. However, when Rico mysteriously falls to his death, Ferguson must work tirelessly through the night to reconstruct the case. With a budget of 277.8 million dollars, the movie boasts a tagline that warns, "If you're smart you'll come down - if you're dumb you'll be dead..." The 1 hour and 27-minute film, in English, received an average rating of 7.4. The Enforcer was released on the 24th of February 1951 by Warner Bros.

title = Ada 
overview = A popular but naive country singer is elected governor of a southern state and, once in office, decides to dismantle the corrupt political machine that got him elected. Director Daniel Mann's 1961 political drama stars Susan Hayward, Dean Martin, Wilfred Hyde-White, Martin Balsam, Ralph Meeker, Connie Sawyer, William Walker, Ray Teal, Larry Gates and Kathryn Card. 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 155.2 millions of dollars

fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the 1961 political drama "Ada," directed by Daniel Mann, a popular yet naive country singer finds himself elected as the governor of a southern state. Once in office, he makes a bold decision to dismantle the corrupt political machine that helped secure his position. Starring Susan Hayward, Dean Martin, Wilfred Hyde-White, Martin Balsam, Ralph Meeker, Connie Sawyer, William Walker, Ray Teal, Larry Gates, and Kathryn Card, this English-language film grossed an impressive $155.2 million at the box office.

overview = Based on Finnish mythology, this movie traces the exploits of Lemminkainen as he woos the fair Annikki and battles the evil witch Louhi. Louhi kidnaps Annikki to compel her father to build for her a Sampo, a magical device that creates salt, grain, and gold. When Lemminkainen tries (and fails) to recover the Sampo, Louhi steals the sun, plunging the world into frozen darkness.

title = Marvin's Room 
overview = A leukemia patient attempts to end a 20-year feud with her sister to get her bone marrow. 
Producer = Robert De Niro 
Director = Jerry Zaks 
date of release = the 18 of December 1996 
budget = 23.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Robert De Niro 

In "Marvin's Room," directed by Jerry Zaks and produced by Robert De Niro, a poignant story unfolds as a leukemia patient makes a desperate attempt to reconcile with her estranged sister after a 20-year feud. The emotional journey takes a dramatic turn as the patient seeks her sister's bone marrow for treatment. Released on the 18th of December 1996 with a budget of 23.0 million dollars, this heartfelt film explores the complexities of family relationships and the power of forgiveness in the face of adversity.

title = Antonia's Line 
overview = After World War II, Antonia and her daughter, Danielle, go back to their Dutch hometown, where Antonia's late mother has bestowed a small farm upon her. There, Antonia settles down and joins a tightly-knit but unusual community. Those around her include quirky friend Crooked Finger, would-be suitor Bas and, eventually for Antonia, a granddaughter and great-granddaughter who help create a strong family of empowered women. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : production countrie = Netherlands 

In the heartwarming film "Antonia's Line," we follow the journey of Antonia and her daughter, Danielle, as they return to their Dutch hometown after World War II. Upon inheriting a small farm from her late mother, Antonia embraces a new life and becomes part of a unique and close-knit community. Alongside quirky characters like Crooked Finger and the would-be suitor Bas, Antonia forms strong bonds with her granddaughter and great-granddaughter, leading to a powerful family of empowered women. As the story unfolds, we witness the resilience and strength of these women as they navigate life's challenges and triumphs in a beautifully portrayed setting.

Facts included in the description:
1. Antonia and Danielle return to their Dutch hometown after World War II.
2. Antonia inherits a small farm from her late mother.
3. Antonia settles down and joins a tightly-knit but unusual community.
4. Quirky friend Crooked Finger is part of the community.
5. Would-be suitor Bas is part of the community.
6. Antonia has a granddaughter and great-granddaughter.
7. The film portrays a strong family of empowered women.

title = The Good Humor Man 
overview = Biff Jones is a driver/salesman for the Good Humor ice-cream company. He hopes to marry his girl Margie, who works as a secretary for Stuart Nagel, an insurance investigator. Margie won't marry Biff, though, because she is the sole support of her kid brother, Johnny. Biff gets involved with Bonnie, a young woman he tries to rescue from gangsters. But Biff's attempts to help her only get him accused of murder. When the police refuse to believe his story, it's up to Biff and Johnny to prove Biff's innocence and solve the crime. 
date of release = the 1 of June 1950 
budget = 231.4 millions of dollars 
cast = Jack Carson, Lola Albright, Jean Wallace, George Reeves 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Lloyd Bacon 
duration of the movie = 1h20 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 1 of June 1950 

In the 1950 film "The Good Humor Man," directed by Lloyd Bacon, we follow the story of Biff Jones, a driver/salesman for the Good Humor ice-cream company. Biff is in love with Margie, who works as a secretary for an insurance investigator. However, Margie is hesitant to marry Biff as she is the sole provider for her younger brother, Johnny. Things take a dark turn when Biff gets entangled with Bonnie, a young woman in trouble with gangsters, leading to him being wrongly accused of murder. With the police refusing to believe his side of the story, it's up to Biff and Johnny to clear his name and solve the crime. Starring Jack Carson, Lola Albright, Jean Wallace, and George Reeves, this English-language film has a runtime of 1 hour and 20 minutes. With a budget of 231.4 million dollars, "The Good Humor Man" was produced by Columbia Pictures and was released on June 1st, 1950.

['correct']

title = Smiley Face 
overview = Jane (Anna Faris), a struggling but perpetually stoned actress, has a busy day ahead. She has several important tasks on her list, including buying more marijuana. Even though she already has a good start on the day's planned drug use, she eats her roommate's pot-laced cupcakes and embarks on a series of misadventures all over Los Angeles. 
duration of the movie = 1h28 
Director = Gregg Araki 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h28 

In "Smiley Face," directed by Gregg Araki, we follow Jane, a perpetually stoned actress portrayed by Anna Faris, as she navigates a chaotic day in Los Angeles. With a duration of 1 hour and 28 minutes, Jane finds herself in a series of misadventures after mistakenly consuming her roommate's pot-laced cupcakes. Despite having important tasks to complete, such as buying more marijuana, Jane's day spirals into a hilarious and unpredictable journey filled with comedic moments. Will Jane be able to overcome the challenges that come her way, or will her high antics lead to even more trouble? Join Jane on her wild ride through LA in this quirky and entertaining film. The movie features Jane as a struggling actress and her adventures take her all over Los Angeles.

title = 51 
overview = Due to political pressure from the American public, the Air Force has decided to allow two well-known reporters limited access to the most secretive base on the planet. But when one of the base’s “long-term visitors” exploits this unprecedented visit as a chance to liberate himself and his fellow alien captives, Area 51 turns from a secure government base to a horrifying destination of terror.

fact : duration of the movie = 1h27 

In the thrilling movie "51," produced by Courtney Solomon, the Air Force faces intense scrutiny from the American public, leading to the decision to grant two reporters limited access to the highly classified Area 51. However, the situation takes a terrifying turn when one of the mysterious "long-term visitors" seizes the opportunity to break free, unleashing chaos and fear within the once secure government facility. As the tension escalates, the reporters find themselves trapped in a nightmarish battle for survival against otherworldly forces. With a runtime of 1 hour and 27 minutes, "51" delivers a gripping tale of conspiracy, escape, and the chilling unknown lurking within the infamous Area 51. The movie title is "51," the duration is 1 hour and 27 minutes, and the producer is Courtney Solomon.

title = The Very Thought of You 
overview = Laurence recounts to his neighbour how his life long friendship with Frank and Daniel has been overturned in just three days by their each independently meeting, and falling for, Martha, who has no idea of their connection. Slowly the tale unfolds, the narrative moving backwards and forwards gradually filling in the gaps until we see the whole picture 
date of release = the 8 of May 1998 
Director = Nick Hamm 
tagline = Two's Company. Three's a Crowd. Four's a Disaster. 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Grainne Marmion 
average note = 5.0 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 8 of May 1998 

In the romantic comedy "The Very Thought of You," directed by Nick Hamm and released on the 8th of May 1998, Laurence finds himself in a complicated situation when his lifelong friends, Frank and Daniel, all fall for the charming Martha without her knowing their connection. As Laurence recounts this love triangle to his neighbor, the story unfolds in a non-linear narrative, gradually revealing the full picture of their entangled relationships. With a tagline that states "Two's Company. Three's a Crowd. Four's a Disaster," this English-language film produced by Grainne Marmion keeps viewers on their toes as the characters navigate the complexities of love and friendship. With an average rating of 5.0, "The Very Thought of You" offers a unique take on the classic romantic comedy genre.

title = Berserk 
overview = Monica Rivers, is the owner and ringmaster of a traveling circus and who'll stop at nothing to draw bigger audiences. When a series of mysterious murders begins to occur and some of her performers die gruesomely, her profits soar. She hires high-wire walker Frank Hawkins, impressed by the handsome and muscular young man. They begin an affair which arouses her previous lover Durando's jealousy. When Durando is found dead shortly afterward, the other performers begin to take alarm, as a mysterious killer is obviously loose in their midst. Many suspect Monica herself of the killings, especially Matilda, who has set her sights on Monica's new lover. At this point, Monica's unruly, sixteen-year-old daughter Angela, is expelled from school for being incorrigible and Monica is forced to take her into the circus, allowing her to become the partner of knife-thrower Gustavo. Meanwhile, the dead bodies continue to pile up... 
Producer = Herman Cohen 
Director = Jim O'Connolly 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Herman Cohen 

In the thrilling movie "Berserk," directed by Jim O'Connolly and produced by Herman Cohen, Monica Rivers is the fearless owner and ringmaster of a traveling circus. As mysterious murders plague the circus and performers meet gruesome fates, Monica's profits skyrocket. To attract bigger audiences, she hires the handsome high-wire walker Frank Hawkins, sparking jealousy in her former lover Durando. When Durando meets a grim end, suspicions arise among the troupe, with many pointing fingers at Monica herself. Amidst the chaos, Monica's rebellious daughter Angela joins the circus, forming a dangerous partnership with knife-thrower Gustavo. As the body count rises, the identity of the killer remains shrouded in mystery, keeping both the characters and the audience on edge.

Facts included in the final description:
- Monica Rivers is the owner and ringmaster of a traveling circus.
- Mysterious murders occur, and some performers die gruesomely.
- Monica's profits soar as the murders happen.
- Monica hires high-wire walker Frank Hawkins.
- Monica has a previous lover named Durando.
- Durando is found dead.
- Monica's daughter Angela joins the circus.
- Angela becomes the partner of knife-thrower Gustavo.
- The movie was produced by Herman Cohen.
- The movie was directed by Jim O'Connolly.
- The original language of the movie is English.

To attract bigger audiences, she hires the handsome high-wire walker Frank Hawkins, sparking jealousy in her former lover Durando. When Durando meets a grim end, suspicions arise among the troupe, with many pointing fingers at Monica herself. Amidst the chaos, Monica's rebellious daughter Angela joins the circus, forming a dangerous partnership with knife-thrower Gustavo. As the body count rises, the identity of the killer remains shrouded in mystery, keeping both the characters and the audience on edge.

Facts included in the final description:
- Monica Rivers is the owner and ringmaster of a traveling circus.
- Mysterious murders occur, and some performers die gruesomely.
- Monica's profits soar as the murders happen.
- Monica hires high-wire walker Frank Hawkins.
- Monica has a previous lover named Durando.
- Durando is found dead.
- Monica's daughter Angela joins the circus.
- Angela becomes the partner of knife-thrower Gustavo.
- The movie was produced by Herman Cohen.
- The movie was directed by Jim O'Connolly.
- The original language of the movie is English.

When Durando meets a grim end, suspicions arise among the troupe, with many pointing fingers at Monica herself. Amidst the chaos, Monica's rebellious daughter Angela joins the circus, forming a dangerous partnership with knife-thrower Gustavo. title = The Man Who Loved Women 
overview = 1983 Burt Reynolds version -- This is the tale of a sculptor named David who has a major womanizing problem. He goes to seek help from a psychiatrist, Marianna, to cure him of his obsession with women. His story of sexual and romantic exploits with the ladies is told by Marianna. 
date of release = the 18 of December 1983 
average note = 4.4 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 18 of December 1983 

In the 1983 film "The Man Who Loved Women," Burt Reynolds stars as David, a sculptor with a notorious womanizing problem. Seeking help from psychiatrist Marianna, David aims to overcome his obsession with women. Through their sessions, Marianna unravels David's captivating yet tumultuous tale of his numerous sexual and romantic escapades. Released on December 18, 1983, this film delves into the complexities of love, desire, and the consequences of one man's insatiable appetite for women. With an average rating of 4.4, this movie offers a compelling exploration of one man's journey towards self-discovery and redemption.

title = Fahrenheit 451 
overview = In the future, an oppressive government maintains control of public opinion by outlawing literature and maintaining a group of enforcers known as "firemen" to perform the necessary book burnings. Fireman Montag begins to question the morality of his vocation. Curious about the world of books, he soon falls in love with a beautiful young member of a pro-literature underground - and with literature itself. 
Producer = Lewis M. Allen 
date of release = the 14 of September 1966 
tagline = Aflame with the excitement and emotions of tomorrow! 
budget = 178.1 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h52 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Lewis M. Allen 

In a dystopian future where literature is outlawed, "Fahrenheit 451" follows the story of Montag, a fireman tasked with burning books to control public opinion. As Montag begins to question the morality of his actions, he embarks on a journey of self-discovery and rebellion. Produced by Lewis M. Allen, this thought-provoking film was released on the 14th of September 1966. With a budget of 178.1 million dollars, the movie runs for 1 hour and 52 minutes, captivating audiences with its tagline: "Aflame with the excitement and emotions of tomorrow!"

title = Cloud Atlas 
overview = A set of six nested stories spanning time between the 19th century and a distant post-apocalyptic future. Cloud Atlas explores how the actions and consequences of individual lives impact one another throughout the past, the present and the future. Action, mystery and romance weave through the story as one soul is shaped from a killer into a hero and a single act of kindness ripples across centuries to inspire a revolution in the distant future.  Based on the award winning novel by David Mitchell. Directed by Tom Tykwer and the Wachowskis. 
production countrie = Germany 
revenue = 130.5 millions of dollars 
budget = 102.0 millions of dollars 
Director = Tom Tykwer 
date of release = the 26 of October 2012 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = Germany 

title = Cloud Atlas 
overview = In the visually stunning and thought-provoking film "Cloud Atlas," directed by Tom Tykwer and the Wachowskis, viewers are taken on a journey through time, spanning from the 19th century to a distant post-apocalyptic future. The movie intricately weaves together six nested stories that explore how the actions and consequences of individual lives impact one another across different eras - past, present, and future. Action, mystery, and romance intertwine as the narrative follows the transformation of a soul from a killer to a hero, with a single act of kindness sending ripples across centuries to spark a revolution in the distant future. Based on the award-winning novel by David Mitchell, this German production captivates audiences with its epic scope and profound exploration of interconnectedness. Released on the 26th of October 2012, "Cloud Atlas" grossed an impressive $130.5 million worldwide, surpassing its $102 million budget. 
production countrie = Germany 
revenue = 130.5 millions of dollars 
budget = 102.0 millions of dollars 
Director = Tom Tykwer 
date of release = the 26 of October 2012 

The description includes all the provided facts.

['correct']
fact : revenue = 130.5 millions of dollars

Based on the award-winning novel by David Mitchell, this German production captivates audiences with its epic scope and profound exploration of interconnectedness. title = Cloud Atlas 
overview = In the visually stunning and thought-provoking film "Cloud Atlas," directed by Tom Tykwer and the Wachowskis, viewers are taken on a journey through time, spanning from the 19th century to a distant post-apocalyptic future. The movie intricately weaves together six nested stories that explore how the actions and consequences of individual lives impact one another across different eras - past, present, and future. Action, mystery, and romance intertwine as the narrative follows the transformation of a soul from a killer to a hero, with a single act of kindness sending ripples across centuries to spark a revolution in the distant future. Based on the award-winning novel by David Mitchell, this German production captivates audiences with its epic scope and profound exploration of interconnectedness. Released on the 26th of October 2012, "Cloud Atlas" grossed an impressive $130.5 million worldwide, surpassing its $102 million budget. 
production countrie = Germany 
revenue = 130.5 millions of dollars 
budget = 102.0 millions of dollars 
Director = Tom Tykwer 
date of release = the 26 of October 2012 

The description includes all the provided facts. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 26 of October 2012

title = Private Property 
overview = A hoodlum (Corey Allen) plots to seduce a lonely housewife (Kate Manx) and turn her over to his virginal friend (Warren Oates). 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 94.8 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the English-language film "Private Property," a cunning hoodlum named Corey Allen plots to seduce a desolate housewife, Kate Manx, and then deliver her to his inexperienced companion, Warren Oates. As the plot unfolds, tensions rise and desires clash in this gripping tale of manipulation and betrayal. With a staggering revenue of 94.8 million dollars, this movie captivates audiences with its intense storyline and stellar performances.

title = Bitter Rice 
overview = Francesca and Walter are two-bit criminals in Northern Italy, and, in an effort to avoid the police, Francesca joins a group of women rice workers. She meets the voluptuous peasant rice worker, Silvana, and the soon-to-be-discharged soldier, Marco. Walter follows her to the rice fields, and the four characters become involved in a complex plot involving robbery, love, and murder. 
production compagnie = Lux Film 
Director = Giuseppe De Santis 
date of release = the 21 of September 1949 
cast = Vittorio Gassman, Doris Dowling, Silvana Mangano, Raf Vallone 
Producer = Dino De Laurentiis 
average note = 7.2 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Lux Film 

In the 1949 film "Bitter Rice," directed by Giuseppe De Santis and produced by Lux Film and Dino De Laurentiis, viewers are taken on a thrilling journey through Northern Italy. The story follows Francesca and Walter, two small-time criminals on the run from the police. To evade capture, Francesca immerses herself in a group of women rice workers, where she encounters the alluring Silvana and the soon-to-be-discharged soldier, Marco. As Walter tracks Francesca to the rice fields, a tangled web of robbery, love, and murder unfolds among the four characters. Starring Vittorio Gassman, Doris Dowling, Silvana Mangano, and Raf Vallone, "Bitter Rice" captivates audiences with its intricate plot and compelling performances. With an average rating of 7.2, this classic film continues to stand the test of time since its release on the 21st of September 1949. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Giuseppe De Santis

title = The Brotherhood of Satan 
overview = A family is trapped in a desert town by a cult of senior-citizens who recruit the town's children to worship Satan. 
budget = 148.0 millions of dollars 
revenue = 16.3 millions of dollars 
cast = Strother Martin, L.Q. Jones, Charles Bateman, Ahna Capri 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures Corporation 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Bernard McEveety 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 148.0 millions of dollars 

In "The Brotherhood of Satan," directed by Bernard McEveety, a chilling tale unfolds as a family finds themselves ensnared in a desert town controlled by a cult of elderly individuals. This cult, led by the town's seniors, manipulates the children of the community into worshipping Satan. Starring Strother Martin, L.Q. Jones, Charles Bateman, and Ahna Capri, this eerie thriller takes place in the United States of America and was produced by Columbia Pictures Corporation. With a budget of 148.0 million dollars, the film garnered a revenue of 16.3 million dollars, showcasing a sinister narrative that will leave viewers on the edge of their seats. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 16.3 millions of dollars

This cult, led by the town's seniors, manipulates the children of the community into worshipping Satan. Starring Strother Martin, L.Q. Jones, Charles Bateman, and Ahna Capri, this eerie thriller takes place in the United States of America and was produced by Columbia Pictures Corporation. With a budget of 148.0 million dollars, the film garnered a revenue of 16.3 million dollars, showcasing a sinister narrative that will leave viewers on the edge of their seats.

title = The Trouble with the Truth 
overview = Musician and starving artist Robert reconsiders his own failed marriage to Emily after his daughter announces that she's engaged. 
budget = 181.6 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.3 
Director = Jim Hemphill 
duration of the movie = 1h36 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = There are two sides to every love story. 
cast = Lea Thompson, John Shea, Danielle Harris, Keri Lynn Pratt 
revenue = 71.8 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 21 of October 2011 
Producer = Thommy Hutson 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 181.6 millions of dollars 

In the thought-provoking film "The Trouble with the Truth," directed by Jim Hemphill and produced by Thommy Hutson, we follow the journey of musician and struggling artist Robert as he reflects on his past marriage to Emily, especially when his daughter drops a bombshell announcement about her engagement. With a stellar cast including Lea Thompson, John Shea, Danielle Harris, and Keri Lynn Pratt, the movie delves into the complexities of relationships and the consequences of choices made. As the tagline suggests, "There are two sides to every love story," inviting viewers to ponder the different perspectives presented. Despite receiving an average note of 6.3, the film managed to generate a revenue of 71.8 million dollars, though it fell short of its substantial budget of 181.6 million dollars. Released on the 21st of October 2011, in its 1 hour and 36-minute runtime, "The Trouble with the Truth" explores the nuances of love, regret, and the enduring impact of past decisions, all conveyed in the original language of English.

title = The Two Mrs. Carrolls 
overview = Struggling artist Geoffrey Carroll meets Sally while on holiday in the country. A romance develops, but he doesn't tell her he's already married. Suffering from mental illness, Geoffrey returns home where he paints an impression of his wife as the angel of death and then promptly poisons her. He marries Sally but after a while he finds a strange urge to paint her as the angel of death too and history seems about to repeat itself. 
budget = 131.3 millions of dollars 
revenue = 155.2 millions of dollars 
cast = Humphrey Bogart, Barbara Stanwyck, Alexis Smith, Nigel Bruce 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 131.3 millions of dollars 

In "The Two Mrs. Carrolls," struggling artist Geoffrey Carroll embarks on a romantic journey with Sally, unaware that he is already married. As his mental illness unravels, Geoffrey's dark artistic expressions manifest in chilling ways, leading him to poison his first wife and marry Sally. The stellar cast including Humphrey Bogart, Barbara Stanwyck, Alexis Smith, and Nigel Bruce brings this psychological thriller to life. With a budget of 131.3 million dollars, the film grossed 155.2 million dollars, captivating audiences with its sinister tale of love and betrayal.

['correct']

title = When a Stranger Calls 
overview = Far away from the site of a gruesome murder, a teenager named Jill Johnson arrives at a luxurious home for a baby-sitting job. With the children fast asleep, she settles in for what she expects to be an ordinary evening. Soon, the ringing of a phone and the frightening words of a sadistic caller turn Jill's routine experience into a night of terror. 
average note = 5.4 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Camilla Belle, Katie Cassidy, Tommy Flanagan, Brian Geraghty 
budget = 15.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Davis Entertainment 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 5.4 

In "When a Stranger Calls," a teenage babysitter named Jill Johnson finds herself in a luxurious home, far from a gruesome murder scene. As she settles in for a seemingly ordinary evening with the children asleep, a chilling phone call from a sadistic stranger turns her night into a terrifying ordeal. Starring Camilla Belle, Katie Cassidy, Tommy Flanagan, and Brian Geraghty, this English-language thriller keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. Produced by Davis Entertainment in the United States of America with a budget of 15.0 million dollars, this film delivers suspense and fear in equal measure. With an average rating of 5.4, "When a Stranger Calls" is a must-watch for fans of psychological horror.
