title = Super Duper Alice Cooper 
overview = Emerging from the Detroit music scene of the 1970s in a flurry of long hair and sequins, Alice Cooper restored hard rock with a sense of showmanship, while simultaneously striking fear into the hearts of Middle America with the chicken-slaughtering, dead-baby-eating theatrics that would cement his identity as a glam metal icon. Meticulously crafted from rare archival footage, Super Duper Alice Cooper tells the story of the man behind the makeup, Vincent Furnier, the son of a preacher, who got caught in the grip of his own monster. 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Eagle Rock Entertainment 
budget = 197.0 millions of dollars 
Producer = Sam Dunn 
tagline = Welcome to his nightmare. 
date of release = the 17 of April 2014 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the mesmerizing documentary "Super Duper Alice Cooper," viewers are taken on a thrilling journey through the rise of the iconic rock star, Alice Cooper. Emerging from the vibrant Detroit music scene of the 1970s, Alice Cooper captivated audiences with his unique blend of hard rock and showmanship. However, it was his controversial and shocking theatrics, including chicken-slaughtering and dead-baby-eating acts, that truly solidified his status as a glam metal legend, striking fear into the hearts of Middle America. 

Crafted with precision from rare archival footage, this film delves deep into the life of Vincent Furnier, the man behind the makeup, who found himself entangled in the grip of his own monstrous creation. Directed by Sam Dunn and produced by Eagle Rock Entertainment, "Super Duper Alice Cooper" offers a fascinating glimpse into the complex journey of a preacher's son turned rock sensation. 

As the tagline aptly suggests, viewers are welcomed into Alice Cooper's nightmare, experiencing the highs and lows of his tumultuous career. Released on April 17, 2014, this English-language production with a budget of 197.0 million dollars is a must-watch for music enthusiasts and fans of rock history alike.

title = Follow Me Quietly 
overview = 1949 thriller about the hunt for a serial killer known as "the Judge" who kills his victims on rainy nights. 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 7 of July 1949 
Producer = Herman Schlom 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 171.5 millions of dollars 
cast = William Lundigan, Dorothy Patrick, Jeff Corey, Nestor Paiva 
duration of the movie = 1h00 
average note = 5.0 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the 1949 thriller "Follow Me Quietly," viewers are taken on a suspenseful journey as law enforcement races against time to capture a notorious serial killer known as "the Judge." This elusive murderer strikes only on rainy nights, adding an extra layer of tension to the gripping storyline. Set in the United States of America, the film was released on the 7th of July 1949 and was produced by Herman Schlom. The talented cast includes William Lundigan, Dorothy Patrick, Jeff Corey, and Nestor Paiva, who deliver captivating performances in English, the original language of the movie. With a budget of 171.5 million dollars, the movie keeps audiences on the edge of their seats for its 1-hour duration. Despite its thrilling premise, "Follow Me Quietly" received an average rating of 5.0, making it a must-watch for fans of classic suspense cinema.

title = Pokémon: The First Movie: Mewtwo Strikes Back 
overview = The adventure explodes into action with the debut of Mewtwo, a bio-engineered Pokemon created from the DNA of Mew, the rarest of all Pokemon. Determined to prove its superiority, Mewtwo lures Ash, Pikachu and others into a Pokemon match like none before. Mewtwo vs. Mew. Super-clones vs. Pokemon. It's the ultimate showdown ... with the very future of the world at stake! 
average note = 6.7 
budget = 30.0 millions of dollars 
tagline = The Pokémon Match of All Time is Here. 
original language of the movie = Japanese 
Director = Michael Haigney 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.7 

In the thrilling "Pokémon: The First Movie: Mewtwo Strikes Back," the world of Pokémon is forever changed with the introduction of Mewtwo, a powerful bio-engineered Pokémon created from the DNA of the rare Mew. Determined to assert its dominance, Mewtwo challenges Ash, Pikachu, and other Pokémon to an unprecedented match - Mewtwo vs. Mew, super-clones vs. Pokémon. As the ultimate showdown unfolds, the fate of the world hangs in the balance. Directed by Michael Haigney and originally in Japanese, this film with an average rating of 6.7 and a budget of 30.0 million dollars brings the iconic tagline to life: "The Pokémon Match of All Time is Here." Don't miss this epic battle that will leave you on the edge of your seat.

Determined to assert its dominance, Mewtwo challenges Ash, Pikachu, and other Pokémon to an unprecedented match - Mewtwo vs. Mew, super-clones vs. Pokémon. As the ultimate showdown unfolds, the fate of the world hangs in the balance. title = Bloody Murder 
overview = Julie McConnell is one of a dozen camp counselors working to re-open a summer camp when a series of murders and disappearances begin commited by a hockey masked killer who may be the urban legend killer Trevor Moorehouse. When Julie looks into the murders by herself, she finds that she may be the killer's next target when she gets too close to some dark secrets of the camp which may lead to the killer's identity. 
cast = Jessica Morris, Peter Guillemette, Patrick Cavanaugh, Crystalle Ford 
average note = 3.6 
duration of the movie = 1h28 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 102.2 millions of dollars 
revenue = 213.1 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Jessica Morris, Peter Guillemette, Patrick Cavanaugh, Crystalle Ford 

In the heart-pounding thriller "Bloody Murder," Julie McConnell, portrayed by Jessica Morris, finds herself in a terrifying situation as a series of murders and disappearances plague the summer camp she is working at. Alongside her fellow counselors, played by Peter Guillemette, Patrick Cavanaugh, and Crystalle Ford, Julie delves into the dark secrets of the camp in an attempt to uncover the identity of the hockey masked killer terrorizing them. When Julie looks into the murders by herself, she finds that she may be the killer's next target when she gets too close to some dark secrets of the camp which may lead to the killer's identity. As she gets closer to the truth, Julie realizes she may be the next target on the killer's list. With a gripping runtime of 1 hour and 28 minutes, this intense film, set in the United States of America, keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. With a budget of 102.2 million dollars and a revenue of 213.1 million dollars, "Bloody Murder" delivers a chilling tale that will leave audiences questioning who can be trusted in the face of danger. The average note for the movie is 3.6.

title = The Inspector General 
overview = An illiterate stooge in a traveling medicine show wanders into a strange town and is picked up on a vagrancy charge. The town's corrupt officials mistake him for the inspector general whom they think is traveling in disguise. Fearing he will discover they've been pocketing tax money, they make several bungled attempts to kill him. 
revenue = 92.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 31 of December 1949 
production compagnie = Warner Bros. 
duration of the movie = 1h41 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Danny Kaye, Walter Slezak, Barbara Bates, Elsa Lanchester 
Director = Henry Koster 
Producer = Jerry Wald 
average note = 6.2 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 92.0 millions of dollars 

In the classic comedy film "The Inspector General," directed by Henry Koster and produced by Jerry Wald, an illiterate stooge finds himself in a peculiar situation when he is mistaken for the inspector general by corrupt officials in a strange town. With a stellar cast including Danny Kaye, Walter Slezak, Barbara Bates, and Elsa Lanchester, the officials attempt to eliminate him to prevent their embezzlement of tax money from being exposed. As the hilarious chaos unfolds in this Warner Bros. production, the film captivates audiences with its witty humor and clever plot twists. Released on the 31st of December 1949 in the United States of America, "The Inspector General" grossed an impressive $92.0 million at the box office and received an average rating of 6.2.

['correct']
fact : date of release = the 31 of December 1949

In the classic comedy film "The Inspector General," directed by Henry Koster and produced by Jerry Wald, an illiterate stooge finds himself in a peculiar situation when he is mistaken for the inspector general by corrupt officials in a strange town. With a stellar cast including Danny Kaye, Walter Slezak, Barbara Bates, and Elsa Lanchester, the officials attempt to eliminate him to prevent their embezzlement of tax money from being exposed. As the hilarious chaos unfolds in this Warner Bros. production, the film captivates audiences with its witty humor and clever plot twists. Released on the 31st of December 1949 in the United States of America, "The Inspector General" grossed an impressive $92.0 million at the box office and received an average rating of 6.2.

title = Curse of the Puppet Master 
overview = Robert "Tank" begins to work for Dr. Magrew sculpting a puppet for the Doctor to bring to life using the work of Andre Toulon. Robert begins to fall in love with the Doctors daughter, Jane. Unbeknownst to Robert the Doctor is trying to create a "perfect race" of puppet humans. Jane discovers a "matt puppet" which is from his first assistant. She comes back just in time to see her father, cut up by the puppets, has succeeded in putting a living human, Robert, into the puppet he carved. 
cast = George Peck, Emily Harrison, Josh Green, Michael Guerin 
Producer = Kirk Edward Hansen 
budget = 79.5 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h30 
date of release = the 26 of May 1998 
original language of the movie = Portuguese 
production compagnie = Full Moon Entertainment 
Director = David DeCoteau 
average note = 3.6 
revenue = 229.4 millions of dollars 
tagline = Four Years Ago, the Puppets of Andre Toulon Vanished Without a Trace. Now The Puppets have Found a New Home, And a New Puppet Master. 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = George Peck, Emily Harrison, Josh Green, Michael Guerin 

In "Curse of the Puppet Master," directed by David DeCoteau, a young man named Robert "Tank" finds himself working for Dr. Magrew, assisting in sculpting a puppet with the intention of bringing it to life using the techniques of Andre Toulon. As Robert becomes romantically involved with the Doctor's daughter, Jane, he is unaware of the sinister plan unfolding around him. Dr. Magrew is secretly striving to create a "perfect race" of puppet humans, leading to a series of chilling events. When Jane stumbles upon a mysterious "matt puppet" linked to a former assistant, she uncovers the horrifying truth about her father's experiments. The movie, released on May 26, 1998, in the United States, features a talented cast including George Peck, Emily Harrison, Josh Green, and Michael Guerin. With a budget of 79.5 million dollars, the film went on to gross an impressive 229.4 million dollars at the box office. Despite its original language being Portuguese, "Curse of the Puppet Master" received an average rating of 3.6. The tagline "Four Years Ago, the Puppets of Andre Toulon Vanished Without a Trace. Now The Puppets have Found a New Home, And a New Puppet Master" sets the eerie tone for this Full Moon Entertainment production. The production company behind the film is Full Moon Entertainment. The producer of the movie is Kirk Edward Hansen. The duration of the movie is 1 hour and 30 minutes.

['correct']

title = Puppet Master: The Legacy 
overview = Peter Hertz tells a woman the past stories about the puppets, but she secretly wants to kill them. 
date of release = the 16 of December 2003 
budget = 175.4 millions of dollars 
tagline = Now the legacy can be told. 
Director = Charles Band 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 2.1 
Producer = Kurt Iswarienko 
cast = Jacob Witkin, Kate Orsini 
duration of the movie = 1h12 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Shadow Entertainment 
revenue = 138.8 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 16 of December 2003 

In "Puppet Master: The Legacy," directed by Charles Band and released on the 16th of December 2003, Peter Hertz recounts the dark and mysterious tales of the puppets to a woman who harbors a deadly secret agenda to eliminate them. With a budget of 175.4 million dollars, this English-language film produced by Shadow Entertainment and produced by Kurt Iswarienko features a star-studded cast including Jacob Witkin and Kate Orsini. As the tagline suggests, "Now the legacy can be told," as the movie unfolds in a compact duration of 1 hour and 12 minutes. Despite an average rating of 2.1, the film managed to generate a revenue of 138.8 million dollars, captivating audiences in the United States of America and beyond.

title = Dan in Real Life 
overview = Advice columnist, Dan Burns is an expert on relationships, but somehow struggles to succeed as a brother, a son and a single parent to three precocious daughters. Things get even more complicated when Dan finds out that the woman he falls in love with is actually his brother's new girlfriend. 
budget = 25.0 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = Something's happening to Dan. It's confusing. It's awkward. It's family. 
Producer = Brad Epstein 
date of release = the 26 of October 2007 
revenue = 68.4 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Touchstone Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 25.0 millions of dollars 

In the heartwarming film "Dan in Real Life," we follow the life of Dan Burns, an advice columnist who excels in guiding others through relationships but finds himself struggling in his own familial roles. As a devoted single parent to three spirited daughters, Dan faces challenges balancing his duties as a brother and a son. The plot thickens when Dan unexpectedly falls for a woman, only to discover she is dating his own brother. Produced by Brad Epstein and released on October 26, 2007, under Touchstone Pictures, this English-language movie beautifully captures the complexities of love, family, and self-discovery. With a budget of 25.0 million dollars, "Dan in Real Life" went on to earn a remarkable revenue of 68.4 million dollars. As the tagline suggests, something truly unique and familial is happening to Dan in this heartfelt and relatable tale.

title = Tremors 4: The Legend Begins 
overview = This prequel of the bone-chilling Tremors begins in the town of Rejection, Nev., in 1889, where 17 men die under mysterious circumstances. Spooked by recent events, the miners who populate the town leave in droves until there's nothing left but a shell of a community. It's up to the remaining residents to get to the bottom of the deaths -- but they must do so before they, too, are eradicated off the face of the planet. 
budget = 5.0 millions of dollars 
average note = 5.4 
Producer = Nancy Roberts 
date of release = the 2 of January 2004 
production compagnie = Stampede Entertainment 
revenue = 186.3 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = A Revolution Has Begun... 
cast = Michael Gross, Sara Botsford, Billy Drago, Brent Roam 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 5.0 millions of dollars 

In "Tremors 4: The Legend Begins," set in the town of Rejection, Nev., in 1889, a series of mysterious deaths claims the lives of 17 men, leading to a mass exodus of miners and leaving the community on the brink of collapse. As the remaining residents grapple with the sinister forces at play, they must uncover the truth behind the killings before they meet a similar fate. Produced by Nancy Roberts under Stampede Entertainment, this prequel to the bone-chilling Tremors franchise features a stellar cast including Michael Gross, Sara Botsford, Billy Drago, and Brent Roam. With a budget of 5.0 million dollars, the film garnered a revenue of 186.3 million dollars upon its release on January 2, 2004. Spine-tingling and suspenseful, "Tremors 4: The Legend Begins" delivers a thrilling tale of survival and mystery, as a revolution unfolds in the Old West. The original language of the movie is English. The average note for the movie is 5.4. The tagline for the movie is "A Revolution Has Begun." The production country is the United States of America.

title = You Light Up My Life 
overview = Laurie has been in show business since she was a child. Her dream is to be a singer, songwriter and actress. Her father wants her to be a comedian like him and Laurie only tries because it pleases her father. But she is a lousy comedian. She auditions for everything and is engaged to Ken, but Ken does not understand her needs. She has a one night stand with Chris, only to later find that he is a director. She has many emotions that have not yet been addressed and she must face them before she can get on with her life. 
average note = 5.3 
revenue = 28.7 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 16.9 millions of dollars 
Producer = Joseph Brooks 
duration of the movie = 1h30 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = Sometimes when you reach for a dream you have to leave something behind. 
cast = Didi Conn, Joe Silver, Michael Zaslow, Melanie Mayron 
Director = Joseph Brooks 
date of release = the 31 of August 1977 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 5.3 

In the 1977 film "You Light Up My Life," we follow Laurie, a talented individual with dreams of becoming a singer, songwriter, and actress. Despite her passion for music, Laurie finds herself entangled in the world of comedy at the insistence of her father, a comedian. Struggling to find her true calling, Laurie auditions for various roles while navigating a complicated relationship with her fiancé, Ken, who fails to understand her aspirations. A chance encounter with Chris, a director, leads to a one-night stand that forces Laurie to confront her unresolved emotions. As she grapples with her inner turmoil, Laurie must come to terms with her desires and make peace with her past in order to move forward. Directed by Joseph Brooks, this American production features a talented cast including Didi Conn, Joe Silver, Michael Zaslow, and Melanie Mayron. With a runtime of 1 hour and 30 minutes, "You Light Up My Life" explores the sacrifices and challenges one faces in pursuit of their dreams. Remember, sometimes when you reach for a dream, you have to leave something behind.

Facts included in the description:
- Laurie has been in show business since she was a child.
- Laurie's dream is to be a singer, songwriter, and actress.
- Laurie's father wants her to be a comedian like him.
- Laurie auditions for everything.
- Laurie is engaged to Ken.
- Laurie has a one night stand with Chris, who is a director.
- The film was released on the 31st of August 1977.
- The film's producer is Joseph Brooks.
- The film's duration is 1 hour and 30 minutes.

fact : revenue = 28.7 millions of dollars 

In the 1977 film "You Light Up My Life," we follow Laurie, a talented individual with dreams of becoming a singer, songwriter, and actress. Despite her passion for music, Laurie finds herself entangled in the world of comedy at the insistence of her father, a comedian. Struggling to find her true calling, Laurie auditions for various roles while navigating a complicated relationship with her fiancé, Ken, who fails to understand her aspirations. A chance encounter with Chris, a director, leads to a one-night stand that forces Laurie to confront her unresolved emotions. As she grapples with her inner turmoil, Laurie must come to terms with her desires and make peace with her past in order to move forward. Directed by Joseph Brooks, this American production features a talented cast including Didi Conn, Joe Silver, Michael Zaslow, and Melanie Mayron. With a runtime of 1 hour and 30 minutes, "You Light Up My Life" explores the sacrifices and challenges one faces in pursuit of their dreams. Remember, sometimes when you reach for a dream, you have to leave something behind.

Facts included in the description:
- Laurie has been in show business since she was a child.
- Laurie's dream is to be a singer, songwriter, and actress.
- Laurie's father wants her to be a comedian like him.
- Laurie auditions for everything.
- Laurie is engaged to Ken.
- Laurie has a one night stand with Chris, who is a director.
- The film was released on the 31st of August 1977.
- The film's producer is Joseph Brooks.
- The film's duration is 1 hour and 30 minutes.
- The original language of the film is English.
- The film was produced in the United States of America.
- The film's tagline is "Sometimes when you reach for a dream you have to leave something behind."
- The average note for the film is 5.3.
- The film's revenue was 28.7 million dollars.
- The film's budget was 16.9 million dollars.

Despite her passion for music, Laurie finds herself entangled in the world of comedy at the insistence of her father, a comedian. Struggling to find her true calling, Laurie auditions for various roles while navigating a complicated relationship with her fiancé, Ken, who fails to understand her aspirations. A chance encounter with Chris, a director, leads to a one-night stand that forces Laurie to confront her unresolved emotions. title = McLaren 
overview = The story of New Zealander, Bruce McLaren, who founded the McLaren Motor Racing team, showing the world that a man of humble beginnings could take on the elite of motor racing and win. 
tagline = Pioneer. Leader. Father. Champion. 
revenue = 163.4 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h34 
cast = Dwayne Cameron, Mario Andretti, Alastair Caldwell, Matt Coldrick 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = General Film Corporation 
production countrie = New Zealand 
budget = 93.5 millions of dollars 
average note = 8.0 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Pioneer. Leader. Father. Champion. 

In the inspiring film "McLaren," viewers are taken on a thrilling journey through the life of Bruce McLaren, a New Zealander who defied the odds by establishing the renowned McLaren Motor Racing team. The movie showcases McLaren's remarkable rise from humble beginnings to becoming a pioneer, leader, father, and ultimately a champion in the world of motor racing. With a stellar cast including Dwayne Cameron, Mario Andretti, Alastair Caldwell, and Matt Coldrick, the story unfolds in English, the original language of the film. Produced by General Film Corporation in New Zealand, "McLaren" captivates audiences with its gripping narrative, earning a revenue of 163.4 million dollars and an impressive average rating of 8.0. At a duration of 1 hour and 34 minutes, this cinematic masterpiece celebrates the indomitable spirit and legacy of a true motorsport legend.

In the inspiring film "McLaren," viewers are taken on a thrilling journey through the life of Bruce McLaren, a New Zealander who defied the odds by establishing the renowned McLaren Motor Racing team. The movie showcases McLaren's remarkable rise from humble beginnings to becoming a pioneer, leader, father, and ultimately a champion in the world of motor racing. With a stellar cast including Dwayne Cameron, Mario Andretti, Alastair Caldwell, and Matt Coldrick, the story unfolds in English, the original language of the film. Produced by General Film Corporation in New Zealand, "McLaren" captivates audiences with its gripping narrative, earning a revenue of 163.4 million dollars and an impressive average rating of 8.0. At a duration of 1 hour and 34 minutes, this cinematic masterpiece celebrates the indomitable spirit and legacy of a true motorsport legend.

title = The Blues Brothers 
overview = Jake Blues is just out of jail, and teams up with his brother, Elwood on a 'mission from God' to raise funds for the orphanage in which they grew up. The only thing they can do is do what they do best – play music – so they get their old band together and they're on their way, while getting in a bit of trouble here and there. 
duration of the movie = 2h13 
Producer = Robert K. Weiss 
tagline = They'll never get caught. They're on a mission from God. 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 27.0 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.5 
revenue = 115.2 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Dan Aykroyd, John Belushi, James Brown, Cab Calloway 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 2h13 

In "The Blues Brothers," Jake Blues, fresh out of jail, joins forces with his brother Elwood on a divine mission to raise funds for their childhood orphanage. With music as their only tool, they reunite their old band and set off on a musical journey, encountering a mix of mischief along the way. Produced by Robert K. Weiss, this 2-hour and 13-minute film showcases the iconic duo on a mission from God, never to be caught. Set in the United States of America and primarily in English, the movie features a stellar cast including Dan Aykroyd, John Belushi, James Brown, and Cab Calloway. With a budget of 27.0 million dollars, "The Blues Brothers" went on to earn a revenue of 115.2 million dollars, impressing audiences with an average rating of 7.5. A production of Universal Pictures, this musical comedy is a timeless classic that blends humor, music, and brotherly love. The tagline for the movie is "They'll never get caught. They're on a mission from God."

title = TekWar 
overview = After four years, Jake Cardigan is prematurely awoken from his fifteen year cryogenic punishment to a world very different than the one he knew. Much more than before 'Tek', the highly-addictive electronic designer narcotic of the 21st century, seems to be prevalent. His wife has divorced him and disappeared together with their son. He wants them back and he wants justice for those undercover policemen who were murdered by unknown conspirators which led to his imprisonment for a crime he did not commit. 
budget = 32.4 millions of dollars 
Producer = Hans Beimler 
date of release = the 23 of January 1994 
production compagnie = Universal TV 
duration of the movie = 1h37 
cast = Greg Evigan, Eugene Clark, Torri Higginson, Ray Jewers 
average note = 5.4 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 32.4 millions of dollars 

In the futuristic world of "TekWar," Jake Cardigan emerges from a cryogenic slumber to find a society overrun by the dangerous drug 'Tek'. Determined to reunite with his estranged wife and son, Jake seeks justice for the slain undercover officers who wrongfully accused him. Produced by Hans Beimler and released on January 23, 1994, this action-packed thriller, with a budget of 32.4 million dollars, delves into a high-tech landscape where addiction and corruption reign. Starring Greg Evigan, Eugene Clark, Torri Higginson, and Ray Jewers, "TekWar" runs for 1 hour and 37 minutes, captivating audiences with its average rating of 5.4. The production company behind this sci-fi film is Universal TV.

Determined to reunite with his estranged wife and son, Jake seeks justice for the slain undercover officers who wrongfully accused him. Produced by Hans Beimler and released on January 23, 1994, this action-packed thriller, with a budget of 32.4 million dollars, delves into a high-tech landscape where addiction and corruption reign. Starring Greg Evigan, Eugene Clark, Torri Higginson, and Ray Jewers, "TekWar" runs for 1 hour and 37 minutes, captivating audiences with its average rating of 5.4. The production company behind this sci-fi film is Universal TV.

title = Westward the Women 
overview = In a time when "The West" pretty much ends in Texas and only California is slowly being populated by the white men, there's a severe lack of women among the workers on Roy Whitman's farm in the California Valley. So he goes back east to Chicago to recruit 150 women willing to become wives for his employees. From the candidates he selects 138 who seem able to survive a months long journey across "The Great American Desert" and the Rocky Mountains. Written by Tom Zoerner 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 6.6 
Producer = Dore Schary 
budget = 300.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the movie "Westward the Women," set in a time when the West is still largely unpopulated, a determined man named Roy Whitman embarks on a journey to recruit 150 women from Chicago to become wives for his farm workers in California. With careful selection, he chooses 138 women who show promise in enduring the arduous months-long trek across the Great American Desert and the Rocky Mountains. Produced by Dore Schary, this English-language film captures the challenges and triumphs of these brave women as they venture into the unknown. With a budget of 300.0 million dollars, "Westward the Women" weaves a tale of resilience, hope, and the pioneering spirit of the American West. (Average note: 6.6)

Facts included in the description:
- Title: Westward the Women
- Overview of the movie
- Original language of the movie: English
- Producer: Dore Schary
- Budget: 300.0 million dollars
- Average note: 6.6

title = High Crimes 
overview = High powered lawyer Claire Kubik finds her world turned upside down when her husband, who she thought was Tom Kubik, is arrested and is revealed to be Ron Chapman. Chapman is on trial for a murder of Latin American villagers while he was in the Marines. Claire soon learns that to navigate the military justice system, she'll need help from the somewhat unconventional Charlie Grimes. 
tagline = Everything you trust. Everything you know. May be a lie... 
revenue = 63.8 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Everything you trust. Everything you know. May be a lie... 

In the gripping thriller "High Crimes," high-powered lawyer Claire Kubik's life takes a dramatic turn when her husband, who she believed was Tom Kubik, is exposed as Ron Chapman, a former Marine on trial for a heinous crime. As Claire delves into the complexities of the military justice system, she enlists the help of the unorthodox Charlie Grimes to navigate the treacherous legal waters. With a tagline that warns "Everything you trust. Everything you know. May be a lie...," this film explores the depths of deception and the lengths one will go to uncover the truth. With a box office revenue of 63.8 million dollars, "High Crimes" is a riveting tale of justice, betrayal, and the power of uncovering hidden secrets.

With a tagline that warns "Everything you trust. Everything you know. May be a lie...," this film explores the depths of deception and the lengths one will go to uncover the truth. With a box office revenue of 63.8 million dollars, "High Crimes" is a riveting tale of justice, betrayal, and the power of uncovering hidden secrets.

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : Producer = Terje Strømstad 

In the chilling movie "Dead Snow," a group of eight medical students embarks on a ski trip to Norway, seeking adventure and relaxation. However, their vacation takes a terrifying turn when they stumble upon a sinister secret hidden in the remote mountains. As they uncover the dark history of the area, they are confronted by a battalion of zombie Nazi soldiers, remnants of a past that refuses to stay buried. Now, the students must fight for their lives against these undead foes, who are relentless in their quest to devour anyone who crosses their path. Will they be able to escape the clutches of these monstrous adversaries, or will they become the next victims of Hitler's horrors that still haunt the snowy landscape?

3. The zombie Nazi soldiers are intent on devouring anyone they encounter.
4. The movie is titled "Dead Snow."
5. The zombie Nazi soldiers were once sent to die in the mountains.

title = Predator 2 
overview = Ten years after a band of mercenaries first battled a vicious alien, the invisible creature from another world has returned to Earth -- and this time, it's drawn to the gang-ruled and ravaged city of Los Angeles. When it starts murdering drug dealers, detective-lieutenant Mike Harrigan and his police force set out to capture the creature, ignoring warnings from a mysterious government agent to stay away. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : production compagnie = Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation 

In "Predator 2," set ten years after the initial encounter with the deadly alien, the fearsome creature returns to Earth, this time targeting the gang-infested streets of Los Angeles. Detective-lieutenant Mike Harrigan and his team are determined to capture the predator as it begins a killing spree among drug dealers. Despite warnings from a secretive government agent to steer clear, Harrigan and his police force embark on a dangerous mission to apprehend the extraterrestrial threat in the urban jungle of L.A. The movie features a diverse cast including Danny Glover as Mike Harrigan, Gary Busey as the mysterious government agent, and Rubén Blades as Harrigan's colleague. The Predator, a technologically advanced alien with a penchant for hunting formidable prey, utilizes its cloaking ability and thermal vision to stalk its victims. The intense action sequences and suspenseful cat-and-mouse chases between Harrigan and the Predator keep viewers on the edge of their seats. Additionally, the film's gritty urban setting and atmospheric cinematography contribute to its dark and menacing tone.

title = The Turning Point 
overview = When her daughter joins a ballet company, a former dancer is forced to confront her long-ago decision to give up the stage to have a family. 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Herbert Ross 
date of release = the 14 of November 1977 
production compagnie = Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation 
revenue = 77.7 millions of dollars 
budget = 285.1 millions of dollars 
tagline = The generations change. But the choices remain the same. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In "The Turning Point," directed by Herbert Ross, viewers are taken on an emotional journey as a former dancer is faced with the repercussions of her decision to leave the stage for family life when her daughter embarks on a ballet career. Set in the United States of America and released on the 14th of November 1977 by Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation, this film delves into the complexities of balancing personal aspirations with familial responsibilities. With a budget of 285.1 million dollars and a revenue of 77.7 million dollars, the movie managed to be both a thought-provoking and financially successful production. The tagline "The generations change. But the choices remain the same" encapsulates the timeless themes explored in this impactful story.

The tagline "The generations change. But the choices remain the same" encapsulates the timeless themes explored in this impactful story.

title = Lore 
overview = After her Nazi parents are imprisoned, Lore leads her younger siblings across a war-torn Germany in 1945. Amidst the chaos, she encounters mysterious Jewish refugee Thomas, who shatters her fragile reality with hatred and desire. To live, she must trust someone she was taught to hate and face the darkness within herself. 
revenue = 290.3 millions of dollars 
Producer = Liz Watts 
duration of the movie = 1h48 
average note = 7.1 
original language of the movie = German 
production compagnie = Porchlight Films 
budget = 96.3 millions of dollars 
tagline = When your life is a lie, who can you trust? 
Director = Cate Shortland 
production countrie = Australia 
date of release = the 2 of August 2012 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 290.3 millions of dollars 

In the gripping and emotionally charged film "Lore," directed by Cate Shortland and produced by Liz Watts, we are transported to war-torn Germany in 1945. After her Nazi parents are imprisoned, the young and resilient Lore takes on the responsibility of leading her younger siblings through the chaos and destruction of the aftermath. It is during this tumultuous journey that Lore crosses paths with the enigmatic Jewish refugee, Thomas, whose presence challenges her deeply ingrained beliefs and forces her to confront the darkness within herself. As she grapples with feelings of both hatred and desire, Lore must navigate a treacherous path of survival, ultimately learning to trust someone she was raised to despise. Set against the backdrop of a shattered reality, the film explores themes of betrayal, resilience, and the complexities of human connection. With a stellar performance by the cast, including standout moments from the lead actress, "Lore" is a poignant and thought-provoking tale that will linger in your mind long after the credits roll.

The movie "Lore" has a duration of 1 hour and 48 minutes and was released on the 2nd of August 2012. It was filmed in German, the original language of the movie, and produced by Porchlight Films in Australia. The tagline of the movie is "When your life is a lie, who can you trust?" The movie received an average rating of 7.1 and grossed 290.3 million dollars at the box office, with a budget of 96.3 million dollars.

title = Gargoyles 
overview = After receiving word about a mysterious carcass/skeleton unearthed in the Arizona desert, a father and his daughter decide to remove it from the burial grounds for further study. Once they do so, they, as well as the town, are besieged by a colony of gargoyles living in some nearby caverns. 
revenue = 130.1 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 5.9 
Director = Bill L. Norton 
production compagnie = Tomorrow Entertainment 
cast = Cornel Wilde, Jennifer Salt, Grayson Hall, Bernie Casey 
date of release = the 21 of November 1972 
duration of the movie = 1h14 
budget = 2.1 millions of dollars 
Producer = Robert W. Christiansen 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 130.1 millions of dollars 

In the 1972 American horror film "Gargoyles," directed by Bill L. Norton and produced by Robert W. Christiansen under Tomorrow Entertainment, a father and his daughter stumble upon a mysterious carcass in the Arizona desert. Intrigued, they decide to excavate it for further study, unknowingly unleashing a colony of terrifying gargoyles from nearby caverns. As chaos ensues in the town, played by a talented cast including Cornel Wilde, Jennifer Salt, Grayson Hall, and Bernie Casey, the sinister creatures wreak havoc on the unsuspecting residents. With an average rating of 5.9, the film grossed an impressive $130.1 million at the box office, surpassing its $2.1 million budget. Released on November 21, 1972, and lasting 1 hour and 14 minutes, "Gargoyles" delivers a chilling tale of ancient evil brought to life in the American Southwest. The movie was produced in the United States of America and is in English.

['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America

In the 1972 American horror film "Gargoyles," directed by Bill L. Norton and produced by Robert W. Christiansen under Tomorrow Entertainment, a father and his daughter stumble upon a mysterious carcass in the Arizona desert. Intrigued, they decide to excavate it for further study, unknowingly unleashing a colony of terrifying gargoyles from nearby caverns. As chaos ensues in the town, played by a talented cast including Cornel Wilde, Jennifer Salt, Grayson Hall, and Bernie Casey, the sinister creatures wreak havoc on the unsuspecting residents. With an average rating of 5.9, the film grossed an impressive $130.1 million at the box office, surpassing its $2.1 million budget. Released on November 21, 1972, and lasting 1 hour and 14 minutes, "Gargoyles" delivers a chilling tale of ancient evil brought to life in the American Southwest. The movie was produced in the United States of America and is in English.

['correct']

title = Straightheads 
overview = There is instant chemistry between Alice (Gillian Anderson), a businesswoman, and Adam (Danny Dyer), a younger working-class man who installs a security system in her London apartment. She takes him to a party in the country, and they end up making love. But the night turns horrific when they encounter three thugs who maim Adam and rape Alice. The incident turns them into fearful recluses until Alice spots the leader of their attackers (Anthony Calf) -- and the two victims plot a brutal revenge. 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
tagline = Let the revenge fit the crime 
Director = Dan Reed 
budget = 72.6 millions of dollars 
Producer = Kevin Loader 
date of release = the 27 of April 2007 
average note = 5.1 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United Kingdom 

In the intense thriller "Straightheads," set in the United Kingdom, businesswoman Alice, played by Gillian Anderson, finds herself drawn to Adam, a younger working-class man portrayed by Danny Dyer, after he installs a security system in her London apartment. Their budding romance takes a dark turn when a night out in the country leads to a brutal attack by three thugs, leaving Adam injured and Alice traumatized. As they struggle to cope with the aftermath, Alice recognizes one of their assailants, triggering a vengeful plot for justice. Directed by Dan Reed and produced by Kevin Loader, this gripping tale of revenge with a budget of 72.6 million dollars was released on April 27, 2007, and keeps viewers on the edge with an average rating of 5.1. The tagline "Let the revenge fit the crime" sets the tone for the chilling journey of retribution in "Straightheads."

title = Mr. Jones

TP  -  TruePositive

fact : production compagnie = TriStar Pictures 

In "Mr. Jones," a compelling tale unfolds, delving into the intricate dynamics between a manic depressive individual named Mr. Jones and a female doctor who finds herself deeply invested in his care. Produced by the renowned Richard Gere under the TriStar Pictures banner, this film offers a poignant exploration of mental health, human connection, and the profound impact one person can have on another's life.

title = Thief 
overview = Frank is an expert professional safecracker, specialized in high-profile diamond heists. He plans to use his ill-gotten income to retire from crime and build a nice life for himself complete with a home, wife and kids. To accelerate the process, he signs on with a top gangster for a big score. 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 27 of March 1981 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the thrilling movie "Thief," released on the 27th of March 1981 in the United States of America, we follow the story of Frank, a skilled safecracker known for pulling off high-profile diamond heists. With dreams of retiring from a life of crime and settling down with a home, wife, and kids, Frank decides to team up with a notorious gangster to execute one last big score. As Frank navigates the dangerous world of organized crime, he must outsmart both law enforcement and rival criminals to secure his future. Will his final heist be his ticket to a peaceful life, or will it lead to his downfall?

title = Brothers 
overview = Brothers is an upcoming Hindi film, directed by Karan Malhotra and produced by Karan Johar under Dharma Productions along with Lionsgate Films and Endemol India.[6] The film is an official remake of the 2011 Hollywood film Warrior. 
cast = Akshay Kumar, Sidharth Malhotra, Jackie Shroff, Kareena Kapoor 
production compagnie = Dharma Productions 
date of release = the 14 of August 2015 
original language of the movie = Hindi 
budget = 84.2 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Akshay Kumar, Sidharth Malhotra, Jackie Shroff, Kareena Kapoor 

In "Brothers," a gripping Hindi film directed by Karan Malhotra and produced by Dharma Productions, viewers are taken on a rollercoaster of emotions as they witness the intense journey of two brothers, played by Akshay Kumar and Sidharth Malhotra. The stellar cast also includes Jackie Shroff and Kareena Kapoor, who deliver powerful performances that stay with the audience long after the credits roll. Set for release on the 14th of August 2015, this film is an official remake of the 2011 Hollywood hit, Warrior. With a budget of 84.2 million dollars, "Brothers" promises to be a cinematic experience that transcends language barriers and leaves a lasting impact on all who watch it. The production companies involved in the making of the film are Dharma Productions, Lionsgate Films, and Endemol India.

title = Iron Man: Rise of Technovore 
overview = Iron Man enlists the help of ruthless vigilante the Punisher to track down War Machine's murderer. All the while, he's being pursued by S.H.I.E.L.D. agents Black Widow and Hawkeye, who suspect his involvement in a recent terrorist plot. 
tagline = Can Iron Man save the world when the world is against him? 
duration of the movie = 1h28 
Director = Hiroshi Hamazaki 
Producer = Taro Morishima 
average note = 5.2 
budget = 212.0 millions of dollars 
revenue = 156.2 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Madhouse 
original language of the movie = Japanese 
cast = Tesshou Genda, Keiji Fujiwara, Miyu Irino, Hiroe Oka 
production countrie = Japan 
date of release = the 24 of April 2013 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Can Iron Man save the world when the world is against him? 

In "Iron Man: Rise of Technovore," Tony Stark, aka Iron Man, finds himself in a complex web of intrigue and suspicion. When his close friend War Machine is murdered, Iron Man teams up with the relentless vigilante, the Punisher, to seek justice. However, their pursuit is complicated by the relentless pursuit of S.H.I.E.L.D. agents Black Widow and Hawkeye, who suspect Iron Man's involvement in a recent terrorist plot.

As Iron Man races against time to clear his name and uncover the truth, he must navigate a world where allies can turn into enemies in an instant. With the tagline "Can Iron Man save the world when the world is against him?" echoing his predicament, the movie unfolds in a fast-paced 1 hour and 28 minutes of action and suspense.

Directed by Hiroshi Hamazaki and produced by Taro Morishima, "Iron Man: Rise of Technovore" boasts an average rating of 5.2. Despite a budget of 212.0 million dollars, the movie generated a revenue of 156.2 million dollars. The production company Madhouse brings this thrilling tale to life in its original Japanese language, with a stellar cast including Tesshou Genda, Keiji Fujiwara, Miyu Irino, and Hiroe Oka.

Set against the backdrop of Japan, "Iron Man: Rise of Technovore" was released on the 24th of April 2013, captivating audiences with its blend of superhero action and intricate plot twists.

['correct']

title = The Outlaw Josey Wales 
overview = After avenging his family's brutal murder, Wales is pursued by a pack of soldiers. He prefers to travel alone, but ragtag outcasts are drawn to him - and Wales can't bring himself to leave them unprotected. 
date of release = the 30 of June 1976 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 30 of June 1976 

In "The Outlaw Josey Wales," released on the 30th of June 1976, we follow the journey of Josey Wales as he seeks vengeance for his family's tragic murder. Despite his preference for solitude, Wales finds himself reluctantly forming bonds with a group of outcasts who are in need of his protection. As he is pursued by a relentless pack of soldiers, Wales must navigate a dangerous path while grappling with his own moral code and the loyalty he feels towards his newfound companions. This classic Western film showcases themes of justice, redemption, and the enduring power of camaraderie in the face of adversity.

This classic Western film showcases themes of justice, redemption, and the enduring power of camaraderie in the face of adversity.

In "The Outlaw Josey Wales," released on the 30th of June 1976, we follow the journey of Josey Wales as he seeks vengeance for his family's tragic murder. Despite his preference for solitude, Wales finds himself reluctantly forming bonds with a group of outcasts who are in need of his protection. As he is pursued by a relentless pack of soldiers, Wales must navigate a dangerous path while grappling with his own moral code and the loyalty he feels towards his newfound companions. This classic Western film showcases themes of justice, redemption, and the enduring power of camaraderie in the face of adversity.

title = National Lampoon Presents: Endless Bummer 
overview = From National Lampoon, the masters of raunchy comedy, comes a summer tale of beers, babes, and bros! In the surf town of Ventura, California, JD's surf board is stolen by a surfer from Los Angeles...a crime that cannot go unpunished. Gathering his friends and the local surf hero, Mike Mooney, they take a road trip to LA to get the surfboard back, then return to Ventura for the wildest summer party ever! 
revenue = 75.4 millions of dollars 
budget = 4.0 millions of dollars 
Director = Sam Pillsbury 
tagline = Summer Unleashed 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Vanessa Angel, Richmond Arquette, Jules Bruff, Andrew Caldwell 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 75.4 millions of dollars 

Get ready for a wild ride with "National Lampoon Presents: Endless Bummer," a summer comedy extravaganza directed by Sam Pillsbury. When JD's prized surfboard is stolen by a surfer from LA, he enlists the help of his friends and local surf hero, Mike Mooney, to embark on a road trip to retrieve it. Starring Vanessa Angel, Richmond Arquette, Jules Bruff, and Andrew Caldwell, this hilarious adventure takes them from Ventura to Los Angeles and back again for the ultimate summer party. With a budget of 4.0 million dollars and a whopping revenue of 75.4 million dollars, this film is a must-watch for anyone craving a dose of beers, babes, and bros. Don't miss out on the surf-centric fun in "National Lampoon Presents: Endless Bummer," where Summer is truly Unleashed! The movie was produced in the United States of America and the original language of the movie is English.

title = Eaten Alive! 
overview = A woman's search for her missing sister leads her to the jungles of New Guinea, where she and an expatriate guide encounter a cult leader and flesh-hungry natives. 
Director = Umberto Lenzi 
budget = 129.4 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h32 
date of release = the 19 of March 1980 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Umberto Lenzi 

In the thrilling movie "Eaten Alive!", directed by Umberto Lenzi, a woman embarks on a dangerous journey to find her missing sister in the treacherous jungles of New Guinea. Alongside an expatriate guide, they stumble upon a sinister cult leader and a tribe of flesh-hungry natives. With a budget of 129.4 million dollars, this heart-pounding adventure unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 32 minutes. Prepare to be on the edge of your seat as the suspense builds in this gripping tale released on the 19th of March 1980.

title = Night on Earth 
overview = An anthology of 5 different cab drivers in 5 American and European cities and their remarkable fares on the same eventful night. 
revenue = 2.0 millions of dollars 
budget = 3.5 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Channel Four Films 
production countrie = Germany 
cast = Winona Ryder, Gena Rowlands, Lisanne Falk, Alan Randolph Scott 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 7.5 
Director = Jim Jarmusch 
date of release = the 3 of October 1991 
Producer = Jim Jarmusch 
tagline = Five Taxis. Five Cities. One Night. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 2.0 millions of dollars 

In the 1991 film "Night on Earth," directed by Jim Jarmusch and produced by Channel Four Films, viewers are taken on a captivating journey through five American and European cities. The movie follows the stories of five different cab drivers, played by Winona Ryder, Gena Rowlands, Lisanne Falk, and Alan Randolph Scott, and their extraordinary passengers on a fateful night. Starring Winona Ryder, Gena Rowlands, Lisanne Falk, and Alan Randolph Scott, the film showcases the diverse encounters and experiences that unfold within the confines of each taxi. With a budget of 3.5 million dollars and a revenue of 2.0 million dollars, "Night on Earth" received an average rating of 7.5. Set against the backdrop of bustling cityscapes, this English-language anthology weaves together tales of connection, isolation, and serendipity, all converging in a single night that leaves a lasting impact on both drivers and riders alike. Don't miss this cinematic exploration of human connection and chance encounters in the urban landscape. The production country of the movie is Germany, and the release date was the 3rd of October 1991. The tagline of the movie is "Five Taxis. Five Cities. One Night."

fact : average note = 7.5 

In the 1991 film "Night on Earth," directed by Jim Jarmusch and produced by Channel Four Films, viewers are taken on a captivating journey through five American and European cities. The movie follows the stories of five different cab drivers, played by Winona Ryder, Gena Rowlands, Lisanne Falk, and Alan Randolph Scott, and their extraordinary passengers on a fateful night. Starring Winona Ryder, Gena Rowlands, Lisanne Falk, and Alan Randolph Scott, the film showcases the diverse encounters and experiences that unfold within the confines of each taxi. With a budget of 3.5 million dollars and a revenue of 2.0 million dollars, "Night on Earth" received an average rating of 7.5. Set against the backdrop of bustling cityscapes, this English-language anthology weaves together tales of connection, isolation, and serendipity, all converging in a single night that leaves a lasting impact on both drivers and riders alike. Don't miss this cinematic exploration of human connection and chance encounters in the urban landscape. The production country of the movie is Germany, and the release date was the 3rd of October 1991. The tagline of the movie is "Five Taxis. Five Cities. One Night."

title = The Cobweb 
overview = At an exclusive psychiatric clinic, the doctors and staff are about as crazy as the patients. The clinic head, Dr. Stewart McIver, thinks that it would be good therapy for his patients to design and make new drapes for the library. Mrs. Karen McIver, who is neglected by her hardworking husband (and a bit unbalanced herself), wants to make her mark on the clinic, so she orders new drapes. Miss Inch, the business manager, who has been with the clinic longer than anyone, sees this as an intrusion into her territory, and she too orders drapes. All this puts everyone in a dither, as they fight over drapes and clinic politics. 
budget = 195.4 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 2h14 
production compagnie = Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) 
average note = 4.3 
Director = Vincente Minnelli 
cast = Richard Widmark, Lauren Bacall, Charles Boyer, Gloria Grahame 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 195.4 millions of dollars 

In "The Cobweb," set in an exclusive psychiatric clinic, the line between sanity and madness blurs as the doctors and staff exhibit their own eccentricities. Dr. Stewart McIver, the clinic head, proposes a unique therapy for the patients - designing new drapes for the library. However, chaos ensues when his neglected wife, Mrs. Karen McIver, and the longstanding business manager, Miss Inch, also decide to order drapes, sparking a heated battle over clinic politics and interior decor. Directed by Vincente Minnelli and featuring a stellar cast including Richard Widmark, Lauren Bacall, Charles Boyer, and Gloria Grahame, this captivating drama unfolds over a duration of 2 hours and 14 minutes. With a lavish budget of 195.4 million dollars, "The Cobweb" is a mesmerizing portrayal of ambition, power struggles, and the thin line between sanity and madness within the clinic walls. The film was produced by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) in the United States of America. The average note for the movie is 4.3.

title = Gone Fishin' 
overview = Two fishing fanatics get in trouble when their fishing boat gets stolen while on a trip. 
budget = 53.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Christopher Cain 
cast = Joe Pesci, Danny Glover, Rosanna Arquette, Lynn Whitfield 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 53.0 millions of dollars 

In the comedic adventure film "Gone Fishin'," directed by Christopher Cain, two fishing enthusiasts, played by Joe Pesci and Danny Glover, find themselves in a sticky situation when their beloved fishing boat is stolen during a trip. As they embark on a hilarious journey to recover their vessel, they encounter unexpected obstacles and mishaps along the way. With a budget of 53.0 million dollars, this American production takes viewers on a wild ride filled with laughter and camaraderie. Joining Pesci and Glover are talented actresses Rosanna Arquette and Lynn Whitfield, adding depth and humor to the escapades of these fishing buddies. The film was produced in the United States of America.

title = The Little Rascals Save the Day 
overview = The Little Rascals are back in an all-new movie! Join the fun with Spanky, Alfalfa, Darla, Buckwheat, Petey the dog and the whole gang as they are up to their usual mischief! The Rascals try anything to raise the money needed to save their grandma's (Doris Roberts) bakery. The only trouble is - they can't seem to do anything right! From botched pet washes to terrible taxi service, they just can't raise a penny. Their only hope is to win prize money from the local talent show - but have you ever heard Alfalfa sing? 
average note = 5.9 
Producer = Mike Elliott 
budget = 8.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 
cast = Drew Justice, Rio Mangini, Jenna Ortega, Eden Wood 
tagline = All New Movie 
date of release = the 25 of March 2014 
Director = Alex Zamm 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : average note = 5.9 

In "The Little Rascals Save the Day," the beloved gang of mischievous kids, including Spanky, Alfalfa, Darla, Buckwheat, and their loyal dog Petey, are back for another adventure. This time, they must come up with a plan to save their grandma's bakery, played by the talented Doris Roberts. Despite their best efforts, from failed pet washes to disastrous taxi services, the Rascals struggle to raise the necessary funds. Their last hope lies in winning the prize money at a local talent show, but with Alfalfa's questionable singing skills, success is far from guaranteed. Directed by Alex Zamm and produced by Mike Elliott, this Universal Pictures production is filled with laughter, heartwarming moments, and the timeless charm of the Little Rascals. "The Little Rascals Save the Day" promises to delight audiences of all ages with its all-new storyline and lovable characters. Don't miss this delightful film that hit the screens on March 25, 2014, with a budget of 8 million dollars and featuring a talented cast including Drew Justice, Rio Mangini, Jenna Ortega, and Eden Wood. Get ready for a fun-filled ride with the Little Rascals in this heartwarming tale of friendship, determination, and the power of teamwork.

In "The Little Rascals Save the Day," the beloved gang of mischievous kids, including Spanky, Alfalfa, Darla, Buckwheat, and their loyal dog Petey, are back for another adventure. This time, they must come up with a plan to save their grandma's bakery, played by the talented Doris Roberts. Despite their best efforts, from failed pet washes to disastrous taxi services, the Rascals struggle to raise the necessary funds. Their last hope lies in winning the prize money at a local talent show, but with Alfalfa's questionable singing skills, success is far from guaranteed. Directed by Alex Zamm and produced by Mike Elliott, this Universal Pictures production is filled with laughter, heartwarming moments, and the timeless charm of the Little Rascals. "The Little Rascals Save the Day" promises to delight audiences of all ages with its all-new storyline and lovable characters. Don't miss this delightful film that hit the screens on March 25, 2014, with a budget of 8 million dollars and featuring a talented cast including Drew Justice, Rio Mangini, Jenna Ortega, and Eden Wood. title = Cabin Fever 
overview = In this grisly remake of the 2002 horror hit, five college chums rent an isolated woodland cabin for a party. But their fun quickly ends when the group is exposed to a hideous flesh-eating virus, and survival becomes the name of the game. 
duration of the movie = 1h39 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 12 of February 2016 
cast = Matthew Daddario, Samuel Davis, Dustin Ingram, Eli Roth 
revenue = 7.7 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h39 

In the chilling remake of the 2002 horror classic, "Cabin Fever," five college friends decide to escape to an isolated woodland cabin for a party getaway. However, their plans take a terrifying turn when they come face to face with a gruesome flesh-eating virus that threatens their very existence. As survival becomes their primary objective, the group must navigate through the horrors that await them in the cabin. Starring Matthew Daddario, Samuel Davis, Dustin Ingram, and directed by Eli Roth, this intense tale of horror and survival unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 39 minutes. Released on the 12th of February 2016 in the United States of America, "Cabin Fever" grossed a staggering $7.7 million at the box office.

title = The Ugly Ones 
overview = Escaped outlaw Jose Gomez returns to his home town pursued by bounty killer Luke Chilson. The towns people protect Gomez, unaware, at first, that he is now a changed and dangerous man. 
production countrie = Spain 
date of release = the 4 of November 1966 
cast = Tomás Milián, Richard Wyler, Mario Brega, Halina Zalewska 
budget = 265.5 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = Spain 

In the 1966 Spanish film "The Ugly Ones," escaped outlaw Jose Gomez makes a dramatic return to his hometown, only to be relentlessly pursued by bounty killer Luke Chilson. As the townspeople rally around Gomez, they are unaware of the dangerous transformation he has undergone. Starring Tomás Milián, Richard Wyler, Mario Brega, and Halina Zalewska, this action-packed Western unfolds against the backdrop of a $265.5 million budget. Don't miss this thrilling tale of redemption and revenge, released on November 4th, 1966 in Spain.

The production company behind the film is Paramount-Orion Filmproduktion, and the production country is Italy.

title = National Lampoon's Gold Diggers 
overview = National Lampoon's Gold Diggers is a black comedy about two losers in their twenties, Calvin Menhoffer (Will Friedle) and Leonard Smallwood (Chris Owen), who are out to get the good life without working for it. The two young men try to rob two 70-year-old sisters, Betty Mundt (Renee Taylor) and Doris Mundt (Louise Lasser). The two sisters beat the two young men up, and send them to jail. The ladies drop the charges, and invite the jailbirds to their Beverly Hills mansion. Cal gets an idea that they could marry the women for their money and live the good life. Hopefully, they will only live 6-months and at most one-year. It turns out that Betty and Doris are broke, and they have come up with a plan to marry the boys, kill them, and collect the life insurance money. After several unsuccessful murder attempts on each other, they join forces to rob Betty and Doris's rich uncle 
Director = Gary Preisler 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 
Producer = Gary Preisler 
budget = 34.0 millions of dollars 
tagline = A comedy about two guys who'd do anything to be on top. 
cast = Will Friedle, Chris Owen, Louise Lasser, Renée Taylor 
duration of the movie = 1h30 
revenue = 0.5 millions of dollars 
average note = 3.1 
production compagnie = National Lampoon Productions 
date of release = the 15 of June 2003 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Gary Preisler 

In "National Lampoon's Gold Diggers," directed by Gary Preisler, two young men, Calvin Menhoffer (Will Friedle) and Leonard Smallwood (Chris Owen), attempt to rob two elderly sisters, Betty Mundt (Renée Taylor) and Doris Mundt (Louise Lasser), only to end up in jail. Surprisingly, the sisters drop the charges and invite the duo to their Beverly Hills mansion. The twist? The sisters are broke and have a sinister plan to marry the boys, kill them, and collect the life insurance money. As the chaotic comedy unfolds, with failed murder attempts and unexpected alliances, the four characters eventually team up to rob the sisters' wealthy uncle. With a budget of 34 million dollars and a revenue of 0.5 million dollars, this dark comedy explores the lengths people will go to for a shot at the good life. Will their devious plans succeed, or will karma catch up to them? Find out in this English-language film released on the 15th of June 2003 by National Lampoon Productions. Remember, in this hilarious tale of greed and deception, the tagline rings true: "A comedy about two guys who'd do anything to be on top."

Facts included in the description:
- Director: Gary Preisler
- Cast: Will Friedle, Chris Owen, Louise Lasser, Renée Taylor
- Original language of the movie: English
- Production country: United States of America
- Producer: Gary Preisler
- Budget: 34.0 million dollars
- Tagline: A comedy about two guys who'd do anything to be on top
- Duration of the movie: 1h30
- Revenue: 0.5 million dollars
- Average note: 3.1
- Production company: National Lampoon Productions
- Date of release: the 15th of June 2003

title = Nowhere 
overview = The third film in a trilogy by writer-director Gregg Araki. Described as "90210 on acid", the film tells the story of a day in the lives of a group of high school kids in Los Angeles and the strange lives they lead. 
revenue = 0.0 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 112.3 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.3 
duration of the movie = 1h22 
production compagnie = Desperate Pictures 
date of release = the 9 of May 1997 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 0.0 millions of dollars 

In "Nowhere," the third installment of Gregg Araki's trilogy, viewers are taken on a wild ride through the lives of a group of high school kids in Los Angeles. Described as "90210 on acid," the film delves into the strange and surreal experiences that shape their day. As the teenagers navigate through a day filled with unexpected twists and turns, audiences are immersed in a world where reality blurs with fantasy. With an average rating of 6.3, this English-language film, released on the 9th of May 1997, is a unique exploration of teenage life. Produced by Desperate Pictures with a budget of 112.3 million dollars, "Nowhere" offers a glimpse into the unconventional and unpredictable journey of adolescence. The movie generated 0.0 million dollars in revenue and has a duration of 1 hour and 22 minutes.

title = Take Down 
overview = Sons and daughters of international billionaires are sent to an boot camp where they are taught basic survival skills in hopes it will teach them responsibility. When they are taken hostage and taken for ransom by kidnappers, they will need to utilize every skill they learned to survive. 
revenue = 115.5 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 5 of May 2016 
cast = Jeremy Sumpter, Phoebe Tonkin, Sebastian Koch, Ed Westwick 
production compagnie = Pinewood Studios 
Director = Jim Gillespie 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 115.5 millions of dollars 

In "Take Down," a group of privileged sons and daughters of international billionaires find themselves in a challenging situation when they are sent to a boot camp to learn basic survival skills. Led by a skilled instructor, they are expected to grasp the importance of responsibility through this experience. However, their newfound knowledge is put to the ultimate test when they are unexpectedly taken hostage by kidnappers demanding ransom. As they fight for their survival, they must rely on the skills they acquired to outwit their captors and make it out alive. Directed by Jim Gillespie and featuring a talented cast including Jeremy Sumpter, Phoebe Tonkin, Sebastian Koch, and Ed Westwick, this English-language film was released on the 5th of May 2016. Produced by Pinewood Studios, "Take Down" grossed an impressive $115.5 million at the box office.

fact : budget = 113.6 millions of dollars 

In "Take Down," a group of privileged sons and daughters of international billionaires find themselves in a challenging situation when they are sent to a boot camp to learn basic survival skills. Led by a skilled instructor, they are expected to grasp the importance of responsibility through this experience. However, their newfound knowledge is put to the ultimate test when they are unexpectedly taken hostage by kidnappers demanding ransom. As they fight for their survival, they must rely on the skills they acquired to outwit their captors and make it out alive. Directed by Jim Gillespie and featuring a talented cast including Jeremy Sumpter, Phoebe Tonkin, Sebastian Koch, and Ed Westwick, this English-language film was released on the 5th of May 2016. Produced by Pinewood Studios, "Take Down" grossed an impressive $115.5 million at the box office.

title = Call Northside 777 
overview = In 1932, a cop is killed and Frank Wiecek sentenced to life. Eleven years later, a newspaper ad by Frank's mother leads Chicago reporter P.J. O'Neal to look into the case. For some time, O'Neal continues to believe Frank guilty. But when he starts to change his mind, he meets increased resistance from authorities unwilling to be proved wrong. 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h51 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the gripping film "Call Northside 777," set in 1932 Chicago, a police officer is tragically killed, leading to the conviction of Frank Wiecek for life. Over a decade later, a newspaper advertisement placed by Frank's mother catches the attention of journalist P.J. O'Neal, prompting him to investigate the case. Initially convinced of Frank's guilt, O'Neal faces mounting obstacles as he begins to question the verdict, encountering staunch resistance from authorities reluctant to admit any wrongdoing. With a runtime of 1 hour and 51 minutes, this American production delves into the complexities of seeking justice and uncovering the truth. The movie was produced in the United States of America.

title = Dear White People 
overview = Four black students attend an Ivy League college where a riot breaks out over an “African American” themed party thrown by white students. With tongue planted firmly in cheek, the film explores racial identity in 'post-racial' America while weaving a story about forging one's unique path in the world. 
cast = Tessa Thompson, Tyler James Williams, Kyle Gallner, Teyonah Parris 
revenue = 53.1 millions of dollars 
Producer = Justin Simien 
Director = Justin Simien 
production compagnie = Homegrown Pictures 
duration of the movie = 1h48 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 6.2 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 1.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Tessa Thompson, Tyler James Williams, Kyle Gallner, Teyonah Parris 

In the thought-provoking film "Dear White People," directed and produced by Justin Simien, a group of four black students navigates the complexities of racial identity at an Ivy League college. When a controversial "African American" themed party organized by white students sparks a riot, the characters find themselves at the center of a larger conversation about race in 'post-racial' America. With a stellar cast including Tessa Thompson, Tyler James Williams, Kyle Gallner, and Teyonah Parris, the movie delves into the challenges of forging one's own path in a society marked by deep-seated prejudices. Despite its modest budget of 1.0 million dollars, "Dear White People" managed to gross an impressive 53.1 million dollars at the box office. The film, with an average rating of 6.2, runs for 1 hour and 48 minutes and is presented in its original language, English. Produced by Homegrown Pictures and set in the United States of America, "Dear White People" is a compelling exploration of race relations that resonates with audiences worldwide.

fact : date of release = the 2 of May 1957 

In the 1957 film "The Living Idol," produced by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) and directed by Albert Lewin, an archaeologist becomes convinced that a Mexican woman is the reincarnation of an Aztec princess. Set against the backdrop of Mexico, this English-language movie takes viewers on an amazing adventure beneath the curse of the Jaguar God. With a budget of 141.9 million dollars, this cinematic exploration of past lives and ancient civilizations promises to captivate audiences with its intriguing premise and exotic setting. The film was released on the 2nd of May 1957 in Mexico, and it received an average rating of 0.0. The tagline for the movie is "Amazing Adventure Beneath the Curse of the Jaguar God."

title = Young People 
overview = Wendy Ballantine's parents decide to retire from show biz so she can have a normal life. They are unwelcome in the small town until a storm lets the family show their stuff. 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Shirley Temple, Jack Oakie, Charlotte Greenwood, Arleen Whelan 
Producer = Harry Joe Brown 
production compagnie = Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation 
revenue = 221.6 millions of dollars 
budget = 74.8 millions of dollars 
tagline = FUN and songs! Fun AND songs! Fun and SONGS! ...DANCES TOO! 
average note = 6.3 
date of release = the 30 of August 1940 
Director = Allan Dwan 
duration of the movie = 1h19 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the 1940 film "Young People," directed by Allan Dwan, audiences are taken on a heartwarming journey with Wendy Ballantine, played by Shirley Temple, as her parents decide to retire from showbiz for her to experience a normal life. Facing initial rejection in a small town, the Ballantine family gets a chance to showcase their talents during a storm. With a stellar cast including Shirley Temple, Jack Oakie, Charlotte Greenwood, and Arleen Whelan, this English-language production by Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation is a delightful mix of fun, songs, and dances. Produced by Harry Joe Brown, the film grossed an impressive $221.6 million, surpassing its $74.8 million budget. Released on August 30, 1940, "Young People" received an average rating of 6.3 and runs for a charming 1 hour and 19 minutes. The tagline for the movie is "FUN and songs! Fun AND songs! Fun and SONGS! ...DANCES TOO!" Don't miss this classic tale of family, talent, and the power of perseverance!

title = The Monster 
overview = A mother and her 10-year old daughter are trapped in a forest. There is something in this forest. Something unlike anything they have heard before. Something that lurks in the darkness and it’s coming after them. 
tagline = Stay in the light 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Stay in the light 

In "The Monster," a gripping thriller unfolds as a mother and her 10-year-old daughter find themselves stranded in a mysterious forest. There is something in this forest, something unlike anything they have heard before, lurking in the darkness and coming after them. With an unknown terror lurking in the shadows, the duo must navigate through the darkness to survive. The tagline "Stay in the light" serves as a chilling reminder of the imminent danger they face. As they struggle to escape the clutches of the unseen threat, the true nature of the monster becomes increasingly clear, leaving them with no choice but to confront their deepest fears in order to make it out alive.

title = Good Boy! 
overview = An intergalactic dog pilot from Sirius (the dog star), visits Earth to verify the rumors that dogs have failed to take over the planet. 
duration of the movie = 1h27 
tagline = Rover is about to take over. 
average note = 4.6 
Director = John Robert Hoffman 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 10 of October 2003 
cast = Molly Shannon, Liam Aiken, Matthew Broderick, Donald Faison 
Producer = Lisa Henson 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h27 

In "Good Boy!", directed by John Robert Hoffman, an intergalactic dog pilot from Sirius (the dog star) named Rover, voiced by Matthew Broderick, visits Earth to verify the rumors that dogs have failed to take over the planet. With a stellar cast including Molly Shannon, Liam Aiken, and Donald Faison, this heartwarming comedy explores the bond between humans and their furry friends. As Rover navigates through his mission, he discovers the true meaning of loyalty and friendship. Will Rover succeed in his quest to take over Earth, or will he find something even more valuable along the way? Find out in this delightful film with a runtime of 1 hour and 27 minutes, released on the 10th of October 2003 in the United States of America. Remember, Rover is about to take over!

**Facts included:**
- Title: Good Boy!
- Overview: An intergalactic dog pilot from Sirius (the dog star), visits Earth to verify the rumors that dogs have failed to take over the planet.
- Duration of the movie: 1h27
- Tagline: Rover is about to take over.
- Average note: 4.6
- Director: John Robert Hoffman
- Production country: United States of America
- Date of release: the 10th of October 2003
- Cast: Molly Shannon, Liam Aiken, Matthew Broderick, Donald Faison
- Producer: Lisa Henson
