title = A Christmas Story 
overview = The comic mishaps and adventures of a young boy named Ralph, trying to convince his parents, teachers, and Santa that a Red Ryder B.B. gun really is the perfect Christmas gift for the 1940s. 
cast = Melinda Dillon, Darren McGavin, Peter Billingsley, Jean Shepherd 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Melinda Dillon, Darren McGavin, Peter Billingsley, Jean Shepherd 

In "A Christmas Story," viewers are taken on a nostalgic journey back to the 1940s as they follow the hilarious escapades of young Ralph. Determined to prove to his parents, teachers, and even Santa that a Red Ryder B.B. gun is the ultimate Christmas present, Ralph finds himself in a series of comedic misadventures. With a stellar cast including Melinda Dillon, Darren McGavin, Peter Billingsley, and Jean Shepherd, this heartwarming tale is told in its original language of English, capturing the essence of holiday magic and childhood dreams. The movie is set in the 1940s.

Determined to prove to his parents, teachers, and even Santa that a Red Ryder B.B. gun is the ultimate Christmas present, Ralph finds himself in a series of comedic misadventures. With a stellar cast including Melinda Dillon, Darren McGavin, Peter Billingsley, and Jean Shepherd, this heartwarming tale is told in its original language of English, capturing the essence of holiday magic and childhood dreams. The movie is set in the 1940s.

title = Three Strangers 
overview = On the eve of the Chinese New Year, three strangers make a pact before a small statue of the Chinese goddess of Destiny. The strangers are Crystal Shackleford, married to a wealthy philanderer; Jerome Artbutny, an outwardly respectable judge; and Johnny West, a seedy sneak thief. The threesome agree to purchase a sweepstakes ticket and share whatever winnings might accrue.

In the captivating film "Three Strangers," directed by Jean Negulesco, three individuals from different walks of life - Crystal, a wealthy but unhappy wife; Jerome, a respected judge with a hidden secret; and Johnny, a cunning thief - come together on the eve of the Chinese New Year to make a fateful pact in front of a statue of the Chinese goddess of Destiny. Played by the talented cast including Sydney Greenstreet, Geraldine Fitzgerald, Peter Lorre, and Joan Lorring, the trio agrees to pool their resources and purchase a sweepstakes ticket, binding their fates together. As the suspenseful story unfolds, their lives intertwine in unexpected ways, leading to a thrilling climax that keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. With a tagline promising "BREATHTAKING SUSPENSE - THRILLS," this English-language production from Warner Bros. delivers a compelling narrative that garnered $10.5 million in revenue and an average rating of 6.2. At a runtime of 1 hour and 32 minutes, "Three Strangers" is a must-watch for fans of mystery and intrigue. The movie was produced by Wolfgang Reinhardt in the United States of America.

In the enchanting short film "Presto," produced by Pixar Animation Studios and directed by Doug Sweetland, audiences are transported to the world of a renowned magician named Presto. Known for his dignity, poise, and mystery, Presto's life takes an unexpected turn when he forgets to feed his rabbit one too many times. As Presto grapples with the consequences of his neglect, he realizes that both he and his rabbit have a few tricks up their sleeves. Set in the United States of America at the turn of the century, this English-language film was released on the 18th of June 2008 to critical acclaim, boasting an average rating of 8.0. title = Obit 
overview = How do you put a life into 500 words? Ask the staff obituary writers at the New York Times. OBIT is a first-ever glimpse into the daily rituals, joys and existential angst of the Times obit writers, as they chronicle life after death on the front lines of history. 
duration of the movie = 1h33 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h33 

In the captivating film "Obit," viewers are granted a rare opportunity to peer behind the curtain and witness the intricate process of encapsulating a lifetime in a mere 500 words. Delving into the lives of the dedicated obituary writers at the prestigious New York Times, this documentary provides a poignant exploration of the daily routines, moments of joy, and profound existential reflections that accompany the task of chronicling the legacies of the deceased. Set against the backdrop of history in the making, "Obit" offers a unique perspective on the intersection of life and death. With a runtime of 1 hour and 33 minutes, this insightful portrayal is presented in its original language of English.

In the captivating film "Obit," viewers are granted a rare opportunity to peer behind the curtain and witness the intricate process of encapsulating a lifetime in a mere 500 words. Delving into the lives of the dedicated obituary writers at the prestigious New York Times, this documentary provides a poignant exploration of the daily routines, moments of joy, and profound existential reflections that accompany the task of chronicling the legacies of the deceased. Set against the backdrop of history in the making, "Obit" offers a unique perspective on the intersection of life and death. With a runtime of 1 hour and 33 minutes, this insightful portrayal is presented in its original language of English.

title = Sealed Cargo 
overview = A Newfoundland fishingboat comes to the aid of a wrecked Danish sailing ship and tows it to a small village, but eventually the captain of the fishingboat realises that it's a U-boat supply ship in disguise, loaded with torpedoes. So, together with his crew and a group of villagers he sets about a plan to blow the ship as well as any U-boats that approach it. Based on the novel "The Gaunt Woman" by Edmund Gilligan. 
production compagnie = RKO Radio Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = RKO Radio Pictures 

title = Sealed Cargo 
overview = A Newfoundland fishing boat comes to the aid of a wrecked Danish sailing ship and tows it to a small village, but eventually the captain of the fishing boat realizes that it's a U-boat supply ship in disguise, loaded with torpedoes. So, together with his crew and a group of villagers, he sets about a plan to blow up the ship as well as any U-boats that approach it. The movie is based on the novel "The Gaunt Woman" by Edmund Gilligan. 
production compagnie = RKO Radio Pictures 

In the thrilling movie "Sealed Cargo," a Newfoundland fishing boat rescues a distressed Danish sailing ship and brings it to a small village for safety. However, as the captain of the fishing boat uncovers the truth, he realizes that the seemingly innocent ship is actually a disguised U-boat supply vessel, carrying a dangerous cargo of torpedoes. With the help of his crew and the villagers, they devise a daring plan to destroy the ship and any approaching U-boats. Based on the novel "The Gaunt Woman" by Edmund Gilligan, this suspenseful tale is brought to life by RKO Radio Pictures.

title = The Secret Life of Walter Mitty 
overview = A timid magazine photo manager who lives life vicariously through daydreams embarks on a true-life adventure when a negative goes missing. 
duration of the movie = 1h54 
Producer = Ben Stiller 
cast = Ben Stiller, Kristen Wiig, Patton Oswalt, Shirley MacLaine 
Director = Ben Stiller 
production compagnie = New Line Cinema 
budget = 90.0 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 188.1 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h54 

In "The Secret Life of Walter Mitty," directed by and starring Ben Stiller, we follow the journey of a timid magazine photo manager who finds himself thrust into a real-life adventure when a negative goes missing. Living vicariously through daydreams, Walter Mitty, played by Ben Stiller, must now face the challenges of the real world. Joined by a stellar cast including Kristen Wiig, Patton Oswalt, and Shirley MacLaine, the film takes viewers on a captivating 1 hour and 54-minute exploration of self-discovery and courage. Produced by Ben Stiller under New Line Cinema, this English-language film had a budget of $90.0 million but went on to earn a remarkable $188.1 million in revenue.

title = The Coming of Sin 
overview = A superstitious, illiterate young gypsy servant girl comes to live with a solitary female artist at her country chateau. The girl has recurring nightmares of a naked man on horseback assaulting and abusing her. As the artist takes the girl under her wing, an sensuous relationship develops between them. 
budget = 247.2 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 247.2 millions of dollars 

In "The Coming of Sin," a superstitious and illiterate young gypsy servant girl finds herself haunted by recurring nightmares of a naked man on horseback assaulting her. Seeking refuge, she moves in with a solitary female artist at her country chateau. As the artist takes the girl under her wing, an sensuous relationship develops between them. With a budget of 247.2 million dollars, this provocative tale explores the complexities of intimacy, power dynamics, and the lingering impact of past traumas.

Seeking refuge, she moves in with a solitary female artist at her country chateau. As the artist takes the girl under her wing, an sensuous relationship develops between them. With a budget of 247.2 million dollars, this provocative tale explores the complexities of intimacy, power dynamics, and the lingering impact of past traumas.

title = Zero Days 
overview = Alex Gibney explores the phenomenon of Stuxnet, a self-replicating computer virus discovered in 2010 by international IT experts. Evidently commissioned by the US and Israeli governments, this malware was designed to specifically sabotage Iran’s nuclear programme. However, the complex computer worm ended up not only infecting its intended target but also spreading uncontrollably. 
production compagnie = Jigsaw Productions 
Producer = Alex Gibney 
cast = Joanne Tucker, Yossi Melman, Ralph Langner, Emad Kiyaei 
revenue = 114.8 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.5 
tagline = World War 3.0 
duration of the movie = 1h56 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 8 of July 2016 
budget = 207.0 millions of dollars 
Director = Alex Gibney 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Jigsaw Productions 

In "Zero Days," directed by Alex Gibney and produced by Jigsaw Productions, viewers are taken on a gripping journey into the world of cyber warfare. The film delves into the discovery of Stuxnet, a powerful computer virus unleashed in 2010 with the apparent backing of the US and Israeli governments. What was meant to disrupt Iran's nuclear program takes a dangerous turn as the virus spreads beyond control, infecting unintended targets. With a stellar cast including Joanne Tucker, Yossi Melman, Ralph Langner, and Emad Kiyaei, this intense documentary sheds light on the unforeseen consequences of modern warfare. As tensions escalate in this digital battleground, "Zero Days" leaves audiences questioning the implications of a new era - World War 3.0. With a runtime of 1 hour and 56 minutes, this English-language film was released on July 8, 2016, in the United States of America. Despite its budget of $207.0 million, the movie managed to generate a revenue of $114.8 million, showcasing its impact and success.

title = Love in the Time of Cholera 
overview = In Colombia just after the Great War, an old man falls from a ladder; dying, he professes great love for his wife. After the funeral, a man calls on the widow - she dismisses him angrily. Flash back more than 50 years to the day Florentino Ariza, a telegraph boy, falls in love with Fermina Daza, the daughter of a mule trader. 
tagline = How long would you wait for love? 
cast = Javier Bardem, Unax Ugalde, Benjamin Bratt, Catalina Sandino Moreno 
Director = Mike Newell 
budget = 45.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 4 of October 2007 
production compagnie = New Line Cinema 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 4.6 millions of dollars 
Producer = Scott Steindorff 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = How long would you wait for love? 

In "Love in the Time of Cholera," directed by Mike Newell and produced by Scott Steindorff, viewers are taken on a journey through time and love in Colombia just after the Great War. The film follows the story of Florentino Ariza, a telegraph boy portrayed by Javier Bardem, who falls deeply in love with Fermina Daza, played by Catalina Sandino Moreno, the daughter of a mule trader. As the narrative unfolds, spanning over 50 years, audiences witness the enduring power of love as Florentino waits for Fermina, despite her marriage to another man.

Set against the backdrop of a post-war Colombia, the film explores themes of love, loss, and longing, asking the poignant question, "How long would you wait for love?" With a budget of 45 million dollars, "Love in the Time of Cholera" was released on the 4th of October 2007 by New Line Cinema. The star-studded cast also includes Unax Ugalde and Benjamin Bratt in pivotal roles.

Despite its production in the United States and English being the original language of the movie, "Love in the Time of Cholera" garnered a revenue of 4.6 million dollars, showcasing the timeless appeal of its romantic tale. 

**Facts included:**
- Title: Love in the Time of Cholera
- Overview of the movie
- Tagline: How long would you wait for love?
- Cast: Javier Bardem, Unax Ugalde, Benjamin Bratt, Catalina Sandino Moreno
- Director: Mike Newell
- Budget: 45.0 million dollars
- Date of release: the 4th of October 2007
- Production company: New Line Cinema
- Original language of the movie: English
- Production country: United States of America
- Revenue: 4.6 million dollars
- Producer: Scott Steindorff

In "Love in the Time of Cholera," directed by Mike Newell and produced by Scott Steindorff, viewers are taken on a journey through time and love in Colombia just after the Great War. The film follows the story of Florentino Ariza, a telegraph boy portrayed by Javier Bardem, who falls deeply in love with Fermina Daza, played by Catalina Sandino Moreno, the daughter of a mule trader. As the narrative unfolds, spanning over 50 years, audiences witness the enduring power of love as Florentino waits for Fermina, despite her marriage to another man.

Set against the backdrop of a post-war Colombia, the film explores themes of love, loss, and longing, asking the poignant question, "How long would you wait for love?" With a budget of 45 million dollars, "Love in the Time of Cholera" was released on the 4th of October 2007 by New Line Cinema. The star-studded cast also includes Unax Ugalde and Benjamin Bratt in pivotal roles.

Despite its production in the United States and English being the original language of the movie, "Love in the Time of Cholera" garnered a revenue of 4.6 million dollars, showcasing the timeless appeal of its romantic tale. 

**Facts included:**
- Title: Love in the Time of Cholera
- Overview of the movie
- Tagline: How long would you wait for love?
- Cast: Javier Bardem, Unax Ugalde, Benjamin Bratt, Catalina Sandino Moreno
- Director: Mike Newell
- Budget: 45.0 million dollars
- Date of release: the 4th of October 2007
- Production company: New Line Cinema
- Original language of the movie: English
- Production country: United States of America
- Revenue: 4.6 million dollars
- Producer: Scott Steindorff

title = The Young Girls of Rochefort 
overview = Delphine and Solange are two sisters living in Rochefort. They are both looking for love, without being aware that their ideal partner is very close... A film where the scenario is much less important than its feeling of euphory, according to the director Jacques Demy. 
duration of the movie = 2h04 
production countrie = France 
date of release = the 8 of March 1967 
production compagnie = Madeleine Films 
budget = 81.6 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.5 
original language of the movie = French 
revenue = 240.4 millions of dollars 
cast = Catherine Deneuve, Françoise Dorléac, Jacques Perrin, George Chakiris 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 2h04 

In the enchanting town of Rochefort, two sisters, Delphine and Solange, are on a quest for love, unaware that their perfect match may be closer than they think. Directed by Jacques Demy, "The Young Girls of Rochefort" is a French cinematic masterpiece that prioritizes the feeling of euphoria over the storyline. Released on the 8th of March 1967, this visually stunning film runs for 2 hours and 4 minutes, captivating audiences with its romantic charm. Starring Catherine Deneuve, Françoise Dorléac, Jacques Perrin, and George Chakiris, the movie is a celebration of love and music set against the picturesque backdrop of France. Produced by Madeleine Films in France, the film had a budget of 81.6 million dollars and went on to gross an impressive 240.4 million dollars, earning an average rating of 7.5. "The Young Girls of Rochefort" is a timeless classic that transports viewers to a world where love is just around the corner.

title = King Kong 
overview = In 1933 New York, an overly ambitious movie producer coerces his cast and hired ship crew to travel to mysterious Skull Island, where they encounter Kong, a giant ape who is immediately smitten with the leading lady. 
duration of the movie = 3h07 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 3h07 

In the epic adventure film "King Kong," set in 1933 New York, an ambitious movie producer convinces his cast and crew to embark on a journey to the enigmatic Skull Island. Little do they know, their expedition leads them to a thrilling encounter with Kong, a colossal ape who becomes infatuated with the film's leading lady. As the story unfolds over a gripping duration of 3 hours and 7 minutes, audiences are taken on a heart-pounding ride filled with jaw-dropping action and awe-inspiring visuals. Get ready to witness the legendary tale of King Kong like never before.

title = Sholay 
overview = A Police Officer, whose family was killed by a bandit named Gabbar Singh, decides to fight fire with fire and recruits two convicts, Jai & Veeru, to bring Gabbar Singh to jail alive, but will they succeed in their mission and get their reward? Come and watch the action-packed super-hit Sholay to find out!! 
revenue = 123.3 millions of dollars 
Producer = G.P. Sippy 
production countrie = India 
original language of the movie = Hindi 
production compagnie = United Producers 
Director = Ramesh Sippy 
date of release = the 15 of August 1975 
average note = 6.9 
duration of the movie = 3h24 
budget = 37.0 millions of dollars 
cast = Amitabh Bachchan, Dharmendra, Sanjeev Kumar, Hema Malini 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 123.3 millions of dollars 

In the action-packed super-hit movie "Sholay," directed by Ramesh Sippy and produced by G.P. Sippy under the production company United Producers, viewers are taken on a thrilling journey as a Police Officer seeks revenge on the notorious bandit Gabbar Singh, who was responsible for the death of his family. To bring Gabbar Singh to justice, the officer enlists the help of two convicts, Jai & Veeru, portrayed by Amitabh Bachchan and Dharmendra, in a mission to capture him alive. Set in India and released on the 15th of August 1975, this Hindi-language film captivated audiences with its stellar performances and intense storyline. With a duration of 3 hours and 24 minutes, "Sholay" grossed a whopping $123.3 million at the box office, surpassing its $37.0 million budget. The movie also features renowned actors Sanjeev Kumar and Hema Malini, and received an average rating of 6.9. Will Jai & Veeru succeed in their dangerous mission and claim their reward? Find out by watching "Sholay"! 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = G.P. Sippy 

In the action-packed super-hit movie "Sholay," directed by Ramesh Sippy and produced by G.P. Sippy under the production company United Producers, viewers are taken on a thrilling journey as a Police Officer seeks revenge on the notorious bandit Gabbar Singh, who was responsible for the death of his family. To bring Gabbar Singh to justice, the officer enlists the help of two convicts, Jai & Veeru, portrayed by Amitabh Bachchan and Dharmendra, in a mission to capture him alive. Set in India and released on the 15th of August 1975, this Hindi-language film captivated audiences with its stellar performances and intense storyline. With a duration of 3 hours and 24 minutes, "Sholay" grossed a whopping $123.3 million at the box office, surpassing its $37.0 million budget. The movie also features renowned actors Sanjeev Kumar and Hema Malini, and received an average rating of 6.9. Will Jai & Veeru succeed in their dangerous mission and claim their reward? Find out by watching "Sholay"!

title = Whiskey Tango Foxtrot 
overview = In 2002, cable news producer Kim Barker (Tina Fey) decides to shake up her routine by taking a daring new assignment in Kabul, Afghanistan. Dislodged from her comfortable American lifestyle, Barker finds herself in the middle of an out-of-control war zone. Luckily, she meets Tanya Vanderpoel (Margot Robbie), a fellow journalist who takes the shellshocked reporter under her wing. Amid the militants, warlords and nighttime partying, Barker discovers the key to becoming a successful correspondent. 
tagline = From the headlines to the front lines 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 6.0 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 
duration of the movie = 1h52 
Producer = Ian Bryce 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = From the headlines to the front lines 

In the riveting film "Whiskey Tango Foxtrot," cable news producer Kim Barker (Tina Fey) embarks on a life-changing assignment in Kabul, Afghanistan in 2002. Displaced from her familiar American lifestyle, Barker navigates the chaos of a war zone with the help of journalist Tanya Vanderpoel (Margot Robbie). As she encounters militants, warlords, and wild nighttime escapades, Barker learns the ropes of being a successful correspondent. With a tagline that reads "From the headlines to the front lines," this English-language movie, produced by Paramount Pictures and Ian Bryce, offers a glimpse into the challenges and triumphs of reporting from the heart of conflict. With an average rating of 6.0, this 1 hour and 52-minute film is a compelling portrayal of one woman's journey into the heart of danger. The production country is the United States of America.

title = Santa Sangre 
overview = A young man is confined in a mental hospital. Through a flashback we see that he was traumatized as a child, when he and his family were circus performers: he saw his father cut off the arms of his mother, a religious fanatic and leader of the heretical church of Santa Sangre ("Holy Blood"), and then commit suicide. Back in the present, he escapes and rejoins his surviving and armless mother. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : tagline = Forget Everything You Have Ever Seen. 

In the haunting and surreal film "Santa Sangre," we follow the journey of a young man who finds himself trapped in a mental hospital, haunted by traumatic memories from his past. Flashbacks reveal a dark and twisted history where he witnessed unspeakable horrors within his own family - a circus troupe torn apart by violence and religious fanaticism. The young man's mother, the leader of the heretical church of Santa Sangre, becomes a central figure in his troubled psyche as he navigates a world filled with pain and madness. As he escapes from the confines of the hospital, he is drawn back to his armless mother, setting off a chain of events that blur the lines between reality and nightmare. The film explores themes of family, faith, and the enduring scars of the past that shape our present. 
 
 
TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : production compagnie = Produzioni Intersound

The film explores themes of family, faith, and the enduring scars of the past that shape our present.

fact : production countrie = Mexico 

In the haunting and surreal film "Santa Sangre," we follow the journey of a young man who finds himself trapped in a mental hospital, haunted by traumatic memories from his past. Flashbacks reveal a dark and twisted history where he witnessed unspeakable horrors within his own family - a circus troupe torn apart by violence and religious fanaticism. The young man's mother, the leader of the heretical church of Santa Sangre, becomes a central figure in his troubled psyche as he navigates a world filled with pain and madness. As he escapes from the confines of the hospital, he is drawn back to his armless mother, setting off a chain of events that blur the lines between reality and nightmare. The film explores themes of family, faith, and the enduring scars of the past that shape our present. 
 
 
TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : date of release = the 1 of May 1989 

In the haunting and surreal film "Santa Sangre," we follow the journey of a young man who finds himself trapped in a mental hospital, haunted by traumatic memories from his past. Flashbacks reveal a dark and twisted history where he witnessed unspeakable horrors within his own family - a circus troupe torn apart by violence and religious fanaticism. The young man's mother, the leader of the heretical church of Santa Sangre, becomes a central figure in his troubled psyche as he navigates a world filled with pain and madness. As he escapes from the confines of the hospital, he is drawn back to his armless mother, setting off a chain of events that blur the lines between reality and nightmare. The film explores themes of family, faith, and the enduring scars of the past that shape our present. 
 
 

 
title = Shank 
overview = Mo Ali’s futuristic knife-crime drama brings the dystopian environment of CHILDREN OF MEN and DISTRICT 13 to London’s East 17. SHANK delivers a ruthless vision of forthcoming urban life, where guns have been superseded by knives and are fiercely wielded by aimless youths. Amidst the chaos is the Paper Chazers gang, a rare morally conscious group who trade scavenged food for money. After Chazers gang member, Junior (Kedar Williams-Stirling), witnesses his brother, murder he must decide whether to get revenge of stick to the gangs moral code... In this superbly paced and artistic film, present-day social issues, and murky city streets, provide a perfect canvas for imagination and action. 
average note = 5.0 
tagline = If you're not one of us, you're a victim. 
date of release = the 21 of August 2010 
budget = 91.7 millions of dollars 
cast = Kedar Williams-Stirling, Ashley Bashy Thomas, Adam Deacon, Michael Socha 
revenue = 93.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Mo Ali 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 5.0 

In the gritty and intense movie "Shank," director Mo Ali presents a chilling glimpse into a future London where knives have replaced guns as the weapon of choice among disillusioned youth. Drawing inspiration from films like "Children of Men" and "District 13," the film follows the Paper Chazers gang, a group with a rare sense of morality in a chaotic world. When Junior, played by Kedar Williams-Stirling, is faced with the decision of seeking revenge for his brother's murder or upholding the gang's principles, tensions rise within the group. Amidst the chaos is the Paper Chazers gang, a rare morally conscious group who trade scavenged food for money. Against the backdrop of social issues and urban decay, "Shank" weaves a compelling narrative that challenges viewers to question where their loyalties lie. With a tagline that warns, "If you're not one of us, you're a victim," this action-packed film immerses audiences in a dystopian vision of London's East 17. Released on August 21, 2010, in the United Kingdom, "Shank" captivates with its raw energy and thought-provoking themes. Starring Kedar Williams-Stirling, Ashley Bashy Thomas, Adam Deacon, and Michael Socha, this visually stunning movie explores the thin line between justice and vengeance in a world on the brink of collapse. The movie had a budget of 91.7 million dollars and grossed 93.0 million dollars at the box office, receiving an average note of 5.0. The original language of the movie is English.

['correct']

title = It All Came True 
overview = After crooked nightclub owner Chips Maguire murders a police informant, he blackmails his piano player to allow him to stay at his eccentric mother's boarding house. 
duration of the movie = 1h37 
cast = Ann Sheridan, Jeffrey Lynn, Humphrey Bogart, Zasu Pitts 
Director = Lewis Seiler 
budget = 283.9 millions of dollars 
Producer = Mark Hellinger 
date of release = the 6 of April 1940 
production compagnie = First National Pictures 
tagline = HURRY! HERE'S A HIT! 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h37 

In the 1940 film "It All Came True," directed by Lewis Seiler and produced by Mark Hellinger, crooked nightclub owner Chips Maguire finds himself in a dangerous situation after committing a murder. To evade the law, he coerces his piano player into letting him hide out at his quirky mother's boarding house. Starring Ann Sheridan, Jeffrey Lynn, Humphrey Bogart, and Zasu Pitts, this suspenseful drama unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 37 minutes. With a whopping budget of 283.9 million dollars, this production by First National Pictures hit the screens on April 6th, 1940, with the tagline urging audiences to "HURRY! HERE'S A HIT!"

title = Tentacles 
overview = Several people disappear from and at the sea. Their bodies are found gnawed to the skeleton, even the marrow is missing. The scientists have no idea which animal could do such things. Dr. Turner begins to suspect that the company which builds a tunnel beneath the bay might have poisoned the environment and caused an octopus to mutate to giant dimensions... 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : budget = 0.8 millions of dollars 

In the thrilling movie "Tentacles," a series of mysterious disappearances and gruesome discoveries plague a seaside community. When bodies are found gnawed to the bone, with even the marrow missing, panic ensues as scientists struggle to identify the culprit behind these horrific attacks. Dr. Turner, played by a brilliant actor, becomes increasingly suspicious of a company constructing a tunnel beneath the bay, suspecting that their activities may have triggered the mutation of an ordinary octopus into a colossal, man-eating monster. As chaos grips the town and the death toll rises, the race is on to stop the tentacled terror before it devours everything in its path. The movie features several people disappearing at sea, their bodies later discovered in a gruesome state. The scientists are baffled by the nature of the attacks and are unable to determine the responsible creature. 
 
 
TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : average note = 3.8 

In the thrilling movie "Tentacles," a series of mysterious disappearances and gruesome discoveries plague a seaside community. When bodies are found gnawed to the bone, with even the marrow missing, panic ensues as scientists struggle to identify the culprit behind these horrific attacks. Dr. Turner, played by a brilliant actor, becomes increasingly suspicious of a company constructing a tunnel beneath the bay, suspecting that their activities may have triggered the mutation of an ordinary octopus into a colossal, man-eating monster. As chaos grips the town and the death toll rises, the race is on to stop the tentacled terror before it devours everything in its path. The movie features several people disappearing at sea, their bodies later discovered in a gruesome state. The scientists are baffled by the nature of the attacks and are unable to determine the responsible creature.

fact : revenue = 3.0 millions of dollars 

In the thrilling movie "Tentacles," a series of mysterious disappearances and gruesome discoveries plague a seaside community. When bodies are found gnawed to the bone, with even the marrow missing, panic ensues as scientists struggle to identify the culprit behind these horrific attacks. Dr. Turner, played by a brilliant actor, becomes increasingly suspicious of a company constructing a tunnel beneath the bay, suspecting that their activities may have triggered the mutation of an ordinary octopus into a colossal, man-eating monster. As chaos grips the town and the death toll rises, the race is on to stop the tentacled terror before it devours everything in its path. The movie features several people disappearing at sea, their bodies later discovered in a gruesome state. The scientists are baffled by the nature of the attacks and are unable to determine the responsible creature.

title = The Comebacks 
overview = A comedy that spoofs the inspirational sports movies, The Comebacks tells the story of an out-of-luck coach, Lambeau Fields, who takes a rag-tag bunch of college misfits and drives them towards the football championships. In the process, this life-long loser discovers that he is a winner after all by redeeming himself, saving his relationship with his family and friends, and finding that there is indeed, no "I" in "team"! 
cast = Carl Weathers, David Koechner, Melora Hardin, Matthew Lawrence 
production compagnie = Fox Atomic 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Tom Brady 
budget = 15.0 millions of dollars 
revenue = 219.9 millions of dollars 
Producer = Peter Abrams 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 4.9 
duration of the movie = 1h47 
tagline = Keep your eye on the ball. 
date of release = the 19 of October 2007 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Carl Weathers, David Koechner, Melora Hardin, Matthew Lawrence 

The Comebacks is a comedy that spoofs inspirational sports movies, following the journey of Lambeau Fields, a down-on-his-luck coach portrayed by Carl Weathers. Lambeau takes on the challenge of coaching a group of college misfits towards the football championships, spoofing inspirational sports movies along the way. As the rag-tag team progresses, Lambeau not only discovers his own potential for success but also learns valuable lessons about redemption, teamwork, and the importance of relationships with family and friends. With a stellar cast including David Koechner, Melora Hardin, and Matthew Lawrence, this Fox Atomic production showcases the classic message that there is no "I" in "team." Directed by Tom Brady, the film was released on October 19, 2007, in the United States. The movie received an average rating of 4.9 and grossed an impressive $219.9 million worldwide against a budget of $15.0 million. The tagline "Keep your eye on the ball" perfectly encapsulates the spirit of this feel-good comedy that will have you laughing and rooting for the underdogs until the very end.

title = Mickey Blue Eyes 
overview = An English auctioneer proposes to the daughter of a mafia kingpin, only to realize that certain "favors" would be asked of him. 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
production compagnie = Castle Rock Entertainment 
average note = 5.3 
cast = Hugh Grant, James Caan, Jeanne Tripplehorn, Burt Young 
Director = Kelly Makin 
duration of the movie = 1h42 
budget = 249.5 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Elizabeth Hurley 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United Kingdom 

In the British comedy "Mickey Blue Eyes," an English auctioneer finds himself in a sticky situation when he proposes to the daughter of a mafia kingpin. As he navigates the complexities of his new relationship, he quickly realizes that certain "favors" will be expected of him. Directed by Kelly Makin and produced by Elizabeth Hurley, the film features a star-studded cast including Hugh Grant, James Caan, Jeanne Tripplehorn, and Burt Young. With an average rating of 5.3, this United Kingdom production by Castle Rock Entertainment runs for 1 hour and 42 minutes in its original English language. With a budget of 249.5 million dollars, "Mickey Blue Eyes" promises a blend of romance, comedy, and mafia intrigue.

In the British comedy "Mickey Blue Eyes," an English auctioneer finds himself in a sticky situation when he proposes to the daughter of a mafia kingpin. As he navigates the complexities of his new relationship, he quickly realizes that certain "favors" will be expected of him. Directed by Kelly Makin and produced by Elizabeth Hurley, the film features a star-studded cast including Hugh Grant, James Caan, Jeanne Tripplehorn, and Burt Young. With an average rating of 5.3, this United Kingdom production by Castle Rock Entertainment runs for 1 hour and 42 minutes in its original English language. With a budget of 249.5 million dollars, "Mickey Blue Eyes" promises a blend of romance, comedy, and mafia intrigue. 
 
 

 
title = Titanic 
overview = Unhappily married, Julia Sturges decides to go to America with her two children on the unsinkable Titanic. Her husband, Richard also arranges passage on the luxury liner so as to have custody of their two children. All this fades to insignificance once the ship hits an iceberg. 
date of release = the 11 of April 1953 
cast = Clifton Webb, Barbara Stanwyck, Robert Wagner, Audrey Dalton 
Director = Jean Negulesco 
tagline = TITANIC in Emotion...in Spectacle...in Climax...in Cast! 
Producer = Charles Brackett 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 11 of April 1953 

In 1953, director Jean Negulesco brought to life the heart-wrenching tale of "Titanic." Starring Clifton Webb, Barbara Stanwyck, Robert Wagner, and Audrey Dalton, this film follows the story of Julia Sturges, who boards the unsinkable Titanic with her children to escape her unhappy marriage to Richard. Her husband, Richard, also arranges passage on the luxury liner to have custody of their two children. As the luxurious liner sets sail, tensions rise between the estranged couple, only to be overshadowed by the tragic encounter with an iceberg. Producer Charles Brackett ensured that this cinematic spectacle captured the essence of the iconic disaster, delivering a riveting portrayal of love, loss, and the ultimate test of human resilience. With a tagline promising "TITANIC in Emotion...in Spectacle...in Climax...in Cast," this American production remains a timeless classic that continues to captivate audiences with its gripping narrative.

The movie was released on the 11th of April 1953 in the United States of America.

title = Blondie Johnson 
overview = When Blondie Johnson's mother dies in poverty, Blondie vows that she will never be poor again. Convinced that virtue doesn't pay, she travels to the city and immediately begins a con with the help of taxi driver Red Charley. Later that evening, after splitting the take with Red, one of her marks, Danny Jones, spots her and invites her home with him for a talk. 
tagline = LOVE made her beautiful... WANT made her daring... MEN made her ruthless! 
date of release = the 25 of February 1933 
Producer = Ray Enright 
duration of the movie = 1h07 
cast = Joan Blondell, Chester Morris, Allen Jenkins, Earle Foxe 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = LOVE made her beautiful... WANT made her daring... MEN made her ruthless! 

In the 1933 film "Blondie Johnson," Joan Blondell stars as the titular character who, after her mother's death in poverty, makes a solemn vow to never experience the same fate. Determined to escape her circumstances, Blondie teams up with taxi driver Red Charley to embark on a life of deception and crime in the city. As she delves deeper into her schemes, she catches the eye of a mark named Danny Jones, leading to unexpected twists and turns. With a runtime of 1 hour and 7 minutes, this Ray Enright-produced movie showcases Blondell's transformation from a woman seeking survival to a ruthless player in a world driven by love, want, and ambition. Co-starring Chester Morris, Allen Jenkins, and Earle Foxe, "Blondie Johnson" is a gripping tale of one woman's journey through the underbelly of society, where beauty, daring, and ruthlessness collide.

Tagline: LOVE made her beautiful... WANT made her daring... MEN made her ruthless! 
Date of release: February 25, 1933 
Producer: Ray Enright 
Duration of the movie: 1h07 
Cast: Joan Blondell, Chester Morris, Allen Jenkins, Earle Foxe 
Original language of the movie: English

title = The Eye 
overview = Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people. 
duration of the movie = 1h38 
production compagnie = Paramount Vantage 
average note = 5.5 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 1 of February 2008 
Director = David Moreau 
Producer = Paula Wagner 
tagline = How can you believe your eyes when they're not yours? 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h38 

In "The Eye," directed by David Moreau and produced by Paula Wagner, we follow the story of Sydney Wells, a talented violinist who was blinded by her sister Helen at a young age. After undergoing a cornea transplant, Sydney begins to see dead people as she recovers from the operation. This supernatural thriller, released on the 1st of February 2008 by Paramount Vantage, challenges the audience with the tagline: "How can you believe your eyes when they're not yours?" With a runtime of 1 hour and 38 minutes, the film is presented in its original language, English, and has received an average rating of 5.5. The production company behind the movie is Paramount Vantage.

['correct']

After undergoing a cornea transplant, Sydney begins to see dead people as she recovers from the operation. This supernatural thriller, released on the 1st of February 2008 by Paramount Vantage, challenges the audience with the tagline: "How can you believe your eyes when they're not yours?" With a runtime of 1 hour and 38 minutes, the film is presented in its original language, English, and has received an average rating of 5.5. The production company behind the movie is Paramount Vantage.

title = Breakout 
overview = A bush pilot is hired for $250,000 to go to Mexico to free an innocent prisoner. 
Producer = Robert Chartoff 
duration of the movie = 1h36 
average note = 6.4 
date of release = the 21 of May 1975 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures Corporation 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Robert Chartoff 

In the action-packed movie "Breakout," produced by Robert Chartoff, a daring bush pilot is offered a hefty sum of $250,000 to embark on a dangerous mission to Mexico. The pilot's task? To liberate an unjustly imprisoned individual. As the thrilling story unfolds, viewers are taken on a gripping journey that lasts for 1 hour and 36 minutes. Released on the 21st of May 1975 by Columbia Pictures Corporation, this film boasts an average rating of 6.4. Get ready for a high-stakes adventure where one pilot's courage is put to the ultimate test in a race against time to secure freedom for the innocent prisoner.

title = Moscow on the Hudson 
overview = A Russian circus visits the US. A clown wants to defect, but doesn't have the nerve. His saxophone playing friend however comes to the decision to defect in the middle of Bloomingdales. He is befriended by the black security guard and falls in love with the Italian immigrant from behind the perfume counter. We follow his life as he works his way through the American dream and tries to find work as a musician. 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures Corporation 
Director = Paul Mazursky 
Producer = Paul Mazursky 
average note = 6.3 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = Vladimir Ivanoff walks into a department store to buy blue jeans, walks out with a girl friend, an immigration lawyer and a buddy. His life and theirs will never be the same again. 
duration of the movie = 1h55 
budget = 6.9 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 4 of June 1984 
cast = Robin Williams, María Conchita Alonso, Cleavant Derricks, Alejandro Rey 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Columbia Pictures Corporation 

In "Moscow on the Hudson," directed and produced by Paul Mazursky and released by Columbia Pictures Corporation on the 4th of June 1984, we are taken on a journey with Vladimir Ivanoff, a Russian circus performer who decides to defect to the United States. Set in the bustling city of New York, Vladimir finds himself befriended by a black security guard and falling in love with an Italian immigrant while navigating the complexities of the American dream. As he tries to establish himself as a musician, Vladimir's life takes unexpected turns after a chance encounter in Bloomingdales. Starring Robin Williams, María Conchita Alonso, Cleavant Derricks, and Alejandro Rey, this heartwarming tale explores themes of friendship, love, and the pursuit of a better life. With an average rating of 6.3 and a budget of 6.9 million dollars, "Moscow on the Hudson" is a captivating story that showcases the challenges and triumphs of starting anew in a foreign land. The original language of the movie is English, and it has a runtime of 1 hour and 55 minutes. The tagline for the film is "Vladimir Ivanoff walks into a department store to buy blue jeans, walks out with a girlfriend, an immigration lawyer, and a buddy. His life and theirs will never be the same again."

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Bille Woodruff 

In the gripping drama "Addicted," directed by Bille Woodruff and released on the 10th of October 2014, a successful gallerist finds herself entangled in a dangerous affair with a talented painter, putting her family and career at risk. As she delves deeper into this forbidden romance, she slowly loses control of her once orderly life. With a stellar cast including Boris Kodjoe, Brandon Gonzales, Cameron Mills, and Emayatzy Corinealdi, the film explores the consequences of indulging in desire and the price one must pay for seeking an escape. Produced by Paul Hall under Lionsgate, this English-language production runs for 1 hour and 45 minutes, captivating audiences with its tale of temptation, betrayal, and the ultimate search for redemption. Despite its average note of 5.4, "Addicted" managed to generate a staggering revenue of 215.7 million dollars, proving its allure to viewers worldwide. The budget for the movie was 297.0 million dollars. The tagline for the film is "Every Woman Needs an Escape."

title = Zombies of Mora Tau 
overview = American tycoon George Harrison, his beautiful wife, Mona, and deep-sea diver Jeff Clark are off the coast of Africa hoping to salvage a fortune in diamonds at the bottom of the sea near the voodoo-haunted island of Mora Tau, and are joined by an English girl named Jan. The treasure is reported to be guarded by Zombies, walking dead-men doomed to roam the earth until men stop trying to find the sacred treasure. Here, they are walking the sea-bottom, and there is a large conflict of interest between them and the treasure-seekers. 
date of release = the 1 of March 1957 
duration of the movie = 1h10 
production compagnie = Clover Productions 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 5.8 
budget = 135.7 millions of dollars 
Producer = Sam Katzman 
Director = Edward L. Cahn 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 1 of March 1957 

In the eerie and suspenseful movie "Zombies of Mora Tau," American tycoon George Harrison, his wife Mona, and diver Jeff Clark embark on a perilous journey off the coast of Africa to recover diamonds from the depths of the sea near the mysterious island of Mora Tau. Their quest is further complicated when they are joined by the English girl Jan, adding a new dynamic to their already tense expedition. As they delve deeper into the waters, they encounter the legendary Zombies, undead beings tasked with protecting the sacred treasure from intruders. Directed by Edward L. Cahn and produced by Sam Katzman under Clover Productions, this classic horror film was released on March 1, 1957, and runs for a thrilling 1 hour and 10 minutes. With a budget of a staggering 135.7 million dollars, the movie received an average rating of 5.8, captivating audiences with its chilling tale of greed, danger, and the supernatural. The production company behind this film is Clover Productions, and it was filmed in the United States of America.

title = TRON: Legacy 
overview = Sam Flynn, the tech-savvy and daring son of Kevin Flynn, investigates his father's disappearance and is pulled into The Grid. With the help of a mysterious program named Quorra, Sam quests to stop evil dictator Clu from crossing into the real world. 
tagline = The Game Has Changed. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = The Game Has Changed. 

title = TRON: Legacy 
overview = Sam Flynn, the tech-savvy and daring son of Kevin Flynn, investigates his father's disappearance and is pulled into The Grid. With the help of a mysterious program named Quorra, Sam quests to stop evil dictator Clu from crossing into the real world. 
tagline = The Game Has Changed. 

In "TRON: Legacy," viewers are taken on a thrilling journey alongside Sam Flynn, a tech-savvy young man determined to uncover the truth behind his father's mysterious disappearance. When Sam delves into The Grid, a digital realm created by his father, he teams up with the enigmatic program Quorra to thwart the plans of the malevolent dictator Clu. As they race against time to prevent Clu from infiltrating the real world, Sam must navigate a high-stakes game where the rules are constantly evolving. With the tagline "The Game Has Changed," this visually stunning and action-packed film immerses audiences in a futuristic world where danger lurks at every turn.

overview = Sam Flynn, the tech-savvy and daring son of Kevin Flynn, investigates his father's disappearance and is pulled into The Grid. With the help of a mysterious program named Quorra, Sam quests to stop evil dictator Clu from crossing into the real world. 
tagline = The Game Has Changed. 

In "TRON: Legacy," viewers are taken on a thrilling journey alongside Sam Flynn, a tech-savvy young man determined to uncover the truth behind his father's mysterious disappearance. When Sam delves into The Grid, a digital realm created by his father, he teams up with the enigmatic program Quorra to thwart the plans of the malevolent dictator Clu. As they race against time to prevent Clu from infiltrating the real world, Sam must navigate a high-stakes game where the rules are constantly evolving. With the tagline "The Game Has Changed," this visually stunning and action-packed film immerses audiences in a futuristic world where danger lurks at every turn.

title = The Mummy 
overview = An ancient Egyptian priest called Imhotep is revived when an archaeological expedition finds his mummy and one of the archaeologists accidentally reads an ancient life-giving spell. Imhotep, escaping from the field site, goes in search for the reincarnation of the soul of his lover. 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Boris Karloff, Zita Johann, David Manners, Arthur Byron 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the English-language film "The Mummy," the ancient Egyptian priest Imhotep is brought back to life after an archaeological team stumbles upon his mummy and inadvertently recites a powerful resurrection spell. Imhotep, now free from his tomb, embarks on a quest to find the reincarnation of his lost love. Starring Boris Karloff, Zita Johann, David Manners, and Arthur Byron, this classic movie weaves a tale of love, betrayal, and the supernatural. The movie was released in the year 1932.

title = Highway to Hell 
overview = Charlie and Rachel run away from home to get married in Las Vegas. But they get attacked by a zombie who takes Rachel with him to hell, where she will become one of Satan's brides 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h34 
cast = Patrick Bergin, Adam Storke, Chad Lowe, Kristy Swanson 
budget = 9.0 millions of dollars 
Producer = John Byers 
tagline = If there's one thing worse than dying and going to Hell, it's not dying - and going to Hell. 
average note = 6.1 
Director = Ate de Jong 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Hemdale Film Corporation 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In "Highway to Hell," Charlie and Rachel's elopement to Las Vegas takes a terrifying turn when they are ambushed by a zombie who drags Rachel to hell, where she faces the chilling fate of becoming one of Satan's brides. As they navigate through a nightmarish journey, the couple encounters unimaginable horrors and challenges in their quest to rescue Rachel from eternal damnation. With a stellar cast including Patrick Bergin, Adam Storke, Chad Lowe, and Kristy Swanson, this United States of America production, helmed by director Ate de Jong and produced by John Byers, unfolds over a gripping duration of 1 hour and 34 minutes. With a budget of 9.0 million dollars, this Hemdale Film Corporation creation delivers a spine-tingling tale that will keep viewers on the edge of their seats. The tagline "If there's one thing worse than dying and going to Hell, it's not dying - and going to Hell" sets the tone for this English-language film, which has garnered an average rating of 6.1.

The tagline "If there's one thing worse than dying and going to Hell, it's not dying - and going to Hell" sets the tone for this English-language film, which has garnered an average rating of 6.1.

As they navigate through a nightmarish journey, the couple encounters unimaginable horrors and challenges in their quest to rescue Rachel from eternal damnation. title = The Aristocats 
overview = When Madame Adelaide Bonfamille leaves her fortune to Duchess and her children -- Bonfamille's prize family of domesticated house cats -- the butler plots to steal the money and kidnaps the heirs, leaving them out on a country road. All seems lost until the wily Thomas O'Malley Cat and his jazz-playing alley cats come to the Aristocats's rescue. 
duration of the movie = 1h18 
production compagnie = Walt Disney Productions 
budget = 4.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
Producer = Winston Hibler 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 23 of December 1970 
average note = 7.1 
revenue = 55.7 millions of dollars 
Director = Wolfgang Reitherman 
cast = Phil Harris, Sterling Holloway, Scatman Crothers, Eva Gabor 
tagline = A tune-filled animated extravaganza. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h18 

In the heartwarming animated classic "The Aristocats," Madame Adelaide Bonfamille's fortune is left to her beloved family of domesticated house cats, Duchess and her kittens. However, their happiness is threatened when the conniving butler kidnaps them in a plot to steal the inheritance. Stranded in the countryside, all hope seems lost until the charming alley cat Thomas O'Malley and his musical feline friends come to their rescue. Directed by Wolfgang Reitherman and produced by Walt Disney Productions, this delightful tale unfolds in English, captivating audiences with its catchy tunes and lovable characters. With a runtime of 1 hour and 18 minutes, the film was released on December 23, 1970, in the United States of America. Featuring a stellar voice cast including Phil Harris, Sterling Holloway, Scatman Crothers, and Eva Gabor, "The Aristocats" received an average rating of 7.1 and grossed an impressive $55.7 million at the box office. The production company behind this animated extravaganza is Walt Disney Productions, with a budget of $4.0 million. The producer of the film is Winston Hibler. Don't miss this tune-filled animated extravaganza that will surely warm your heart.

title = Goddess 
overview = Elspeth Dickens dreams of finding her "voice" despite being stuck in an isolated farmhouse with her twin toddlers. A web-cam becomes her pathway to fame and fortune, but at a price. 
cast = Laura Michelle Kelly, Ronan Keating, Magda Szubanski, Dustin Clare 
Director = Mark Lamprell 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Laura Michelle Kelly, Ronan Keating, Magda Szubanski, Dustin Clare 

In the English language film "Goddess," directed by Mark Lamprell, Elspeth Dickens, portrayed by Laura Michelle Kelly, finds herself yearning to discover her true voice while confined to a remote farmhouse with her twin toddlers. Through the use of a webcam, she embarks on a journey towards fame and fortune, with the support of a cast including Ronan Keating, Magda Szubanski, and Dustin Clare. However, as Elspeth's online presence grows, she must navigate the challenges that come with newfound success, ultimately realizing that her aspirations come at a price. The movie features Laura Michelle Kelly, Ronan Keating, Magda Szubanski, and Dustin Clare in the cast.

Through the use of a webcam, she embarks on a journey towards fame and fortune, with the support of a cast including Ronan Keating, Magda Szubanski, and Dustin Clare. However, as Elspeth's online presence grows, she must navigate the challenges that come with newfound success, ultimately realizing that her aspirations come at a price. The movie features Laura Michelle Kelly, Ronan Keating, Magda Szubanski, and Dustin Clare in the cast.

title = New York Confidential 
overview = Story follows the rise and subsequent fall of the notorious head of a New York crime family, who decides to testify against his pals in order to avoid being killed by his fellow cohorts. 
budget = 66.2 millions of dollars 
revenue = 268.6 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 15 of February 1955 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Warner Bros. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 66.2 millions of dollars 

In "New York Confidential," a gripping tale unfolds as we witness the dramatic journey of the infamous leader of a New York crime syndicate. Faced with a life-threatening ultimatum from his own associates, he makes a daring choice to turn state's witness, setting off a chain of events that will forever alter the criminal underworld. Released on February 15, 1955, by Warner Bros., this English-language film delves into the dark underbelly of organized crime with a budget of $66.2 million, ultimately raking in an impressive $268.6 million at the box office.

title = The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy 
overview = Mere seconds before the Earth is to be demolished by an alien construction crew, Arthur Dent is swept off the planet by his friend Ford Prefect, a researcher penning a new edition of "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy." 
average note = 6.6 
duration of the movie = 1h49 
tagline = Don't leave Earth without it. 
date of release = the 15 of January 2005 
cast = Martin Freeman, Zooey Deschanel, Sam Rockwell, Yasiin Bey 
Director = Garth Jennings 
revenue = 104.5 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
Producer = Roger Birnbaum 
budget = 50.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.6 

In a race against time, "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy" follows the quirky journey of Arthur Dent and his friend Ford Prefect as they escape Earth's destruction by hitchhiking through space. With the help of a peculiar guidebook, they navigate through bizarre encounters and cosmic chaos. Starring Martin Freeman, Zooey Deschanel, Sam Rockwell, and Yasiin Bey, this sci-fi comedy, directed by Garth Jennings, promises an out-of-this-world adventure. Released on the 15th of January 2005, this film boasts a tagline that says it all: "Don't leave Earth without it." With an average note of 6.6, the movie runs for 1 hour and 49 minutes, captivating audiences with its humor and imagination. Produced by Roger Birnbaum, this United States of America production grossed an impressive $104.5 million, surpassing its $50 million budget.

title = Fracture 
overview = A husband is on trial for the attempted murder of his wife, in what is seemingly an open/shut case for the ambitious district attorney trying to put him away. However, there are surprises for both around every corner, and, as a suspenseful game of cat-and-mouse is played out, each must manipulate and outwit the other. 
duration of the movie = 1h53 
revenue = 91.4 millions of dollars 
Producer = Charles Weinstock 
budget = 60.3 millions of dollars 
production countrie = Germany 
Director = Gregory Hoblit 
tagline = I shot my wife... prove it. 
production compagnie = New Line Cinema 
cast = Anthony Hopkins, Ryan Gosling, David Strathairn, Rosamund Pike 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h53 

In the suspenseful thriller "Fracture," directed by Gregory Hoblit and produced by Charles Weinstock, a husband finds himself on trial for the attempted murder of his wife. What seems like an open-and-shut case for the ambitious district attorney becomes a twisted game of cat-and-mouse, filled with surprises at every turn. As the husband and the prosecutor, portrayed by Anthony Hopkins and Ryan Gosling respectively, manipulate and outwit each other, the tension escalates. With a runtime of 1 hour and 53 minutes, this German-produced film by New Line Cinema grossed an impressive $91.4 million at the box office, surpassing its $60.3 million budget. The tagline "I shot my wife... prove it" sets the tone for this gripping tale, also starring David Strathairn and Rosamund Pike.

The tagline "I shot my wife... prove it" sets the tone for this gripping tale, also starring David Strathairn and Rosamund Pike.

In the suspenseful thriller "Fracture," directed by Gregory Hoblit and produced by Charles Weinstock, a husband finds himself on trial for the attempted murder of his wife. What seems like an open-and-shut case for the ambitious district attorney becomes a twisted game of cat-and-mouse, filled with surprises at every turn. As the husband and the prosecutor, portrayed by Anthony Hopkins and Ryan Gosling respectively, manipulate and outwit each other, the tension escalates. title = The Man in the Iron Mask 
overview = Years have passed since the Three Musketeers, Aramis, Athos and Porthos, have fought together with their friend, D'Artagnan. But with the tyrannical King Louis using his power to wreak havoc in the kingdom while his twin brother, Philippe, remains imprisoned, the Musketeers reunite to abduct Louis and replace him with Philippe. 
average note = 6.3 
Producer = René Dupont 
budget = 274.6 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 2h12 
cast = Leonardo DiCaprio, Jeremy Irons, Gérard Depardieu, Gabriel Byrne 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
tagline = For the honor of a king. And the destiny of a country. All for one. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.3 

The Man in the Iron Mask is a tale of loyalty, betrayal, and royal intrigue that unfolds years after the Three Musketeers, Aramis, Athos, and Porthos, have fought together with their friend, D'Artagnan. With the tyrannical King Louis wreaking havoc in the kingdom and his twin brother, Philippe, imprisoned, the Musketeers reunite to abduct Louis and replace him with Philippe. The star-studded cast includes Leonardo DiCaprio, Jeremy Irons, Gérard Depardieu, and Gabriel Byrne. The English-language film, produced by René Dupont, takes viewers on a thrilling journey through the power struggles of the kingdom. The movie has an average note of 6.3 and a budget of 274.6 million dollars. It has a duration of 2 hours and 12 minutes and is set in the United Kingdom. The tagline of the film is "For the honor of a king. And the destiny of a country. All for one."

title = Another Stakeout 
overview = Chris and Bill are called upon for their excellent surveillance record to stakeout a lakeside home where a Mafia trial witness is believed to be heading or already hiding. Unlike their earlier _Stakeout_, this time they are accompanied by Gina Garret from the DA's office and her pet rottweiler 'Archie'; their cover, husband and wife with son Bill. 
Director = John Badham 
revenue = 160.5 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Touchstone Pictures 
average note = 4.9 
tagline = They're on the look out for thrills, action and adventure. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = John Badham 

In the action-packed movie "Another Stakeout," directed by John Badham, two skilled surveillance experts, Chris and Bill, are tasked with staking out a lakeside home in search of a Mafia trial witness. This time, they are joined by Gina Garret from the DA's office and her loyal pet rottweiler, Archie. Posing as a family with their "son" Bill, the team must maintain their cover while on the lookout for any signs of the witness. As they navigate through twists and turns, they uncover thrilling secrets and face unexpected challenges. With a tagline promising thrills, action, and adventure, "Another Stakeout" delivers suspense and excitement throughout. With Touchstone Pictures behind the production, this film grossed an impressive $160.5 million at the box office and received an average rating of 4.9.

This time, they are joined by Gina Garret from the DA's office and her loyal pet rottweiler, Archie. Posing as a family with their "son" Bill, the team must maintain their cover while on the lookout for any signs of the witness. As they navigate through twists and turns, they uncover thrilling secrets and face unexpected challenges. With a tagline promising thrills, action, and adventure, "Another Stakeout" delivers suspense and excitement throughout. With Touchstone Pictures behind the production, this film grossed an impressive $160.5 million at the box office and received an average rating of 4.9. 
 
 

 
title = Let's Make Love 
overview = When billionaire Jean-Marc Clement learns that he is to be satirized in an off-Broadway revue, he passes himself off as an actor playing him in order to get closer to the beautiful star of the show, Amanda Dell. 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = MARILYN MONROE and YVES MONTAND the French entertainment sensation! Doing what they do best in LET'S MAKE LOVE! 
Producer = Jerry Wald 
average note = 6.0 
revenue = 75.8 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h54 
date of release = the 7 of October 1960 
Director = George Cukor 
cast = Marilyn Monroe, Yves Montand, Tony Randall, Frankie Vaughan 
budget = 16.3 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the classic romantic comedy "Let's Make Love," billionaire Jean-Marc Clement discovers he is to be parodied in an off-Broadway show and decides to masquerade as an actor portraying himself to woo the show's leading lady, Amanda Dell. Directed by George Cukor and produced by Jerry Wald, the film features an all-star cast including Marilyn Monroe, Yves Montand, Tony Randall, and Frankie Vaughan. Set in the entertainment world, the movie showcases the talents of Monroe and Montand, with a tagline emphasizing their on-screen chemistry. Released on October 7, 1960, in the United States, the film received an average rating of 6.0 and grossed an impressive $75.8 million at the box office. With a runtime of 1 hour and 54 minutes, "Let's Make Love" is a delightful blend of humor, romance, and star power that continues to captivate audiences with its charm. The original language of the movie is English, and the budget for the film was $16.3 million.

title = Hellraiser 
overview = Larry and his wife, Julia move into an old house and discover a hideous creature - the man's half-brother, who is also the woman's former lover - hiding upstairs. Having lost his earthly body to a trio of S&amp;M demons, the Cenobites, Frank, is brought back into existence by a drop of blood on the floor. He soon forces his former mistress to bring him his necessary human sacrifices to complete his body... but the Cenobites won't be happy about this. 
date of release = the 11 of September 1987 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
revenue = 14.6 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Andrew Robinson, Clare Higgins, Ashley Laurence, Sean Chapman 
duration of the movie = 1h34 
Producer = Christopher Figg 
Director = Clive Barker 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 11 of September 1987 

In the 1987 British horror film "Hellraiser," directed by Clive Barker and produced by Christopher Figg, a chilling tale unfolds as Larry and Julia move into an old house and unwittingly unleash a terrifying force. When Julia's former lover, Frank, reemerges in a grotesque form after encountering S&M demons known as the Cenobites, a series of gruesome events is set into motion. As Frank manipulates Julia into providing him with human sacrifices to restore his body, a deadly game ensues with the Cenobites, who are not pleased with his actions. Starring Andrew Robinson, Clare Higgins, Ashley Laurence, and Sean Chapman, this 1 hour and 34-minute film delves into a world of horror and obsession, ultimately grossing $14.6 million at the box office.

The movie was released on the 11th of September 1987 in the United Kingdom and is spoken in English.

In the thrilling movie "Tower of Evil," a team of skilled archaeologists embarks on a quest to uncover an ancient and enigmatic Phoenician treasure. However, their expedition takes a dark turn when they become ensnared in a web of perplexing murders. Led by Director Jim O'Connolly, the film features a talented cast including Bryant Haliday, Jill Haworth, Anna Palk, and William Lucas. title = Damien: Omen II 
overview = Since the sudden and highly suspicious death of his parents, 12-year-old Damien has been in the charge of his wealthy aunt and uncle (Lee Grant and William Holden). Widely feared to be the Antichrist, Damien relentlessly plots to seize control of his uncle's business empire - and the world. Meanwhile, anyone attempting to unravel the secrets of Damien's sinister past or fiendish future meets with a swift and cruel demise.

As those who dig into Damien's dark past or ominous future meet grim fates, a sense of dread looms over all. With a revenue of 26.5 million dollars and an average rating of 6.1, "Damien: Omen II" delves deeper into the sinister forces at play.

title = The Slipper and the Rose 
overview = In the tiny kingdom of Euphrania, the King and his court are most anxious to get Prince Edward wed. But Edward wants to marry for love. Meanwhile, young Cinderella finds life drastically altered with her father's death as she's forced to be a servant in her own house. But a cheery fairy godmother helps her with her impossible tasks, and even gets her to take an evening out at the King's bride-fin 
Director = Bryan Forbes 
cast = Gemma Craven, Margaret Lockwood, Michael Hordern, Edith Evans 
budget = 54.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Bryan Forbes 

In the enchanting kingdom of Euphrania, "The Slipper and the Rose" tells the tale of Prince Edward, who is under pressure from the King and his court to find a suitable bride. However, Edward is determined to marry for love, setting the stage for a romantic and heartwarming story. As young Cinderella faces hardships after her father's passing, a kind fairy godmother comes to her aid, transforming her life and granting her the opportunity to attend a royal event. Directed by Bryan Forbes, this lavish production features a talented cast including Gemma Craven, Margaret Lockwood, Michael Hordern, and Edith Evans. With a budget of 54.0 million dollars, this magical retelling of a classic fairy tale is sure to captivate audiences of all ages.

title = Cocktail 
overview = A talented New York bartender takes a job at a bar in Jamaica and falls in love. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : Producer = Ted Field 

In "Cocktail," a talented New York bartender named Brian Flanagan decides to switch up his scenery and takes a job at a lively bar in Jamaica. As he mixes drinks and entertains the patrons, he unexpectedly falls head over heels in love with Jordan Mooney, a vacationing artist. Amidst the tropical setting and the pulsating beats of the Caribbean, Brian navigates the highs and lows of romance while perfecting his craft behind the bar. Will love be the perfect cocktail for him, or will it leave a bitter aftertaste?

title = H6: Diary of a Serial Killer 
overview = H6 tells the story of Antonio Frau, a serial killer set free after serving 25 years in jail for the violent murder of his girlfriend. After inheriting and old motel from a relative he never knew, he sees this as a signal and takes to his holy task of relieving the grief of those who have lost the will to live. He takes his victims to room Number 6 in the motel where he 'purifies' them, while, at the same time, continues his everyday life next to his wife. A mistake leads to his arrest, and his plan to become rich and famous takes relevance. 
production compagnie = Kanzaman 
cast = Fernando Acaso, María José Bausá, Raquel Arenas, Xènia Reguant 
revenue = 276.4 millions of dollars 
tagline = Come in, don't be afraid... 
budget = 8.1 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = Spanish 
duration of the movie = 1h32 
Director = Martín Garrido 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Kanzaman 

In "H6: Diary of a Serial Killer," directed by Martín Garrido, we are introduced to Antonio Frau, a serial killer who is released after 25 years in prison for the brutal murder of his girlfriend. Upon inheriting an old motel from a relative he never knew, he sees it as a sign to continue his gruesome mission of "purifying" those who have lost the will to live in room Number 6. Despite carrying out these heinous acts, he maintains a facade of normalcy with his unsuspecting wife by his side. However, a mistake leads to his capture, prompting his twisted desire for wealth and fame to come to the forefront. With a chilling tagline inviting you to "Come in, don't be afraid...," this Spanish-language film produced by Kanzaman delves into the dark and disturbing mind of a killer. Starring Fernando Acaso, María José Bausá, Raquel Arenas, and Xènia Reguant, the movie garnered a revenue of 276.4 million dollars against a budget of 8.1 million dollars, running for a duration of 1 hour and 32 minutes.

With a budget of 1.4 million dollars, Batman must use all his skills and gadgets to save the day in this high-stakes battle against evil.

title = Goal!: The Dream Begins 
overview = Like millions of kids around the world, Santiago harbors the dream of being a professional footballer...However, living in the Barrios section of Los Angeles, he thinks it is only that--a dream. Until one day an extraordinary turn of events has him trying out for Premiership club Newcastle United. 
budget = 30.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 6 of June 2005 
production compagnie = Touchstone Pictures 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
average note = 6.6 
revenue = 27.6 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h58 
Director = Danny Cannon 
Producer = Mark Huffam 
tagline = Every Dream Has A Beginning 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 30.0 millions of dollars 

In "Goal!: The Dream Begins", Santiago, a young boy from the Barrios section of Los Angeles, shares the universal dream of becoming a professional footballer. Despite his humble beginnings, Santiago's life takes an unexpected turn when he gets the opportunity to try out for the prestigious Premiership club, Newcastle United. Directed by Danny Cannon and produced by Mark Huffam, this sports drama, released on June 6, 2005, under the Touchstone Pictures production company in the United Kingdom, follows Santiago's journey as he navigates the challenges of pursuing his passion for football. With a budget of $30 million, the film received an average rating of 6.6 and grossed $27.6 million in revenue. Lasting 1 hour and 58 minutes, "Goal!: The Dream Begins" reminds us that every dream has a beginning.

title = Heartless 
overview = The story follows Jamie, a troubled young man with a birthmark on his face, which has left him feeling isolated and fearful, hiding from the world outside. He lives in the East End of London, an area notorious for its violent hooded gangs. According to news reports, the gangs are now wearing demon masks. But, one night, Jamie discovers the terrifying truth. 
revenue = 179.9 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h54 
average note = 6.2 
production compagnie = Matador Pictures 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Jim Sturgess, Noel Clarke, Eddie Marsan, Luke Treadaway 
Producer = Pippa Cross 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
Director = Philip Ridley 
date of release = the 21 of November 2009 
tagline = The darker it gets the more you see 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 179.9 millions of dollars 

In the dark and gritty streets of the East End of London, "Heartless" unfolds the haunting tale of Jamie, a young man plagued by a birthmark that sets him apart from society. Feeling isolated and fearful, Jamie navigates a world filled with violent hooded gangs, now rumored to be donning demon masks. As Jamie delves deeper into the shadows of his reality, he uncovers a terrifying truth that changes everything. Directed by Philip Ridley and produced by Matador Pictures, this English-language film features a stellar cast including Jim Sturgess, Noel Clarke, Eddie Marsan, and Luke Treadaway. With a tagline that echoes the film's ominous tone - "The darker it gets the more you see" - "Heartless" captivates audiences with its gripping narrative. Released on the 21st of November 2009, the movie garnered an impressive revenue of 179.9 million dollars and an average rating of 6.2. The duration of the movie is 1 hour and 54 minutes. The production company behind "Heartless" is Matador Pictures, and it was produced by Pippa Cross. The original language of the movie is English, and it was filmed in the United Kingdom.

['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h54
