title = The Stepfather 
overview = Michael Harding (Penn Badgley) returns home from military school to find his mother (Sela Ward) happily in love and living with her new boyfriend, David (Dylan Walsh). As the two men get to know each other, Michael becomes more and more suspicious of the man who is always there with a helpful hand. Is he really the man of her dreams or could David be hiding a dark side? 
tagline = Daddy's home. 
date of release = the 16 of October 2009 
cast = Dylan Walsh, Sela Ward, Penn Badgley, Amber Heard 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Daddy's home. 

In the chilling thriller "The Stepfather," Michael Harding (Penn Badgley) comes back from military school to discover his mother (Sela Ward) has found love with her new boyfriend, David (Dylan Walsh). As Michael and David bond, Michael's unease grows as he suspects David may not be the perfect partner he appears to be. With a tagline that ominously declares "Daddy's home," this suspenseful film keeps audiences on the edge of their seats. Released on October 16, 2009, the movie features a talented cast including Amber Heard alongside the main stars Dylan Walsh, Sela Ward, and Penn Badgley.

In the chilling thriller "The Stepfather," Michael Harding (Penn Badgley) comes back from military school to discover his mother (Sela Ward) has found love with her new boyfriend, David (Dylan Walsh). As Michael and David bond, Michael's unease grows as he suspects David may not be the perfect partner he appears to be. With a tagline that ominously declares "Daddy's home," this suspenseful film keeps audiences on the edge of their seats. Released on October 16, 2009, the movie features a talented cast including Amber Heard alongside the main stars Dylan Walsh, Sela Ward, and Penn Badgley.

title = A Nightmare on Elm Street 4: The Dream Master 
overview = Dream demon Freddy Krueger is resurrected from his apparent demise, and rapidly tracks down and kills the remainder of the Elm Street kids. However, Kristen, who can draw others into her dreams, wills her special ability to her friend Alice. Alice soon realizes that Freddy is taking advantage of that unknown power to pull a new group of children into his foul domain. 
duration of the movie = 1h39 
cast = Robert Englund, Tuesday Knight, Ken Sagoes, Rodney Eastman 
tagline = Terror beyond your wildest dreams. 
budget = 7.0 millions of dollars 
Director = Renny Harlin 
date of release = the 19 of August 1988 
revenue = 72.5 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
Producer = Robert Shaye 
production compagnie = New Line Cinema 
average note = 5.8 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h39 

In "A Nightmare on Elm Street 4: The Dream Master," dream demon Freddy Krueger returns from the dead to continue his reign of terror on the Elm Street kids. Kristen, who has the ability to bring others into her dreams, passes on her power to her friend Alice. As Alice discovers Freddy's manipulation of this newfound ability, she must fight to save a new group of children from falling victim to his evil schemes. Directed by Renny Harlin and starring Robert Englund, Tuesday Knight, Ken Sagoes, and Rodney Eastman, this horror film promises terror beyond your wildest dreams. With a budget of 7.0 million dollars, the movie was released on the 19th of August 1988 in the United States of America by New Line Cinema. Despite receiving an average rating of 5.8, it managed to gross 72.5 million dollars at the box office. The duration of the movie is 1h39. The tagline for the film is "Terror beyond your wildest dreams." The producer of the movie is Robert Shaye.

title = The Brothers Solomon 
overview = A pair of well-meaning, but socially inept brothers try to find their perfect mates in order to provide their dying father with a grandchild. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : revenue = 266.8 millions of dollars 

In "The Brothers Solomon," we follow the hilarious journey of two socially awkward brothers, John and Dean Solomon, who embark on a mission to find the perfect partners to fulfill their father's dying wish for a grandchild. John and Dean, well-meaning but lacking in social skills, are determined to provide their father with a grandchild before it's too late. As they navigate the unpredictable world of dating and relationships, the brothers find themselves in a series of comedic misadventures. Along the way, they learn valuable lessons about love, family, and the true meaning of happiness. Will John and Dean be able to overcome their ineptitude and find the love they seek, all while honoring their father's last wish?

title = Brighton Rock 
overview = Centring on the activities of a gang of assorted criminals and, in particular, their leader – a vicious young hoodlum known as "Pinkie" – the film's main thematic concern is the criminal underbelly evident in inter-war Brighton. 
cast = Richard Attenborough, Carol Marsh, Hermione Baddeley, William Hartnell 
date of release = the 12 of December 1947 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = John Boulting 
production countrie = United Kingdom 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Richard Attenborough, Carol Marsh, Hermione Baddeley, William Hartnell 

In the 1947 British film "Brighton Rock," directed by John Boulting, viewers are immersed in the criminal underbelly of inter-war Brighton. The story follows a gang of criminals led by the ruthless "Pinkie," portrayed by Richard Attenborough. As the gang navigates the seedy underworld of Brighton, tensions rise and loyalties are tested. The stellar cast includes Richard Attenborough, Carol Marsh, Hermione Baddeley, and William Hartnell. Released on the 12th of December 1947, this gripping tale unfolds in its original English language, capturing the dark and dangerous atmosphere of the era in the United Kingdom.

['correct']

In the 1947 British film "Brighton Rock," directed by John Boulting, viewers are immersed in the criminal underbelly of inter-war Brighton. The story follows a gang of criminals led by the ruthless "Pinkie," portrayed by Richard Attenborough. As the gang navigates the seedy underworld of Brighton, tensions rise and loyalties are tested. The stellar cast includes Richard Attenborough, Carol Marsh, Hermione Baddeley, and William Hartnell. Released on the 12th of December 1947, this gripping tale unfolds in its original English language, capturing the dark and dangerous atmosphere of the era in the United Kingdom.

title = She Gods of Shark Reef 
overview = Two brothers, one wanted for murder, are shipwrecked on an island inhabited by nubile young women who have amassed a valuable cache of pearls. 
Director = Roger Corman 
average note = 3.0 
production compagnie = American International Pictures (AIP) 
tagline = Beautiful maidens in a Lush Tropical Paradise ruled by a Hideous Stone God! 
budget = 202.8 millions of dollars 
Producer = Ludwig H. Gerber 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 1 of August 1958 
duration of the movie = 1h03 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Roger Corman 

In "She Gods of Shark Reef," directed by Roger Corman and produced by Ludwig H. Gerber, two brothers find themselves in a perilous situation after being shipwrecked on an island inhabited by alluring young women. One of the brothers is wanted for murder, adding tension to their already precarious circumstances. As they navigate the island, they discover that the women have a secret stash of valuable pearls. Set in a lush tropical paradise, the film explores themes of beauty and danger, with the women being ruled by a hideous stone god. With a budget of 202.8 million dollars, this American International Pictures (AIP) production showcases the stunning visuals and captivating storyline. Released on the 1st of August 1958, the movie runs for 1 hour and 3 minutes in its original English language. The average note for this film is 3.0, making it a unique and intriguing watch for fans of adventure and mystery. The tagline for the movie is "Beautiful maidens in a Lush Tropical Paradise ruled by a Hideous Stone God!"

title = Hope Springs 
overview = After thirty years of marriage, a middle-aged couple attends an intense, week-long counseling session to work on their relationship. 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures 
budget = 30.0 millions of dollars 
revenue = 114.3 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h40 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 7 of August 2012 
tagline = Sometimes to keep the magic, you need to learn a few tricks. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Columbia Pictures 

In "Hope Springs," produced by Columbia Pictures, a middle-aged couple embarks on a transformative journey to save their thirty-year marriage. The couple attends an intense, week-long counseling session to work on their relationship, delving deep into their past and emotions to reignite the spark. With a budget of 30.0 million dollars, the film grossed an impressive 114.3 million dollars at the box office. The 1 hour and 40-minute movie, released on August 7, 2012, in English, delivers a poignant message encapsulated in its tagline: "Sometimes to keep the magic, you need to learn a few tricks."

title = Popcorn 
overview = A horror film festival, held in a theater which was once the scene of a tragic fire, turns into a real life horror show. 
date of release = the 1 of February 1991 
production compagnie = Transatlantic Pictures 
duration of the movie = 1h31 
tagline = Buy a bag... Go home in a box. 
cast = Jill Schoelen, Dee Wallace, Kelly Jo Minter, Karen Lorre 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 1 of February 1991 

In "Popcorn," a horror film festival takes a terrifying turn when the event is held in a theater with a dark history of a tragic fire. As the festival unfolds, the attendees soon find themselves trapped in a real-life horror show. Released on the 1st of February 1991 by Transatlantic Pictures, this 1 hour and 31-minute film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. The tagline "Buy a bag... Go home in a box" sets the tone for the chilling events that unfold. Starring Jill Schoelen, Dee Wallace, Kelly Jo Minter, and Karen Lorre, "Popcorn" delivers a spine-tingling experience that will leave audiences gasping for more.

title = Thank You 
overview = The film is about three husbands having affairs outside their marriage. One of their wives hires a detective named Kishen and finds out that their husbands are cheating. Their wives find out when Kishen scares them by blind folding them and when they tell their girlfriends list, Sanjana gets hurt and leaves and tries to commit suicide but Kishen helps her. 
date of release = the 8 of April 2011 
production compagnie = UTV Motion Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 8 of April 2011 

In "Thank You," released on the 8th of April 2011 by UTV Motion Pictures, the storyline revolves around three husbands entangled in extramarital affairs. When one of their wives enlists the help of detective Kishen, the truth about their infidelities is unveiled. Through a series of events, including a dramatic blindfolding encounter orchestrated by Kishen, the wives confront their cheating spouses. Amidst the chaos, a girlfriend named Sanjana is deeply affected and attempts to take her own life, only to find unexpected support from Kishen.

title = Transporter 2 
overview = Professional driver Frank Martin is living in Miami, where he is temporarily filling in for a friend as the chauffeur for a government narcotics control policymaker and his family. The young boy in the family is targeted for kidnapping, and Frank immediately becomes involved in protecting the child and exposing the kidnappers.

Director = Louis Leterrier 
production compagnie = Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation 
tagline = The Best In The Business Is Back In The Game. 
budget = 32.0 millions of dollars 
cast = Jason Statham, Amber Valletta, Kate Nauta, Alessandro Gassman 
average note = 6.2 
duration of the movie = 1h27 
production countrie = France 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 2 of August 2005 

In "Transporter 2," directed by Louis Leterrier and released on the 2nd of August 2005 by Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation, we follow professional driver Frank Martin, portrayed by Jason Statham. Frank finds himself in Miami, temporarily working as a chauffeur for a government narcotics control policymaker and his family. When the young boy in the family becomes the target of a kidnapping plot, Frank must step in to protect him and expose the kidnappers. With a budget of 32.0 million dollars, the movie promises high-octane action and suspense as Frank races against time to save the child. Co-starring Amber Valletta, Kate Nauta, and Alessandro Gassman, "Transporter 2" is a thrilling ride that showcases why Frank Martin is known as the best in the business. The tagline "The Best In The Business Is Back In The Game" perfectly captures the essence of this adrenaline-pumping film.

Facts included in the description:

- Production company: Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation
- Tagline: The Best In The Business Is Back In The Game
- Budget: 32.0 million dollars
- Cast: Jason Statham, Amber Valletta, Kate Nauta, Alessandro Gassman

title = In the Bedroom 
overview = Summertime on the coast of Maine, "In the Bedroom" centers on the inner dynamics of a family in transition. Matt Fowler is a doctor practicing in his native Maine and is married to New York born Ruth Fowler, a music teacher. He is involved in a love affair with a local single mother. As the beauty of Maine's brief and fleeting summer comes to an end, these characters find themselves in the midst of unimaginable tragedy. 
budget = 1.7 millions of dollars 
revenue = 243.0 millions of dollars 
tagline = A young man. An older woman. Her ex-husband. Things are about to explode... 
production compagnie = Miramax Films 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 23 of November 2001 
Director = Todd Field 
Producer = Ross Katz 
cast = Tom Wilkinson, Sissy Spacek, Nick Stahl, Marisa Tomei 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 1.7 millions of dollars 

The description is complete with all the provided facts included. Here is the final description:

"In the Bedroom" is a gripping drama set against the picturesque backdrop of the Maine coast. Dr. Matt Fowler, a local physician, and his wife Ruth, a music teacher, navigate a tumultuous period in their lives. Matt finds himself entangled in a forbidden romance with a single mother, leading to a series of events that culminate in a tragic turn of events. As the fleeting summer in Maine draws to a close, the characters are faced with heart-wrenching decisions that will change their lives forever. Directed by Todd Field and produced by Ross Katz, the film features a stellar cast including Tom Wilkinson, Sissy Spacek, Nick Stahl, and Marisa Tomei. With a budget of 1.7 million dollars, "In the Bedroom" went on to gross an impressive 243 million dollars at the box office upon its release on November 23, 2001, under the Miramax Films production company. The tagline "A young man. An older woman. Her ex-husband. Things are about to explode..." sets the tone for the explosive emotional journey that unfolds on screen.

title = X-Men: Apocalypse 
overview = After the re-emergence of the world's first mutant, world-destroyer Apocalypse, the X-Men must unite to defeat his extinction level plan. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : production compagnie = Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation 

In "X-Men: Apocalypse," the world is faced with a catastrophic threat as the world's first mutant, Apocalypse, resurfaces with a plan to bring about extinction. The X-Men, a group of powerful mutants with extraordinary abilities, must come together and unite forces to stop Apocalypse and prevent his world-destroying agenda from becoming a reality. As the fate of humanity hangs in the balance, the X-Men must confront their greatest challenge yet and fight for the survival of all mankind. 

Facts included in the description:
1. Title: X-Men: Apocalypse
2. Overview: After the re-emergence of the world's first mutant, world-destroyer Apocalypse, the X-Men must unite to defeat his extinction level plan.

title = The Mark of Cain 
overview = After a bomb kills their company commander in Iraq, British soldiers Treacle and Shane are ordered to round up suspects and use torture on the detainees. Back home, the press gets the story and the pair achieves instant infamy. 
budget = 148.6 millions of dollars 
Producer = Lynn Horsford 
cast = Gerard Kearns, Matthew McNulty, Elliot Cowan, Brendan Coyle 
production compagnie = Channel 4 Television Corporation 
revenue = 247.5 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h27 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
date of release = the 25 of November 2008 
Director = Marc Munden 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 148.6 millions of dollars 

In "The Mark of Cain," directed by Marc Munden, British soldiers Treacle and Shane find themselves in a moral dilemma after a bomb kills their company commander in Iraq. Ordered to round up suspects and resort to torture, their actions lead to instant infamy when the press catches wind of their controversial methods. Starring Gerard Kearns, Matthew McNulty, Elliot Cowan, and Brendan Coyle, this gripping film produced by Lynn Horsford under Channel 4 Television Corporation explores the consequences of war and the choices made in its aftermath. With a budget of 148.6 million dollars and a revenue of 247.5 million dollars, this 1 hour and 27-minute movie in English was released on November 25, 2008, in the United Kingdom.

title = Once Before I Die 
overview = Stranded behind enemy lines when the Japanese attack the Philippines in late 1941, Lt. Bailey must lead a group of soldiers and their families (including Bailey's curvaceous fiancée Alex) to safety and the streets of Manila. During the perilous trek Alex befriends a virginal young soldier whose only desire is to have sex once before he dies. 
date of release = the 1 of December 1966 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 1 of December 1966 

In the gripping war drama "Once Before I Die," set during the Japanese attack on the Philippines in late 1941, Lt. Bailey finds himself in a dire situation as he leads a group of soldiers and their families, including his alluring fiancée Alex, to safety through the streets of Manila. Amidst the chaos and danger, a unique bond forms between Alex and a young soldier who harbors a singular wish - to experience intimacy before facing death. Released on the 1st of December 1966, this film captures the raw emotions and sacrifices made during wartime, highlighting the resilience and humanity that shines through even in the darkest of times.

title = The Day the Earth Stood Still 
overview = A representative of an alien race that went through drastic evolution to survive its own climate change, Klaatu comes to Earth to assess whether humanity can prevent the environmental damage they have inflicted on their own planet. When barred from speaking to the United Nations, he decides humankind shall be exterminated so the planet can survive. 
Director = Scott Derrickson 
budget = 80.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation 
cast = Keanu Reeves, Jennifer Connelly, Kathy Bates, Jaden Smith 
date of release = the 10 of December 2008 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Scott Derrickson 

In "The Day the Earth Stood Still," directed by Scott Derrickson and released on the 10th of December 2008 by Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation, a pivotal moment in human history unfolds. Klaatu, a representative of an advanced alien race, arrives on Earth with a critical mission. Witnessing the devastating effects of climate change caused by humanity, Klaatu must determine if humans are capable of saving their planet from irreversible damage. When his attempts to address the United Nations are thwarted, Klaatu makes a fateful decision - humanity must be eradicated to ensure the survival of Earth. Starring Keanu Reeves, Jennifer Connelly, Kathy Bates, and Jaden Smith, this thought-provoking sci-fi film with an $80 million budget delves into themes of environmental responsibility, evolution, and the consequences of our actions.

Klaatu, a representative of an advanced alien race, arrives on Earth with a critical mission. Witnessing the devastating effects of climate change caused by humanity, Klaatu must determine if humans are capable of saving their planet from irreversible damage. When his attempts to address the United Nations are thwarted, Klaatu makes a fateful decision - humanity must be eradicated to ensure the survival of Earth. Starring Keanu Reeves, Jennifer Connelly, Kathy Bates, and Jaden Smith, this thought-provoking sci-fi film with an $80 million budget delves into themes of environmental responsibility, evolution, and the consequences of our actions.

overview = A carny builds a gambling empire at the expense of his family's wellbeing.

duration of the movie = 1h29 
average note = 5.8

cast = Spencer Tracy, Claire Trevor, Scotty Beckett, Henry B. Walthall 
budget = 244.3 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = The Poet's Conception of Hell 

In "Dante's Inferno," directed by Harry Lachman, a carny played by Spencer Tracy, builds a gambling empire in the United States of America, leading to the detriment of his family's wellbeing. As he delves deeper into the world of gambling, he faces moral dilemmas and ethical challenges that threaten to consume him. With a budget of 244.3 million dollars, this intense drama unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 29 minutes, captivating audiences with its exploration of greed, power, and the consequences of one man's choices. Featuring a stellar cast including Claire Trevor, Scotty Beckett, and Henry B. Walthall, "Dante's Inferno" presents a modern interpretation of The Poet's Conception of Hell, earning an average rating of 5.8.

title = Mean Dreams 
overview = When two youngsters meet and fall for each other, they must go on the run from the girl's corrupt father, who is also the sheriff of the town. 
budget = 4.4 millions of dollars 
revenue = 181.2 millions of dollars 
cast = Sophie Nélisse, Josh Wiggins, Colm Feore, Bill Paxton 
average note = 6.5 
duration of the movie = 1h48 
production countrie = Canada 
Producer = William Woods 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Nathan Morlando 
date of release = the 21 of October 2016 
tagline = The law won't protect you 
production compagnie = Woods Entertainment 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 4.4 millions of dollars 

In the thrilling movie "Mean Dreams," directed by Nathan Morlando and produced by William Woods, two young individuals, played by Sophie Nélisse and Josh Wiggins, find love amidst danger. As they fall for each other, they are forced to flee from the girl's corrupt father, who happens to be the town's sheriff, portrayed by Bill Paxton. With a budget of 4.4 million dollars, this Canadian production by Woods Entertainment, released on the 21st of October 2016, captivated audiences worldwide, grossing an impressive 181.2 million dollars. The film, with an average rating of 6.5, runs for 1 hour and 48 minutes and is filled with suspense, showcasing the talents of its cast including Colm Feore. As the tagline suggests, in "Mean Dreams," the law won't protect you, leaving viewers on the edge of their seats until the very end.

title = The Poseidon Adventure 
overview = The Poseidon Adventure was one of the first Catastrophe films and began the Disaster Film genre. Director Neame tells the story of a group of people that must fight for their lives aboard a sinking ship. Based on the novel by Paul Gallico. 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 84.6 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h57 
date of release = the 1 of December 1972 
average note = 7.3 
Director = Ronald Neame 
production compagnie = Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "The Poseidon Adventure," directed by Ronald Neame, a group of individuals find themselves in a fight for survival aboard a sinking ship. This groundbreaking Catastrophe film, based on the novel by Paul Gallico, kickstarted the Disaster Film genre. Released on December 1, 1972, by Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation in the United States of America, the movie, with a runtime of 1 hour and 57 minutes, grossed an impressive $84.6 million. With an average rating of 7.3, this English-language film remains a classic in the realm of disaster movies.

['correct']
fact : revenue = 84.6 millions of dollars

In "The Poseidon Adventure," directed by Ronald Neame, a group of individuals find themselves in a fight for survival aboard a sinking ship. This groundbreaking Catastrophe film, based on the novel by Paul Gallico, kickstarted the Disaster Film genre. Released on December 1, 1972, by Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation in the United States of America, the movie, with a runtime of 1 hour and 57 minutes, grossed an impressive $84.6 million. With an average rating of 7.3, this English-language film remains a classic in the realm of disaster movies.

title = Mandroid 
overview = In his hidden laboratory deep in Russia, Dr. Karl Zimmer has invented the Mandroid, a humanoid robot which follows the motions of a man in a special control suit. He has offered the invention to the USA, who have sent Smith and Wait from the CIA for inspection. However Zimmer's partner Drago has different plans, wants to sell Mandroid to the military. The night he tries to steal Mandroid, he becomes exposed to the highly toxic Superconn. But he can flee and won't give up on Mandroid, even though he's terribly disfigured. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : tagline = It's Power is in Your Hands! 

In the thrilling sci-fi film "Mandroid," Dr. Karl Zimmer, a brilliant scientist based in Russia, creates a groundbreaking invention known as the Mandroid. This humanoid robot mimics the movements of a person wearing a special control suit. When the CIA sends agents Smith and Wait to inspect the Mandroid, Zimmer's partner Drago has sinister intentions to sell the advanced technology to the military. A dramatic turn of events occurs when Drago is exposed to the toxic Superconn while attempting to steal the Mandroid. Despite being disfigured, Drago remains determined to possess the Mandroid at any cost. Will the CIA agents be able to stop Drago's dangerous plans and secure the futuristic robot?

Facts included in the description:
1. Dr. Karl Zimmer invents the Mandroid in his hidden laboratory in Russia.
2. The Mandroid mimics the motions of a person in a special control suit.
3. The CIA sends agents Smith and Wait to inspect the Mandroid.
4. Dr. Zimmer's partner, Drago, wants to sell the Mandroid to the military.
5. Drago becomes exposed to the highly toxic Superconn while trying to steal the Mandroid.
6. Drago is terribly disfigured but remains determined to possess the Mandroid.

title = The Lion King 2: Simba's Pride 
overview = The circle of life continues for Simba, now fully grown and in his rightful place as the king of Pride Rock. Simba and Nala have given birth to a daughter, Kiara who's as rebellious as her father was. But Kiara drives her parents to distraction when she catches the eye of Kovu, the son of the evil lioness, Zira. Will Kovu steal Kiara's heart? 
production compagnie = Walt Disney Pictures 
tagline = The Circle of Life Continues... 
cast = Matthew Broderick, Moira Kelly, Neve Campbell, Liz Callaway 
Director = Darrell Rooney 
Producer = Jeannine Roussel 
duration of the movie = 1h21 
production countrie = Australia 
revenue = 213.1 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Walt Disney Pictures 

In "The Lion King 2: Simba's Pride," the circle of life continues as Simba takes his place as the rightful king of Pride Rock. Alongside Nala, they welcome their rebellious daughter Kiara into the world. When Kiara's path crosses with Kovu, the son of the villainous lioness Zira, tensions rise as their love blossoms. Directed by Darrell Rooney and produced by Jeannine Roussel, this Walt Disney Pictures production from Australia explores themes of love, family, and destiny. Starring Matthew Broderick, Moira Kelly, Neve Campbell, and Liz Callaway, this 1 hour and 21-minute film grossed an impressive $213.1 million at the box office. As the tagline suggests, "The Circle of Life Continues..."

The production company behind this film is Walt Disney Pictures.

title = Kwaidan 
overview = This is the film adaptation of four stories from the book "Kwaidan: Stories and studies of strange things" by Lafcadio Hearn and is actually a collection of Japanese ghost stories, taken from various sources, some even stemming from China. 
revenue = 13.2 millions of dollars 
production countrie = Japan 
date of release = the 29 of December 1964 
duration of the movie = 3h03 
cast = Michiyo Aratama, Misako Watanabe, Rentarô Mikuni, Kenjiro Ishiyama 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 13.2 millions of dollars 

The description is complete with all the facts included. Here is the final description:

In the eerie and captivating film "Kwaidan," based on the chilling tales from the book by Lafcadio Hearn, viewers are transported into a world of Japanese ghost stories with origins that reach as far as China. Released on the 29th of December 1964 in Japan, this cinematic masterpiece weaves together four haunting narratives, each more spine-tingling than the last. With a runtime of 3 hours and 3 minutes, audiences are taken on a mesmerizing journey through the supernatural. The stellar cast, including Michiyo Aratama, Misako Watanabe, Rentarô Mikuni, and Kenjiro Ishiyama, brings these ghostly tales to life in a way that garnered an impressive revenue of 13.2 million dollars. "Kwaidan" is a must-watch for those who dare to delve into the realm of the unknown and embrace the shivers that come with it. 
 
 
FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : production countrie = Japan 

The description is complete with all the facts included. Here is the final description:

In the eerie and captivating film "Kwaidan," based on the chilling tales from the book by Lafcadio Hearn, viewers are transported into a world of Japanese ghost stories with origins that reach as far as China. Released on the 29th of December 1964 in Japan, this cinematic masterpiece weaves together four haunting narratives, each more spine-tingling than the last. With a runtime of 3 hours and 3 minutes, audiences are taken on a mesmerizing journey through the supernatural. The stellar cast, including Michiyo Aratama, Misako Watanabe, Rentarô Mikuni, and Kenjiro Ishiyama, brings these ghostly tales to life in a way that garnered an impressive revenue of 13.2 million dollars. "Kwaidan" is a must-watch for those who dare to delve into the realm of the unknown and embrace the shivers that come with it. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 29 of December 1964 

The description is complete with all the facts included. Here is the final description:

In the eerie and captivating film "Kwaidan," based on the chilling tales from the book by Lafcadio Hearn, viewers are transported into a world of Japanese ghost stories with origins that reach as far as China. Released on the 29th of December 1964 in Japan, this cinematic masterpiece weaves together four haunting narratives, each more spine-tingling than the last. With a runtime of 3 hours and 3 minutes, audiences are taken on a mesmerizing journey through the supernatural. The stellar cast, including Michiyo Aratama, Misako Watanabe, Rentarô Mikuni, and Kenjiro Ishiyama, brings these ghostly tales to life in a way that garnered an impressive revenue of 13.2 million dollars. "Kwaidan" is a must-watch for those who dare to delve into the realm of the unknown and embrace the shivers that come with it.

title = An American Tail 
overview = A young mouse named Fievel and his family decide to migrate to America, a "land without cats," at the turn of the 20th century. But somehow, Fievel ends up in the New World alone and must fend off not only the felines he never thought he'd have to deal with again but also the loneliness of being away from home. 
cast = Phillip Glasser, Dom DeLuise, Nehemiah Persoff, Erica Yohn 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = Meet Fievel. In his search to find his family, he discovered America. 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 9.0 millions of dollars 
Director = Don Bluth 
Producer = Don Bluth 
date of release = the 21 of November 1986 
revenue = 84.5 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 
duration of the movie = 1h20 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Phillip Glasser, Dom DeLuise, Nehemiah Persoff, Erica Yohn 

In the heartwarming animated film "An American Tail," directed by Don Bluth, a young mouse named Fievel embarks on a journey with his family to America, a promised land free from cats, at the turn of the 20th century. However, Fievel finds himself separated from his loved ones upon arrival in the New World, facing not only the feline foes he hoped to leave behind but also the daunting loneliness of being far from home. Voiced by Phillip Glasser, Fievel's adventures are accompanied by a lovable cast including Dom DeLuise, Nehemiah Persoff, and Erica Yohn. As Fievel navigates his way through this new and unfamiliar land, he discovers the true essence of America. With a budget of 9.0 million dollars, the film was released on November 21, 1986, by Universal Pictures and went on to gross an impressive 84.5 million dollars at the box office. This heartwarming tale, told in English, runs for a duration of 1 hour and 20 minutes, capturing the essence of hope, family, and the pursuit of a better life. Don't miss out on joining Fievel on his unforgettable journey in "An American Tail." Meet Fievel. In his search to find his family, he discovered America. The production country is the United States of America.

title = Ground Control 
overview = An air-traffic controller quits after a plane crash but, years later, goes to help an airport that is in the path of a terrible storm. 
average note = 5.6 
duration of the movie = 1h38 
tagline = No Radar. No Contact. No Control. 
cast = Kiefer Sutherland, Kristy Swanson, Robert Sean Leonard, Kelly McGillis 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 26 of August 1998 
Director = Richard Howard 
budget = 0.5 millions of dollars 
revenue = 111.6 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Green Communications 
Producer = Talaat Captan 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 5.6 

In the thrilling movie "Ground Control," directed by Richard Howard and produced by Talaat Captan, we follow the story of an air-traffic controller who makes a life-changing decision to quit after a tragic plane crash. Years later, when an airport is threatened by a devastating storm, he must confront his past and step up to help. With a stellar cast including Kiefer Sutherland, Kristy Swanson, Robert Sean Leonard, and Kelly McGillis, the film keeps you on the edge of your seat for its 1 hour and 38-minute runtime. Set against the backdrop of intense aviation drama, the tagline "No Radar. No Contact. No Control." sets the tone for the high-stakes action. Released on August 26, 1998, in the original English language, "Ground Control" was produced with a budget of 0.5 million dollars but soared to success with a revenue of 111.6 million dollars. This gripping film, set in the United States of America and produced by Green Communications, is a must-watch for fans of intense thrillers. The average note for the movie is 5.6.

This gripping film, set in the United States of America and produced by Green Communications, is a must-watch for fans of intense thrillers. The average note for the movie is 5.6.

Years later, when an airport is threatened by a devastating storm, he must confront his past and step up to help. title = Tammy and the Millionaire 
overview = A bayou girl (Debbie Watson) and her kin (Frank McGrath, Denver Pyle) have run-ins with some rich folks. 
revenue = 149.6 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 1 of May 1967 
Producer = Dick Wesson 
budget = 157.3 millions of dollars 
average note = 0.0 
cast = Debbie Watson, Frank McGrath, Denver Pyle, George Furth 
tagline = Snooty Debutante! Wild Mountaineers! Uppity Millionaire! Tammy hilariously teaches them the facts of life..and love! 
Director = Leslie Goodwins 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h27 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 149.6 millions of dollars 

In the charming film "Tammy and the Millionaire," a spirited bayou girl, portrayed by Debbie Watson, finds herself entangled in humorous encounters with wealthy individuals alongside her family members, played by Frank McGrath and Denver Pyle. Set against the backdrop of the bayou, this delightful tale unfolds as Tammy navigates the clash between her down-to-earth upbringing and the extravagant lifestyles of the rich. With a stellar cast including George Furth, the movie, directed by Leslie Goodwins and produced by Dick Wesson, captures the essence of love and life lessons in a lighthearted manner. As Tammy imparts her wisdom to the snooty debutante, wild mountaineers, and uppity millionaire, audiences are treated to a heartwarming story that resonates with both humor and heart. Released on the 1st of May 1967 in the United States of America, "Tammy and the Millionaire" garnered a remarkable revenue of 149.6 million dollars, despite having a budget of 157.3 million dollars. With an average note of 0.0, and a runtime of 1 hour and 27 minutes, this film is a delightful blend of comedy, romance, and valuable life lessons. Don't miss out on this endearing classic that proves that sometimes, the richest lessons come from the most unexpected places.

title = Thirteen 
overview = Tracy is a normal 13-year-old trying to make it in school. After befriending the most popular girl at school, Evie, Tracy's world is turned upside down when Evie introduces her to a world of sex, drugs and cash. But it isn't long before Tracy's new world and attitude finally takes a toll on her, her family, and old friends. 
Producer = Michael London 
production compagnie = Fox Searchlight Pictures 
cast = Evan Rachel Wood, Nikki Reed, Vanessa Hudgens, Holly Hunter 
tagline = It's happening so fast. 
average note = 6.6 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 4.6 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 20 of August 2003 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 2.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Michael London 

In the 2003 film "Thirteen," produced by Michael London and released by Fox Searchlight Pictures, we follow the story of Tracy, a typical 13-year-old girl navigating the challenges of school. When she befriends the popular but troubled Evie, Tracy is exposed to a world of sex, drugs, and money that quickly consumes her. As Tracy's behavior spirals out of control, her relationships with her family and old friends are put to the test. Starring Evan Rachel Wood, Nikki Reed, Vanessa Hudgens, and Holly Hunter, this intense coming-of-age drama explores the dark side of adolescence. With a tagline that reads "It's happening so fast," the film captures the rapid descent into chaos that Tracy experiences. Despite receiving an average rating of 6.6, "Thirteen" managed to gross $4.6 million at the box office, surpassing its $2.0 million budget. Set in the United States and spoken in English, the movie was released on August 20, 2003.

In the 2003 film "Thirteen," produced by Michael London and released by Fox Searchlight Pictures, we follow the story of Tracy, a typical 13-year-old girl navigating the challenges of school. When she befriends the popular but troubled Evie, Tracy is exposed to a world of sex, drugs, and money that quickly consumes her. As Tracy's behavior spirals out of control, her relationships with her family and old friends are put to the test. Starring Evan Rachel Wood, Nikki Reed, Vanessa Hudgens, and Holly Hunter, this intense coming-of-age drama explores the dark side of adolescence. With a tagline that reads "It's happening so fast," the film captures the rapid descent into chaos that Tracy experiences. Despite receiving an average rating of 6.6, "Thirteen" managed to gross $4.6 million at the box office, surpassing its $2.0 million budget. Set in the United States and spoken in English, the movie was released on August 20, 2003.

title = Robin Hood 
overview = When soldier Robin happens upon the dying Robert of Loxley, he promises to return the man's sword to his family in Nottingham. There, he assumes Robert's identity; romances his widow, Marion; and draws the ire of the town's sheriff and King John's henchman, Godfrey. 
duration of the movie = 2h20 
average note = 6.2 
budget = 200.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 2h20 

In the action-packed film "Robin Hood," a soldier named Robin stumbles upon the dying Robert of Loxley and makes a promise to return the man's sword to his family in Nottingham. Taking on Robert's identity, Robin finds himself entangled in a web of romance with Robert's widow, Marion. However, his actions also attract the attention of the town's sheriff and King John's henchman, Godfrey, leading to a thrilling showdown. With a duration of 2 hours and 20 minutes, this movie captivates audiences with its daring escapades and heart-pounding adventures. Despite facing challenges, Robin Hood's courage and determination shine through, making this a must-watch film. With an average rating of 6.2, the movie showcases impressive performances and stunning visuals, all brought to life with a budget of 200 million dollars.

title = Harlequin 
overview = In this modern-day version of the Rasputin story, David Hemmings plays an up-and-coming senator, Nick Rast, whose young son is terminally ill with leukaemia. A mysterious faith healer, Gregory Wolfe (Robert Powell), appears and seems to cure the boy. Rast's wife Sandy (Carmen Duncan) falls in love with Wolfe, but the powerful interests behind Rast's career, represented by geriatric monster Doc Wheelan (Broderick Crawford) are less happy with events. 
cast = Robert Powell, David Hemmings, Carmen Duncan, Broderick Crawford 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Robert Powell, David Hemmings, Carmen Duncan, Broderick Crawford 

In the gripping drama "Harlequin," a promising senator named Nick Rast, portrayed by David Hemmings, faces a heartbreaking situation as his young son battles leukemia. When an enigmatic faith healer named Gregory Wolfe, played by Robert Powell, enters their lives and seemingly cures the boy, it sets off a chain of events that lead to unexpected consequences. As Rast's wife Sandy, portrayed by Carmen Duncan, finds herself drawn to Wolfe, tensions rise with the powerful forces backing Rast's political career, including the formidable Doc Wheelan, played by Broderick Crawford. In this modern-day version of the Rasputin story, David Hemmings plays an up-and-coming senator, Nick Rast, whose young son is terminally ill with leukemia. A mysterious faith healer, Gregory Wolfe (Robert Powell), appears and seems to cure the boy. Rast's wife Sandy (Carmen Duncan) falls in love with Wolfe, but the powerful interests behind Rast's career, represented by geriatric monster Doc Wheelan (Broderick Crawford) are less happy with events. With a modern twist on the Rasputin story, "Harlequin" delves into themes of faith, love, and the corrupting influence of power. The cast includes Robert Powell, David Hemmings, Carmen Duncan, and Broderick Crawford. 
 
 
TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']

['correct']
fact : tagline = How do you grow up when your parents haven't? 

In the coming-of-age film "As Cool as I Am," a bright teenage girl navigates the challenges of growing up in a small town, all while dealing with her self-absorbed parents who were teenagers themselves when she was born. With a tagline that asks, "How do you grow up when your parents haven't?" this English-language movie produced by Identity Films delves into the complexities of family dynamics and personal growth. Despite its budget of 238.2 million dollars, the film managed to gross an impressive 78.0 million dollars at the box office. With a runtime of 1 hour and 32 minutes, "As Cool as I Am" offers a heartfelt and relatable story that resonates with audiences of all ages.

title = Tension at Table Rock 
overview = When the owner of a stagecoach station is killed, a gunman takes his place. 
Director = Charles Marquis Warren 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h33 
revenue = 72.8 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.0 
production compagnie = RKO Radio Pictures 
Producer = Sam Wiesenthal 
date of release = the 3 of October 1956 
tagline = A man like Shane... the suspense of High Noon... 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 259.7 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Charles Marquis Warren 

In the classic Western film "Tension at Table Rock," directed by Charles Marquis Warren and released on October 3, 1956, viewers are taken on a thrilling journey to a stagecoach station where the owner is tragically killed. As tensions rise, a mysterious gunman steps in to take his place, leading to a series of suspenseful events that keep audiences on the edge of their seats. With a runtime of 1 hour and 33 minutes, the film, produced by Sam Wiesenthal for RKO Radio Pictures, unfolds in English, capturing the essence of the American frontier. Despite a budget of 259.7 million dollars, the movie went on to generate a revenue of 72.8 million dollars, showcasing its success at the box office. With an average rating of 7.0, "Tension at Table Rock" is a must-watch for fans of classic Westerns, offering a blend of action, drama, and intrigue. The tagline "A man like Shane... the suspense of High Noon..." perfectly encapsulates the gripping nature of this iconic film set in the United States of America.

title = Return to Paradise 
overview = Lewis, Sheriff and Tony are three friends vacationing in Malaysia. Sheriff and Tony eventually leave to pursue careers in New York, but Lewis stays behind to work with orangutans. Two years later, Sheriff and Tony learn that, because of their past actions, Lewis has been arrested for drug possession. With Lewis facing a death sentence, the friends are left with a difficult decision: return to Malaysia and split Lewis' sentence, or let him die. 
duration of the movie = 1h49 
revenue = 174.2 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h49 

In the gripping drama "Return to Paradise," three friends - Lewis, Sheriff, and Tony - embark on a vacation in Malaysia. While Sheriff and Tony move on to pursue careers in New York, Lewis remains in Malaysia to work with orangutans. However, their carefree days come to a halt when Lewis is arrested for drug possession two years later. Facing a death sentence, the friends are forced to make a tough choice: return to Malaysia and share Lewis' sentence or abandon him to his fate. With a runtime of 1 hour and 49 minutes, this emotionally charged film grossed an impressive $174.2 million at the box office.

['correct']
fact : revenue = 174.2 millions of dollars

With a runtime of 1 hour and 49 minutes, this emotionally charged film grossed an impressive $174.2 million at the box office.

title = Above the Law 
overview = Seagal is Nico Toscani, an Italian immigrant, American patriot, ex-CIA agent, aikido specialist, and unorthodox Chicago policeman. He is as committed to his job as he is to his personalized brand of justice: expert and thorough bone-crushing. 
Producer = Andrew Davis 
date of release = the 8 of April 1988 
budget = 7.5 millions of dollars 
cast = Steven Seagal, Pam Grier, Henry Silva, Sharon Stone 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = Hong Kong 
duration of the movie = 1h39 
tagline = He's a cop who believes no one is above the law. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Andrew Davis 

In "Above the Law," directed by Andrew Davis, Steven Seagal stars as Nico Toscani, an Italian immigrant, American patriot, ex-CIA agent, aikido specialist, and unorthodox Chicago policeman. Released on April 8, 1988, with a budget of 7.5 million dollars, the film features a stellar cast including Pam Grier, Henry Silva, and Sharon Stone. Set in Hong Kong, the movie is presented in its original English language and runs for 1 hour and 39 minutes. The tagline "He's a cop who believes no one is above the law" perfectly encapsulates Seagal's character's commitment to delivering bone-crushing justice.

['correct']
fact : date of release = the 8 of April 1988 

In "Above the Law," directed by Andrew Davis, Steven Seagal stars as Nico Toscani, an Italian immigrant, American patriot, ex-CIA agent, aikido specialist, and unorthodox Chicago policeman. Released on April 8, 1988, with a budget of 7.5 million dollars, the film features a stellar cast including Pam Grier, Henry Silva, and Sharon Stone. Set in Hong Kong, the movie is presented in its original English language and runs for 1 hour and 39 minutes. The tagline "He's a cop who believes no one is above the law" perfectly encapsulates Seagal's character's commitment to delivering bone-crushing justice. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 7.5 millions of dollars

title = Words and Music 
overview = Encomium to Larry Hart (1895-1943), seen through the fictive eyes of his song-writing partner, Richard Rodgers (1902-1979): from their first meeting, through lean years and their breakthrough, to their successes on Broadway, London, and Hollywood. We see the fruits of Hart and Rodgers' collaboration - elaborately staged numbers from their plays, characters' visits to night clubs, and impromptu performances at parties. We also see Larry's scattered approach to life, his failed love with Peggy McNeil, his unhappiness, and Richard's successful wooing of Dorothy Feiner. 
Director = Norman Taurog 
tagline = The BIGGEST musical! 
date of release = the 31 of December 1948 
average note = 6.6 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 165.4 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) 
Producer = Arthur Freed 
cast = Tom Drake, Mickey Rooney, Janet Leigh, Marshall Thompson 
duration of the movie = 2h00 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Norman Taurog 

In "Words and Music," directed by Norman Taurog and produced by Arthur Freed, audiences are taken on a journey through the legendary songwriting partnership of Larry Hart and Richard Rodgers. Through the eyes of Rodgers, portrayed by Tom Drake, we witness the highs and lows of their collaboration, from their humble beginnings to their monumental success on Broadway, in London, and in Hollywood. The film showcases elaborate musical numbers from their plays, lively visits to nightclubs, and spontaneous performances at parties. Amidst the creative triumphs, we also delve into Larry Hart's tumultuous personal life, including his failed romance with Peggy McNeil and his struggles with unhappiness. Meanwhile, Richard's pursuit of love with Dorothy Feiner, played by Janet Leigh, adds a romantic subplot to the narrative. With a star-studded cast including Mickey Rooney and Marshall Thompson, "Words and Music" is a celebration of friendship, creativity, and the enduring power of music. Don't miss out on experiencing the BIGGEST musical of its time, released on the 31st of December 1948, with an average rating of 6.6.

The movie had a budget of 165.4 million dollars and was produced by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM). The original language of the movie is English and it has a duration of 2 hours. The production company behind the film is Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM), and it was released in the United States of America.

title = My Own Private Idaho 
overview = In this loose adaptation of Shakespeare's "Henry IV," Mike Waters (River Phoenix) is a gay hustler afflicted with narcolepsy. Scott Favor (Keanu Reeves) is the rebellious son of a mayor. Together, the two travel from Portland, Oregon to Idaho and finally to the coast of Italy in a quest to find Mike's estranged mother. Along the way they turn tricks for money and drugs, eventually attracting the attention of a wealthy benefactor and sexual deviant. 
production compagnie = Fine Line Features 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Fine Line Features 

In the critically acclaimed film "My Own Private Idaho," a modern-day adaptation of Shakespeare's "Henry IV," we follow the journey of Mike Waters, a narcoleptic gay hustler portrayed by the talented River Phoenix. Alongside him is Scott Favor, played by Keanu Reeves, the rebellious son of a mayor. The duo embarks on a transformative trip from Portland, Oregon to Idaho, and later to the picturesque coast of Italy, all in pursuit of Mike's long-lost mother. As they navigate through their tumultuous lives, engaging in risky behavior to sustain themselves, they catch the eye of a wealthy benefactor with dark desires. Produced by Fine Line Features, this film delves into themes of identity, family, and the complexities of human connection.

['wrong']

Produced by Fine Line Features, this film delves into themes of identity, family, and the complexities of human connection.

fact : Producer = Laurie Parker 

In the critically acclaimed film "My Own Private Idaho," a modern-day adaptation of Shakespeare's "Henry IV," we follow the journey of Mike Waters, a narcoleptic gay hustler portrayed by the talented River Phoenix. Alongside him is Scott Favor, played by Keanu Reeves, the rebellious son of a mayor. The duo embarks on a transformative trip from Portland, Oregon to Idaho, and later to the picturesque coast of Italy, all in pursuit of Mike's long-lost mother. As they navigate through their tumultuous lives, engaging in risky behavior to sustain themselves, they catch the eye of a wealthy benefactor with dark desires. Produced by Fine Line Features, this film delves into themes of identity, family, and the complexities of human connection.

In the critically acclaimed film "My Own Private Idaho," a modern-day adaptation of Shakespeare's "Henry IV," we follow the journey of Mike Waters, a narcoleptic gay hustler portrayed by the talented River Phoenix. Alongside him is Scott Favor, played by Keanu Reeves, the rebellious son of a mayor. The duo embarks on a transformative trip from Portland, Oregon to Idaho, and later to the picturesque coast of Italy, all in pursuit of Mike's long-lost mother. As they navigate through their tumultuous lives, engaging in risky behavior to sustain themselves, they catch the eye of a wealthy benefactor with dark desires. Produced by Fine Line Features, this film delves into themes of identity, family, and the complexities of human connection. 
 
 

 
title = The Beautiful Beast 
overview = In a twist on the classic Beauty and the Beast tale, Isabelle is all beauty--on the outside. A glamour-queen socialite, she spends her days spoiling herself and spending money like it's going out of style. When Isabelle injures herself and gets lost in an isolated winter land, she stumbles on the solitude of Jeremy, a man hiding from both the world and his past. He's the first person to put Isabelle in her place, and Isabelle realizes she might be more beast than she wants to admit. Through Jeremy's influence, she begins to change--and fall in love. But will she revert to the beast and give up her chance at real love when she returns home? 

TN  -  TrueNegative

fact : budget = 70.3 millions of dollars 

title = The Beautiful Beast 
overview = In a twist on the classic Beauty and the Beast tale, Isabelle is all beauty--on the outside. A glamour-queen socialite, she spends her days spoiling herself and spending money like it's going out of style. When Isabelle injures herself and gets lost in an isolated winter land, she stumbles on the solitude of Jeremy, a man hiding from both the world and his past. He's the first person to put Isabelle in her place, and Isabelle realizes she might be more beast than she wants to admit. Through Jeremy's influence, she begins to change--and fall in love. But will she revert to the beast and give up her chance at real love when she returns home? 

In "The Beautiful Beast," a modern twist on the classic Beauty and the Beast tale unfolds as Isabelle, a glamorous socialite, finds herself lost in an isolated winter land after injuring herself. There, she encounters Jeremy, a man with a mysterious past who challenges her self-absorbed ways. As Isabelle begins to transform under Jeremy's influence, she also discovers the true meaning of love. However, the question remains - will she choose to embrace her inner beast or pursue a chance at genuine love when she returns home?

title = Case 39 
overview = In her many years as a social worker, Emily Jenkins believes she has seen it all, until she meets 10-year-old Lilith and the girl's cruel parents. Emily's worst fears are confirmed when the parents try to harm the child, and so Emily assumes custody of Lilith while she looks for a foster family. However, Emily soon finds that dark forces surround the seemingly innocent girl, and the more she tries to protect Lilith, the more horrors she encounters. 
date of release = the 13 of August 2009 
production compagnie = Paramount Vantage 
cast = Renée Zellweger, Jodelle Ferland, Ian McShane, Kerry O'Malley 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 27.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = Canada 
Director = Christian Alvart 
average note = 6.1 
revenue = 29.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 13 of August 2009 

In the psychological thriller "Case 39," released on the 13th of August 2009 by Paramount Vantage, social worker Emily Jenkins, played by Renée Zellweger, encounters a disturbing case unlike any other. After meeting 10-year-old Lilith and uncovering the cruelty of her parents, Emily takes custody of the girl in search of a safer environment. As she delves deeper into Lilith's life, portrayed by Jodelle Ferland, Emily realizes that sinister forces are at play. Directed by Christian Alvart and set in Canada, this English-language film with a budget of 27.0 million dollars explores the horrors that unfold as Emily tries to protect Lilith from the darkness that surrounds her. With a talented cast including Ian McShane and Kerry O'Malley, "Case 39" received an average rating of 6.1 and grossed 29.0 million dollars at the box office.

title = Monster High: Boo York, Boo York 
overview = The ghouls are taking a bite out of Boo York! The De Niles are hoping to meet their dynastic destiny and carve out a new empire, while Catty Noir is trying to find her music. Together the ghouls are taking Boo York by storm. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : cast = Cam Clarke, Erin Fitzgerald, Jonquil Goode, Todd Haberkorn 

In the thrilling movie "Monster High: Boo York, Boo York," the ghouls are sinking their fangs into the vibrant city of Boo York! As the De Niles set their sights on fulfilling their dynastic legacy and establishing a fresh empire, the talented Catty Noir embarks on a quest to rediscover her passion for music. United in their endeavors, the ghouls unleash their unique powers and personalities, captivating Boo York with their mesmerizing presence. Join them on this exhilarating journey as they navigate through challenges and triumphs, making their mark on the bustling cityscape.

Facts included in the description:
1. The ghouls are taking a bite out of Boo York.
2. The De Niles are hoping to meet their dynastic destiny and carve out a new empire.
3. Catty Noir is trying to find her music.
4. The ghouls are taking Boo York by storm.

In the thrilling movie "Monster High: Boo York, Boo York," the ghouls are sinking their fangs into the vibrant city of Boo York! As the De Niles set their sights on fulfilling their dynastic legacy and establishing a fresh empire, the talented Catty Noir embarks on a quest to rediscover her passion for music. United in their endeavors, the ghouls unleash their unique powers and personalities, captivating Boo York with their mesmerizing presence. Join them on this exhilarating journey as they navigate through challenges and triumphs, making their mark on the bustling cityscape.

Facts included in the description:
1. The ghouls are taking a bite out of Boo York.
2. The De Niles are hoping to meet their dynastic destiny and carve out a new empire.
3. Catty Noir is trying to find her music.
4. The ghouls are taking Boo York by storm.

title = Groupie 
overview = When a mysterious groupie joins legendary cursed band, "The Dark Knights", a series of unexplained murders derails their comeback tour. 
average note = 3.4 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 1 of January 2010 
Director = Mark L. Lester 
revenue = 32.9 millions of dollars 
budget = 123.6 millions of dollars 
cast = Taryn Manning, Hal Ozsan, Eric Roberts, Betsy Rue 
duration of the movie = 1h30 
Producer = Dana Dubovsky 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = American World Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 3.4 

In the thrilling movie "Groupie", directed by Mark L. Lester, a mysterious groupie becomes entangled with the legendary cursed band, "The Dark Knights". As the band embarks on their comeback tour, unexplained murders begin to occur, throwing their plans into chaos. Starring Taryn Manning, Hal Ozsan, Eric Roberts, and Betsy Rue, this English-language film was released on the 1st of January 2010. With a duration of 1 hour and 30 minutes, the movie garnered an average rating of 3.4. Produced by Dana Dubovsky, "Groupie" generated a revenue of 32.9 million dollars, despite having a budget of 123.6 million dollars. Set in the United States of America and produced by American World Pictures, this film is a must-watch for fans of mystery and suspense.

title = The Scopia Effect 
overview = Reincarnation goes horribly wrong releasing dark forces across time. Basia accesses parts of her mind that should never be tampered with. Past lives merge with present as her reality becomes distorted, she fights for her very existence. 
duration of the movie = 2h10 
Director = Christopher Butler 
production compagnie = Big Eye 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 2h10 

title = The Scopia Effect 
overview = Reincarnation goes horribly wrong releasing dark forces across time. Basia accesses parts of her mind that should never be tampered with. Past lives merge with present as her reality becomes distorted, she fights for her very existence. 
duration of the movie = 2h10 
Director = Christopher Butler 
production compagnie = Big Eye 

In "The Scopia Effect," directed by Christopher Butler and produced by Big Eye, viewers are taken on a thrilling journey where reincarnation takes a sinister turn. Basia finds herself in a terrifying situation as she delves into her past lives, only to unleash dark forces that transcend time. As she navigates through a distorted reality, merging past and present, Basia must fight for her survival against the malevolent entities she has awakened. With a runtime of 2 hours and 10 minutes, this mind-bending film explores the consequences of tampering with the deepest recesses of the mind, leaving audiences on the edge of their seats until the very end.

In "The Scopia Effect," directed by Christopher Butler and produced by Big Eye, viewers are taken on a thrilling journey where reincarnation takes a sinister turn. Basia finds herself in a terrifying situation as she delves into her past lives, only to unleash dark forces that transcend time. As she navigates through a distorted reality, merging past and present, Basia must fight for her survival against the malevolent entities she has awakened. With a runtime of 2 hours and 10 minutes, this mind-bending film explores the consequences of tampering with the deepest recesses of the mind, leaving audiences on the edge of their seats until the very end.

title = Eternal Summer 
overview = Three high school students experience the perks and pitfalls of love in director Leste Chen’s sensitive tale of friendship and yearning. 
average note = 5.1 
duration of the movie = 1h45 
Director = Leste Chen 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 5.1 

In "Eternal Summer," directed by Leste Chen, viewers are taken on a poignant journey through the lives of three high school students as they navigate the complexities of love, friendship, and yearning. Set against the backdrop of adolescence, this film beautifully captures both the joys and challenges that come with young love. With an average rating of 5.1, this 1 hour and 45-minute movie is a heartfelt exploration of the perks and pitfalls of relationships, making it a must-watch for those seeking a touching coming-of-age story.

title = The Scarlet Letter 
overview = Set in puritanical Boston in the mid 1600s, the story of seamstress Hester Prynne, who is outcast after she becomes pregnant by a respected reverend. She refuses to divulge the name of the father, is "convicted" of adultery and forced to wear a scarlet "A" until an Indian attack unites the Puritans and leads to a reevaluation of their laws and morals. 
average note = 5.5 
production compagnie = Hollywood Pictures 
Director = Roland Joffé 
cast = Demi Moore, Gary Oldman, Robert Duvall, Robert Prosky 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = When intimacy is forbidden and passion is a sin, love is the most defiant crime of all. 
revenue = 10.4 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 5.5 

The Scarlet Letter is a movie set in puritanical Boston in the mid 1600s. The story follows the life of seamstress Hester Prynne, who is ostracized after she becomes pregnant by a respected reverend. Despite facing condemnation for her actions, Hester refuses to reveal the identity of the father and is consequently "convicted" of adultery. As a result, she is forced to wear a scarlet letter "A" as a mark of shame. The narrative takes a turn when an Indian attack occurs, bringing the Puritan community together and prompting a reevaluation of their laws and morals.

The film is directed by Roland Joffé and features a talented cast including Demi Moore, Gary Oldman, Robert Duvall, and Robert Prosky. Produced by Hollywood Pictures, the movie is presented in English, with a tagline that encapsulates its central theme: "When intimacy is forbidden and passion is a sin, love is the most defiant crime of all." The Scarlet Letter received an average rating of 5.5 and generated a revenue of 10.4 million dollars, showcasing its impact on audiences. Through its exploration of forbidden love and societal judgment, the film challenges the norms of a society where passion is considered a transgression. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Hollywood Pictures

Despite facing condemnation for her actions, Hester refuses to reveal the identity of the father and is consequently "convicted" of adultery. As a result, she is forced to wear a scarlet letter "A" as a mark of shame. The narrative takes a turn when an Indian attack occurs, bringing the Puritan community together and prompting a reevaluation of their laws and morals.

The film is directed by Roland Joffé and features a talented cast including Demi Moore, Gary Oldman, Robert Duvall, and Robert Prosky. Produced by Hollywood Pictures, the movie is presented in English, with a tagline that encapsulates its central theme: "When intimacy is forbidden and passion is a sin, love is the most defiant crime of all." The Scarlet Letter received an average rating of 5.5 and generated a revenue of 10.4 million dollars, showcasing its impact on audiences. Through its exploration of forbidden love and societal judgment, the film challenges the norms of a society where passion is considered a transgression.

title = Being John Malkovich 
overview = Spike Jonze’s debut feature film is a love story mix of comedy and fantasy. The story is about an unsuccessful puppeteer named Craig, who one day at work finds a portal into the head of actor John Malkovich. The portal soon becomes a passion for anybody who enters it’s mad and controlling world of overtaking another human body. 
tagline = Ever wanted to be someone else? Now you can. 
cast = John Cusack, Cameron Diaz, Catherine Keener, Charlie Sheen 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 22.9 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 30 of September 1999 
Director = Spike Jonze 
Producer = Steve Golin 
budget = 13.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Gramercy Pictures 
average note = 7.3 
duration of the movie = 1h52 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Ever wanted to be someone else? Now you can. 

In the mind-bending film "Being John Malkovich," directed by Spike Jonze, audiences are taken on a wild ride through a mix of comedy and fantasy. The story follows the life of Craig, an unsuccessful puppeteer, who stumbles upon a mysterious portal at work that leads directly into the mind of the famous actor John Malkovich. As the portal becomes a fascination for those who enter it, they are thrust into a world of madness and control, where the desire to overtake another human body takes center stage. With a star-studded cast including John Cusack, Cameron Diaz, Catherine Keener, and Charlie Sheen, this United States production by Gramercy Pictures grossed 22.9 million dollars at the box office. Released on September 30, 1999, in English, the film received an average rating of 7.3 and runs for 1 hour and 52 minutes. The tagline "Ever wanted to be someone else? Now you can" perfectly encapsulates the surreal journey viewers are about to embark on. Spike Jonze served as the director, with Steve Golin as the producer. The budget for the film was 13.0 million dollars.

Now you can" perfectly encapsulates the surreal journey viewers are about to embark on. Spike Jonze served as the director, with Steve Golin as the producer. The budget for the film was 13.0 million dollars.

fact : duration of the movie = 1h52 

In the mind-bending film "Being John Malkovich," directed by Spike Jonze, audiences are taken on a wild ride through a mix of comedy and fantasy. The story follows the life of Craig, an unsuccessful puppeteer, who stumbles upon a mysterious portal at work that leads directly into the mind of the famous actor John Malkovich. As the portal becomes a fascination for those who enter it, they are thrust into a world of madness and control, where the desire to overtake another human body takes center stage. With a star-studded cast including John Cusack, Cameron Diaz, Catherine Keener, and Charlie Sheen, this United States production by Gramercy Pictures grossed 22.9 million dollars at the box office. Released on September 30, 1999, in English, the film received an average rating of 7.3 and runs for 1 hour and 52 minutes. The tagline "Ever wanted to be someone else? Now you can" perfectly encapsulates the surreal journey viewers are about to embark on. Spike Jonze served as the director, with Steve Golin as the producer. The budget for the film was 13.0 million dollars.
